commit_message:
Use self.configuration to support the multi-backend case

Use self.configuration instead of using FLAGS directly to make
the driver work in a multi backend environment.
And remove three repeated lines:en = out.split('\r\n')

Fixes bug: 1154125

Change-Id: I6e08706104eabb71677ec8583b9abb9711553504
(cherry picked from commit 7817d12439a4c86d3015ce8e6a74f72804fdfd24)

commit_message:
Fix typo in persona valid values

The 3PAR drivers have a persona extra spec that has a valid
values with a typo in it. The value '11 - VMWare' should be
"11 - VMware', note the lower case 'w'.

Fixes bug 1155781

Change-Id: I70ab255e1ec6a4b83437b072a7eb4fe11eafc710
(cherry picked from commit 0f353e794faac9f4a67d1628034d13507fc9785c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-22 03:58:59.000000000', 'message': 'Allow snapshot_delete for NFS/GlusterFS drivers

RemoteFsDriver should allow snapshot_delete, since snapshot_create
for NFS and GlusterFS volumes will create a snapshot in the error
state which cannot be deleted afterward.

snapshot_delete() should allow this to be removed rather than
throwing NotImplementedError.

Fixes bug: 1156686

Change-Id: I4307878fa97fbce5bd733a83fa172509e2fba8ce
(cherry picked from commit ea10f1b8291cb07962577699abe13648a4bdca58)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow snapshot_delete for NFS/GlusterFS drivers

RemoteFsDriver should allow snapshot_delete, since snapshot_create
for NFS and GlusterFS volumes will create a snapshot in the error
state which cannot be deleted afterward.

snapshot_delete() should allow this to be removed rather than
throwing NotImplementedError.

Fixes bug: 1156686

Change-Id: I4307878fa97fbce5bd733a83fa172509e2fba8ce
(cherry picked from commit ea10f1b8291cb07962577699abe13648a4bdca58)

commit_message:
remove cinder-rtstool because of rtslib dep

rtslib is AGPL, so cinder-rtstool is defacto AGPL by importing it.
Remove cinder-rtstool from the OpenStack repository.

Fixes bug #1157091

Change-Id: I30c9ee19d43107fa7f2e5e65d69049b8d69d2bdf
(cherry picked from commit b66c3361be2095186e19b0d44e49a8b2c48f7235)

subject: Enhance put_object to inform when chunk is ignored
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-05 17:12:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23577/1/check/gate-python-swiftclient-pep8/205 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23577/1/check/gate-python-swiftclient-docs/156 : SUCCESS

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-05 22:41:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I like the warning when I pass a non-file-like object and a chunk_size parameter, because then it's telling me what I'm doing wrong.

I don't like the warning when I pass a non-file-like object but I do not pass a chunk_size parameter. I should be able to pass in a string to put_object() without getting a warning.

To clarify, I want this behavior:

    put_object(url, contents=filelike, chunk_size=32768)    # no warnings.

    put_object(url, contents=a_string)   # no warnings (CURRENTLY BROKEN)

    put_object(url, contents=a_string, chunk_size=32768)   # warning!


I like the direction this change is going, but the spurious warning needs to be addressed."}, {'account_id': 5499, 'date': '2013-03-06 15:35:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-06 15:35:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Enhance put_object to inform when chunk is ignored

Changed documentation for chunk_size parameter to indicate
that it can be used only with file like objects.

Also added a UserWarning when using a string contents to inform
that chunk_size will be ignored.

Added a unit test to check whether the warning is working
correctly.

Fixes: bug #1147232
Change-Id: I618ec45520ba81905ce2ead4d61f192d21ae3489

commit_message:
Add a dereference option for ldap

This allows proper dereferencing of aliased objects in an LDAP tree.

Fixes Bug #1153786

Change-Id: Ia09a99b7bca1ab055eb0c6dfa34138beca15bff0

commit_message:
Try to get rid of the "events" & "raw events" naming in the code.

Rather use the term "samples" as having both is confusing.
Note: this does *not* change the API, just the terminology in the code.

bug 1104492
Signed-off-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If8cf89db60b52815db8e0acbf466400d0e9238c6

commit_message:
Add tests which verify quota behaviour

    Adds a new file containing 3 tests which perform a simple
    quota check for each of network, subnet, and port. Each test loops
    creating a [network,subnet,port] until either the max permitted number
    of iterations is reached, or a quota exceeded exception is hit.
    For the test to pass, the quota exceeded exception must be hit.
    Modified tempest.conf.sample to enable larger subnets which permit

    Implements: blueprint quantum-quota-basic-tests quota tests
    Change-Id: I57336acd038cb70b6e9d8025b9c9e01d72475768

Change-Id: I4b28fdefb3e839ce9af8999dbcc395832c3c13b5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-13 10:38:19.000000000', 'message': "Fix: NovaException's message variable should be private

Different exceptions define message as a parameterized string that
cannot be used directly. The complete message with variables replaced
with their real values are only available through the use of str() or
unicode() on the exception class itself.

As such, NovaException's message variable should be renamed _message
to indicate that it is private.

Resolves bug 1154522.

Change-Id: Ibda79de0ac2f94b003fded59c943edb223aeffb6
"}, {'created': '2013-03-14 12:18:14.000000000', 'message': "Fix: NovaException's message variable should be private

commit_message:
Fix: Renaming NovaException's message to msg_template

Different exceptions define message as a parameterized string that
cannot be used directly. The complete message with variables replaced
with their real values are only available through the use of str() or
unicode() on the raised exception itself.

As such, NovaException's message variable should be renamed to
indicate that it is a template that should not be used to print out
the exception message.

Resolves bug 1154522.

Change-Id: Ibda79de0ac2f94b003fded59c943edb223aeffb6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-27 00:38:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add DBDuplicateEntry exception for unique constraint violations

Unique constraint violation is wrapped by IntegrityError in SqlAlchemy.
SqlAlchemy doesn't unify errors from different DBs so we must do this in nova.
Also in some tables (for example instance_types) there are more than one unique
constraint. This means we should get names of columns, which values violate
unique constraint, from error message.

Unique constraint violations messages are different for different DB backedns:

1) sqlite:
    1 column - (IntegrityError) column c1 is not unique
    N columns - (IntegrityError) column c1, c2, ..., N are not unique

2) postgres:
    1 column - (IntegrityError) duplicate key value violates unique
                   constraint "users_c1_key"
    N columns - (IntegrityError) duplicate key value violates unique
                   constraint "name_of_our_constraint"

3) mysql:
    1 column - (IntegrityError) (1062, "Duplicate entry 'value_of_c1' for key
                   'c1'")
    N columns - (IntegrityError) (1062, "Duplicate entry 'values joined
                   with -' for key 'name_of_our_constraint'")

There is no information about table and columns in `N columns` messages for
mysql and postgres. So we should make name convention for UniqueConstraints
name: "uniq_c1_x_c2_x_c3" means that columns c1, c2, c3 are in
UniqueConstraint.
Also there is another way to get columns name from unique constraint:
    1) Get table name.
    2) Load table = Table(table_name, meta, autoload=True).
    3) Find unique constraint that is in table.constraints by name.
    4) Get columns names from unique constraint object.
But I think that it is a bad approach because:
    1) We must do table autoload in exception handling
    2) There is no easy way to get table name in wrap_db_error() method.

Remove Duplicate exception handling from models.save() method.

Add new DBDuplicateEntry exception to exceptions module.

Add new wrapper in sqlalchemy get_session() for handling Integrity Error.

blueprint db-unique-keys

Fixes bug 1067683

Change-Id: Ic8fd8e0613f10d06c1d7d90f76a436099e8bfef2
(cherry picked from commit 8835866fdda46220f1361716ef6a4fb4afa6c918)

commit_message:
Add DBDuplicateEntry exception for unique constraint violations

Unique constraint violation is wrapped by IntegrityError in SqlAlchemy.
SqlAlchemy doesn't unify errors from different DBs so we must do this in nova.
Also in some tables (for example instance_types) there are more than one unique
constraint. This means we should get names of columns, which values violate
unique constraint, from error message.

Unique constraint violations messages are different for different DB backedns:

1) sqlite:
    1 column - (IntegrityError) column c1 is not unique
    N columns - (IntegrityError) column c1, c2, ..., N are not unique

2) postgres:
    1 column - (IntegrityError) duplicate key value violates unique
                   constraint "users_c1_key"
    N columns - (IntegrityError) duplicate key value violates unique
                   constraint "name_of_our_constraint"

3) mysql:
    1 column - (IntegrityError) (1062, "Duplicate entry 'value_of_c1' for key
                   'c1'")
    N columns - (IntegrityError) (1062, "Duplicate entry 'values joined
                   with -' for key 'name_of_our_constraint'")

There is no information about table and columns in `N columns` messages for
mysql and postgres. So we should make name convention for UniqueConstraints
name: "uniq_c1_x_c2_x_c3" means that columns c1, c2, c3 are in
UniqueConstraint.
Also there is another way to get columns name from unique constraint:
    1) Get table name.
    2) Load table = Table(table_name, meta, autoload=True).
    3) Find unique constraint that is in table.constraints by name.
    4) Get columns names from unique constraint object.
But I think that it is a bad approach because:
    1) We must do table autoload in exception handling
    2) There is no easy way to get table name in wrap_db_error() method.

Remove Duplicate exception handling from models.save() method.

Add new DBDuplicateEntry exception to exceptions module.

Add new wrapper in sqlalchemy get_session() for handling Integrity Error.

blueprint db-unique-keys

Fixes bug 1067683

Change-Id: Ic8fd8e0613f10d06c1d7d90f76a436099e8bfef2
(cherry picked from commit 8835866fdda46220f1361716ef6a4fb4afa6c918)

for bugs that have been marked as fixed. However, the XML client class was

commit_message:
Remove skips in volume types tests.

This commit removes the skips from test_volume_types_extra_specs_negative
for bugs that have been marked as fixed. However, the XML client class was
not written to accept the bad input for the negative tests. So the XML
client is modified to accept this input. Additionally, the skip in
test_volume_types_negative.py was removed as well.

Change-Id: I45090c29a4115c205b656777e57a940a7de7dbf5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-20 04:01:32.000000000', 'message': 'Updates to OSAPI sizelimit middleware.

Updates the OSAPI sizelimit middleware so that we use avoid calling
len on a request body which could cause a really large request
to get buffered into memory.

Also updates the middleware to return HTTP 413 which is a more
correct error code in this case (previously it returned just 400).

Fixes LP Bug #1131857.

Change-Id: Iff6cb0c24bc21e5a1d5dd4cf29acb0b4ee221708
'}]
commit_message:
Updates to OSAPI sizelimit middleware.

Updates the OSAPI sizelimit middleware so that we use avoid calling
len on a request body which could cause a really large request
to get buffered into memory.

Also updates the middleware to return HTTP 413 which is a more
correct error code in this case (previously it returned just 400).

Fixes LP Bug #1131857.

Change-Id: Iff6cb0c24bc21e5a1d5dd4cf29acb0b4ee221708

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-22 00:51:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix race condition in dhcp agent

This patch fixes a race condition that can happen in the dhcp agent when
a subnet is created and then a host route is then immediately added to that
subnet following a subnet.update.end notification. The race condition occurs
in refresh_dhcp_helper() where self.enable_dhcp_helper() gets called twice
since the first call had not completed self.cache.put(network). This same race
condition can also occur in the other events so lockutils.synchronized() is
added to synchronize those code segments as well.

Fixes bug 1155748

Change-Id: I2ff52adc3dfebddd6d9c15d5dc79aa65be107179
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition in dhcp agent

This patch fixes a race condition that can happen in the dhcp agent when
a subnet is created and then a host route is then immediately added to that
subnet following a subnet.update.end notification. The race condition occurs
in refresh_dhcp_helper() where self.enable_dhcp_helper() gets called twice
since the first call had not completed self.cache.put(network). This same race
condition can also occur in the other events so lockutils.synchronized() is
added to synchronize those code segments as well.

Fixes bug 1155748

Change-Id: I2ff52adc3dfebddd6d9c15d5dc79aa65be107179

commit_message:
Fix race condition in dhcp agent

This patch fixes a race condition that can happen in the dhcp agent when
a subnet is created and then a host route is then immediately added to that
subnet following a subnet.update.end notification. The race condition occurs
in refresh_dhcp_helper() where self.enable_dhcp_helper() gets called twice
since the first call had not completed self.cache.put(network). This same race
condition can also occur in the other events so lockutils.synchronized() is
added to synchronize those code segments as well.

Fixes bug 1155748

Change-Id: I2ff52adc3dfebddd6d9c15d5dc79aa65be107179

commit_message:
Make nova.virt.fake.FakeDriver useable in integration testing

With this change nova.virt.fake.FakeDriver can be used for scale testing
using devstack. By setting 'compute_driver = nova.virt.fake.FakeDriver'
in nova.conf and disabiling quota and other limits, we can load up nova
to think it is running 1000's of instances.  This particular scenario is
analagous to how the baremetal driver will work (one machine managing
100's to 1000's of instances).

Make nova.virt.fake.FakeDriver use CONF.host for hostname.

Change-Id: I731ca2968176b4e39dd2fe7fc99f479cc568398b

commit_message:
Add caching for ec2 mapping ids.

Requests to map ec2 ids can be slow when there are a large number
of instances. These shouldn't ever change so cache them in memory
for a week. The one week timeout is simply to prevent memory from
growing uncontrollably.

Fixes bug 1157437

Change-Id: I3f1c68959a933a7aaa50f122c34a716264c8722d

commit_message:
Remove inheritance of More action on first action

More indicator in the action dropdown should not inherit the class
of the first action. Any custom behavior attached to the first action
will also be inherited by More.

Example: If the first action had "btn-danger", the More button become
red too. This might give the user the impression that More is also
a dangerous operation.

Fixes bug 1158419

Change-Id: Ic0da20c4322720f0185d31da7b1687ece1d2d249

'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2013-02-22 23:49:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-24 00:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

do we somewhere need to check if we are running in pre-python 2.6 and log a warning or throw an error that we do not support that env?'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-24 00:22:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-02-24 18:57:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

IIRC, anyjson provides a significant benefit for the rpc code.

The kombu library uses anyjson for marshaling.  By setting up anyjson to use dumps() from jsonutils, we ensure that we can automatically fix serialization issues with to_primitive() instead of getting failures.  This is why there have been a number of serialization bugs that only manifested with using impl_qpid or impl_zmq.

Once Havana opens up, there will be some rpc changes going in (rpc message envelope getting enabled, code is there now, just disabled) where messages will get json serialized using jsonutils before going down to the driver, so this kombu benefit will become moot.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-02-25 17:38:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Davanum:

As far as I know, we do not warn on a non py26/py27 environment. I don't have strong feelings for or against adding a warning somewhere.


Russell:

I'm not a fan of patching kombu like that - which I'm sure you can understand. Can we file a bug in oslo so that information is at least known?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-02-25 17:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Russell:

It may not be necessary to file a bug if the problem simply goes away.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-02-26 08:46:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Well, we're not patching kombu ... it's already using anyjson, and we're registering our json handling with anyjson, right?

The main point is that removing this will expose users of impl_kombu to a class of bugs that previously only affected the other rpc drivers."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-02-26 12:07:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It sounds like python 2.6 support is not the only thing we get from anyjson."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-02-26 15:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Doug: we have python2.6 support *without* anyjson. This is only needed for python2.5 and earlier'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-02-26 15:45:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Russell:

It's unclear which specific transport we use in kombu, but as fas as I can tell the amqplib and zmq don't use json as a message serialization format at all. Can you verify that?"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-02-26 17:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

OK, well, my point was that Russell is saying we benefit from anyjson for something other than a specific version of Python.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-03-01 01:55:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Looking at the latest kombu code and impl_kombu currently in nova ... when we call kombu.messaging.Producer.publish(), we rely on default encoding:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/openstack/common/rpc/impl_kombu.py#L316

kombu.messaging.Producer.publish() gets down to here:

    https://github.com/celery/kombu/blob/master/kombu/messaging.py#L237

which then goes over to kombu.serialization to encode the message body.  The default serialization method there is 'json', which uses anyjson.

    https://github.com/celery/kombu/blob/master/kombu/serialization.py#L284

    https://github.com/celery/kombu/blob/master/kombu/serialization.py#L369"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-01 11:01:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I  buy Russell's rationale for why we need anyjson now ... but I'd like a bug which tracks the removal of it when the need for it goes away with the marshalling changes Russell talks about

As for bug #1026062 - is the alternate fix to just require >=0.3.1 across all projects?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-09 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-09 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-03-21 22:48:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This can be restored and merged after:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25067/'}]

anyjson is only needed for pre-python2.6 environments which

Fixes bug 1026062

Change-Id: I17e351cffa07145d41ecc96fc403e5242ced893b

commit_message:
Remove anyjson compat

anyjson is only needed for pre-python2.6 environments which
we explicitly do not support. Let's remove it to alleviate
the headache.

Fixes bug 1026062

Change-Id: I17e351cffa07145d41ecc96fc403e5242ced893b

Allow for prettytable 0.7.x as well

Relax requirements to >= 0.6, < 0.8, as 0.7.x seems to
work as well. Added testcase to ensure this.

commit_message:
Trapping KeyboardInterrupt sooner.

Currently a KeyboardInterrupt can be triggered by the user while the
client is communicating with keystone.  This patch moves the trap
higher up in the stack.

Fixes bug: 1157905

Change-Id: I16889c2d97bc4694ab27c863c62c27333e264b60

commit_message:
nova-manage vm list fails looking 'instance_type'

The recent set of changes to remove the join on instance_types and get
data from instance_system_metadata missed out the use in
"nova-manage vm list"

fixes bug:  #1158352

Change-Id: I5b06a4fef34331abe40e7429b3abda47070bcbbc

commit_message:
Adds an openstack api extension to manage spare servers.

WORK IN PROGRESS - comments on the api methods much appreciated

Host servers can be labeled 'spare' which stops new VMs going on them.

Then later if the server is needed for an emergeny evacuation or chassis
swap it will be ready to go.

DocImpact
Adds feature from bug #1154790

Change-Id: Id463fff842c1c796977faf36fe4c2f00c8d2b7aa

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-21 19:21:36.000000000', 'message': 'Make versions aware of enabled pipelines.

Updates to make our versions controller a bit smarter so
that it only returns information on API versions which are
actually running.

With these changes a user can disable the v2.0 or v3 API
versions in their pipeline, restart keystone, and then have
versions return information only for the versions which
are actually running.

This is important because auth_token now uses info from the
keystone versions controller (in some cases) to dynamically
select an API version.

Fixes LP Bug #1158470.
Change-Id: I0fa8a82f08e7247c44fb7f4ff8dbb7d4ad58b9cc
'}]
commit_message:
Make versions aware of enabled pipelines.

Updates to make our versions controller a bit smarter so
that it only returns information on API versions which are
actually running.

With these changes a user can disable the v2.0 or v3 API
versions in their pipeline, restart keystone, and then have
versions return information only for the versions which
are actually running.

This is important because auth_token now uses info from the
keystone versions controller (in some cases) to dynamically
select an API version.

Fixes LP Bug #1158470.
Change-Id: I0fa8a82f08e7247c44fb7f4ff8dbb7d4ad58b9cc

subject: Add extra-specs support for volume-type
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-09 06:16:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23981/1/check/gate-python-openstackclient-pep8/272 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23981/1/check/gate-python-openstackclient-docs/197 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/23981/1/check/gate-python-openstackclient-python27/269 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-03-09 06:47:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I'm pondering the set/unset model where in other places we use options rather than a second positional argument.  That would be a required change if changing the volume type name is possible.

Also, I think we're going to need to qualify 'type'.  It's too general and likely to be used in other APIs also.  'volume-type' or 'voltype' or 'vol-type'?  nova cli uses secgroup to shorten security-group.  I don't think we've set an OSC precedent yet?"}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-03-09 18:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-03-10 03:57:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-10 04:02:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23981/2/check/gate-python-openstackclient-pep8/276 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23981/2/check/gate-python-openstackclient-docs/201 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23981/2/check/gate-python-openstackclient-python26/269 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23981/2/check/gate-python-openstackclient-python27/273 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-03-10 04:12:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@dtroyer, 

Regarding your first comment; yes, I noticed the set/unset model doesn't fit perfectly in the case where meta-data is used, because of the needed second positional argument. The scenario you described will happen when we try to update the metadata for a 'volume' object, since it can update metadata/name and description.

I'm wondering if we want to reserve set/unset for metadata, and maybe use edit/update as the 'verb' for tasks like updating name/description... but that seems like an awful lot of work. 

regarding your second comment; I agree, that 'type' is too generic; and AFAIK, we don't have a standard in OSC thus far, so I'm okay with either, vol-type or volume-type (ones with hyphens) seem best, not a big fan of voltype - that split second of ambiguity when reading it bugs me."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-03-15 19:20:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

set/unset is what it is...

but let's go ahead with 'volume-type' rather than just 'type'.  We use it elsewhere, like as an option in the 'create volume' command."}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-03-19 19:28:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-03-21 15:12:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-21 15:17:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Just noticed there is an option in cinder for a command called
extra-specs-list, only relates to volume-types, to list the
meta-data key/value pair. Added that functionality.
Also made minor changes so delete/set/unset can be called by name.

Change-Id: If534ccd1d8a3abc6d235c60ec9a964b88e3fa66d
'}]
commit_message:
Add extra-specs support for volume-type

changed to volume-type
changed command to --long, added a formatter for key=value
Just noticed there is an option in cinder for a command called
extra-specs-list, only relates to volume-types, to list the
meta-data key/value pair. Added that functionality.
Also made minor changes so delete/set/unset can be called by name.

Change-Id: If534ccd1d8a3abc6d235c60ec9a964b88e3fa66d

commit_message:
Add service cleanup handler for test_list_services.

It is not necessary to check the status of deletes again since that is
checked in the other test.

Fixes bug #1156640.

Change-Id: Id97390c69133e60cab7d93924e9913624a7449ad

But I will be doing the changes you have mentioned in the subsequent(different) commit. Is it ok?'}, {'account_id': 2976, 'date': '2013-03-19 12:35:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-03-19 12:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-03-19 18:20:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So this looks fine to me, but making these updates one test method at a time just seems crazy to me. If the same problem is multiple places in the same file (like it is here) then IMO it is better to fix it in one commit. Just change the commit message to say you're updating the try/except blocks to assertRaises in the file.

I can understand wanting to split up commits into small consumable chunks, but in this case you're just making more review effort by splitting up the patches too much. It's a different matter if the changes are completely different or in different tests. See:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages#Structural_split_of_changes

for examples on when it is good to split changes up into multiple commits.

Once you update the try/except blocks for the other tests in this file, you've got my +2 for this patch."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-03-20 00:53:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

commit_message:
Updating the try/except blocks to assertRaises.

Tests Modified:
test_get_metadata_of_alt_account_image_fails
test_delete_metadata_of_alt_account_server_fails
test_delete_metadata_of_alt_account_image_fails

Modifications:
As per new Tempest style guidelines, convert "try/expect/else"
statements into "assertRaises".

In order to ensure that other tests remain unaffected
because of this change, replace "finally" with "addCleanup".

Parially implements Blueprint update-expected-exception-tests.

Change-Id: Iac2a911ee6f812e18f41e66ac6d7fd648ce2f1fa

commit_message:
Fix bugs in bulk and slo and small doc change.

Added 411 responses in bulk and slo when needed.

Make X-Static-Large-Object an illegal header with slo installed- somehow
that got lost with some refactor I did.

I will +2 this once you confirm which versions of LDAP servers you have tested this against and the degree to which you were successful."}, {'account_id': 7045, 'date': '2013-03-18 16:50:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I tested with OpenLDAP 2.4.33, the LDIF in the added test LiveLDAPIdentity.test_ldap_dereferencing may be openldap specific. This is only because the RFC is still a draft for aliased objects [1], but seems that OpenLDAP is following the draft. 

Exposing the dereferencing support in the python LDAP library allows the server to reply with references to other objects and the client to follow those references. The bug report associated with this review explains a fairly good use case.

[1] http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-byrne-ldap-alias-00'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-03-18 16:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-03-19 20:20:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

next question, why wouldn't Keystone *always* dereference aliases? The only reason to not dereference aliases is if you want to manipulate an alias entry, and Keystone has no reason to do that."}, {'account_id': 7045, 'date': '2013-03-19 20:22:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Good point, we could set it to always as the default. I simply went with the existing default setting.'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-03-19 20:40:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (3 inline comments)

commit_message:
Add a dereference option for ldap

This allows proper dereferencing of aliased objects in an LDAP tree.

Fixes Bug #1153786

Change-Id: Ia09a99b7bca1ab055eb0c6dfa34138beca15bff0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-21 16:19:05.000000000', 'message': "Remove detailed-errors from setup.cfg.

detailed-errors does not provide us any value in our use of runs,
and it actually breaks now that we're using standard unittest
protocol and testtools.

Change-Id: Ie5a36eaf022e3f3d47904aad0ba2efdfc0d85b34
"}]
commit_message:
Remove detailed-errors from setup.cfg.

detailed-errors does not provide us any value in our use of runs,
and it actually breaks now that we're using standard unittest
protocol and testtools.

Change-Id: Ie5a36eaf022e3f3d47904aad0ba2efdfc0d85b34

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-21 17:55:04.000000000', 'message': 'Extend param2id() to work with uuids

Add uuid support to param2id() to allow commands including
cinder-manage volume delete to work with uuid style volumd ids

Fixes bug #1158409

Change-Id: I04444b16bcf458a006cc7941a6c5d16bd80597af
'}]
commit_message:
Extend param2id() to work with uuids

Add uuid support to param2id() to allow commands including
cinder-manage volume delete to work with uuid style volumd ids

Fixes bug #1158409

Change-Id: I04444b16bcf458a006cc7941a6c5d16bd80597af

using the right format. Missing two colons.

Change-Id: Ie23007a0da498373fbfb137c7edb3d80813c6ba5
Fixes: bug #1158310
'}]
commit_message:
instruction command was not documented in right format.

Instructions for a Multiple Server Swift Installation (Ubuntu) doc
for creating /var/run/swift and changing owner command were not
using the right format. Missing two colons.

Change-Id: Ie23007a0da498373fbfb137c7edb3d80813c6ba5
Fixes: bug #1158310

commit_message:
API extension for accessing instance_actions

Adds a new API extension for accessing the recorded actions on an
instance.  Usage is documented with api samples.

Blueprint instance-actions

Change-Id: I1e32b492520d28eb97b4d395a6118ace38f438bc

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-03-21 17:03:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I am able to reproduce the deadlock in the NVP plugin.
It occurs when DB intensive operations are performed; in our tests it affects only the 'metadata access network' feature, where we add a network, a subnet, and a router interface when the 1st router interface is added to the router.

Experimental analysis suggests the deadlock occurs in 13% of cases. (it happened 13 times out of 100).

db pooling solves the issue. If we remove it I will work on an alternative strategy that avoids the deadlock."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-03-21 17:03:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This will cause a reopen of https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1086173

Among the two problems, I'm not sure what's worse."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-03-21 17:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

There are some issues with the OSLO code - mainly the configuration varaibles. That is, we use a [DATABASE] section and in OSLO they are in the [DEFAULT] section. If we could make an OSLO fix to support our code then I would be in favor of moving the OSLO code.
This does not solve the issue that Salavatore has mentioned.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-03-21 17:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-03-21 17:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

IMO, we should use Oslo code.
Oslo new code looks also fixes the bug in proper way.
so, how about remove sql_dbpool in this commit, and import olso code in some release?'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-03-21 17:03:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Mark

When our QA team test quantum with many concurrent CI test, this bug happened. Some test failed with this deadlock by false positive.

I'm not sure how to reproduce this with small step, because this is timing issue.
If we add sleep code in the transaction, the bug may reproduced."}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-03-21 17:03:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Gary,
so oslo fix don't fix locking problem?"}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-03-21 17:03:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've commented on the bug report which is actually masking a different bug.
  
The referenced bug and what we're trying to accomplish here are two different items and should be two different bugs if we going to consider keeping pooling.

We only added pooling support in G2 and it has always been defaulted to off (even in devstack).  I looked at the original bug that Salvatore referenced, but that report lacks any method to reproduce the deadlock.

Most folks have been running with pooling turned off, has anyone experienced a deadlock like Nachi described?  Or has the scale been too small to trigger the deadlock?"}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-03-21 17:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-03-21 17:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

A workaround for the problem is being set at https://review.openstack.org/25024'}]

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-19 22:31:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/24851/1/check/gate-oslo.config-pyflakes/4 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24851/1/check/gate-oslo.config-docs/6 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/24851/1/check/gate-oslo.config-python26/6 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24851/1/check/gate-oslo.config-python27/6 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-19 22:31:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

markmc, so --debug and --nodebug would have no use if the debug flag is set in the config file? seems like before the new cfg, folks were able to override things set in the conf file from the command line...no?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-19 22:56:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm pretty sure that "config files override the CLI" was the accepted behaviour before cfg

Maybe nova-manage was different from the services for some reason, but I'm not even convinced of that

I suspect it's more a case of something changed so that nova-manage gets debug spew, unrelated to cfg

Looking at e.g. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/2142/2/glance/common/config.py

  # If either the CLI option or the conf value		
  # is True, we set to True		
  debug = options.get('debug') or \		
            get_option(conf, 'debug', type='bool', default=False)

if you set debug in the config file, there was no way of overriding it on the CLI

Actually, I see in nova the behaviour was that running

  $> nova-manage --nodebug

was equivalent to running

  $> nova-manage --flagfile=/etc/nova/nova.conf --nodebug

(i.e. the --flagfile arg was inserted first)

and gflags translated that into

  $> nova-manage --debug --nodebug

(i.e. it took the contents of nova.conf and stuffed it into the command line)

So, yeah - the semantics of gflags vs cfg are different - but we've been using cfg since Essex ...

Something else must have changed to cause people to be filing Critical bugs about nova-manage debug spew at Grizzly RC time ...'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-19 23:07:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

lgtm. thanks for the background and analysis'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-03-19 23:23:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Well it looks like the ship has sailed, but I actually would expect cli args to override the config file value.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-20 06:07:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Vish - not in the case where the CLI args are in an init script (think nova-api) and you want to override them in the config file.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-21 16:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Approved

just enforces what we have defined as the "correct" behavior, so merging this.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-21 16:55:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-21 16:56:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/24851/1/gate/gate-oslo.config-docs/7 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24851/1/gate/gate-oslo.config-pep8/7 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24851/1/gate/gate-oslo.config-python26/7 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24851/1/gate/gate-oslo.config-python27/7 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-21 16:56:41.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-19 22:15:48.000000000', 'message': 'Improve test cases for boolean values

In I6a3ef892ac54389d30d2e9e25b9ad8047d4926ec we see some confusion about
the order which CLI values vs config files values should be applied.

The documented semantics is that values in config files override any
values specified on the command line.

Improve the "bool value override" tests to more explicitly test the
cases of a config file overriding a CLI bool, a config file overriding
an inverse CLI bool and a config file overriding a previous config file
bool. The proposed patch would have broken these tests.

Change-Id: I133c43d2d9121c98407d42d6cab8a1ecb2ff450e
'}]
commit_message:
Improve test cases for boolean values

In I6a3ef892ac54389d30d2e9e25b9ad8047d4926ec we see some confusion about
the order which CLI values vs config files values should be applied.

The documented semantics is that values in config files override any
values specified on the command line.

Improve the "bool value override" tests to more explicitly test the
cases of a config file overriding a CLI bool, a config file overriding
an inverse CLI bool and a config file overriding a previous config file
bool. The proposed patch would have broken these tests.

Change-Id: I133c43d2d9121c98407d42d6cab8a1ecb2ff450e

commit_message:
Bootstrap now dynamically imports storage and transport modules

When the Bootstrap is instantiated, it is passed a configuration
file. The [drivers] section of the configuration file is read
and the specified storage and transport modules are imported and
instantiated.

Implements: blueprint bootstrap-dynamic

Change-Id: I47cd6f529afdbc93fca53f3298b4bfdbf717184c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-20 16:49:31.000000000', 'message': 'Change type of ssh_port option from Str to Int

The type of CONF option virtual_power_ssh_port was incorrectly defaulted
to Str. This can cause Paramiko to raise when casting to %d.

Fixes bug 1157824.

Change-Id: I30ddd1ff0da45f8392085249f1bd2a539b201a7e
'}]
commit_message:
Change type of ssh_port option from Str to Int

The type of CONF option virtual_power_ssh_port was incorrectly defaulted
to Str. This can cause Paramiko to raise when casting to %d.

Fixes bug 1157824.

Change-Id: I30ddd1ff0da45f8392085249f1bd2a539b201a7e

commit_message:
Fix for attempted COPY of objects gt MAX_FILE_SIZE

If X-Copy-From is a manifest object, it can be bigger than MAX_FILE_SIZE.
Currently this fails with 503. It should be 413.

Bug #1158279

Change-Id: I7ec16088046c84e42d5be9c865e1338eb07845b6

Thanks Matthew. I also thought the list() behavior was a bit overzealous. Honestly, it might not be worth merging any of this until/unless we can gate it?'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-03-20 07:48:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Basically looks like we need to figure out something for unicode() in py3'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-03-20 15:53:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The six library (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/six/1.3.0) is popular for projects that want 2 and 3 support. It includes wrappers for Unicode objects.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-03-20 16:14:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks Doug. We might need to use six, but I'm not sure yet. We should definitely import from future (especially unicode_literals).

I'm definitely learning a lot here and reading python3porting.com is a huge help. Altogether, though, I realize that simply running 2to3 is the wrong way."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-03-21 14:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Conversions to happen after gating.'}]

compatibility. Had to readjust some line-lengths
for pep8.

The 2to3 tool cannot make all the necessary conversions,
but makes many automatically.

2to3 did not catch the test_models.py test for
'has dict methods' where it was checking for 'next',
whereas this method has been renamed to '__next__'.
This has been manually fixed.

Change-Id: I44c6e034f349398ccd51dfdc51d24abc8a317a16
"}]
commit_message:
2to3 for db modules

Ran the 2to3 tool against 'db' to approach Python3
compatibility. Had to readjust some line-lengths
for pep8.

The 2to3 tool cannot make all the necessary conversions,
but makes many automatically.

2to3 did not catch the test_models.py test for
'has dict methods' where it was checking for 'next',
whereas this method has been renamed to '__next__'.
This has been manually fixed.

Change-Id: I44c6e034f349398ccd51dfdc51d24abc8a317a16

commit_message:
2to3 for RPC

Ran the 2to3 tool against RPC to approach Python3
compatibility. Had to readjust some line-lengths
for pep8.

The 2to3 tool cannot make all the necessary conversions,
but makes many automatically.

'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-03-11 23:57:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I actually agree that 422 is the "wrong" status code most (all?) of the places we use it; even though I probably put a few there.  But even more so I think we use 412 in place of 400 incorrectly (Precondition failed normally indicating a refusal to serve a request because of an If-Not-Match header or something similar - which isn't really supported).  If we do 422, we should surely do 412.

But I'm not sure it's necessary (or even appropriate) to change any of these at this point in the game?  Maybe something to square in an api version bump?  Or at least a significant release version bump?

Maybe I'm looking at it wrong... is this causing a problem for some clients or is it purely an exercise in "correctness"?'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-03-12 00:08:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

My take would be clean it up in V2 and leave it in V1 just to be safe.  I don't necessarily have an issue with changing error response codes up, as long as success doesn't change but I understand this might raise some concern."}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2013-03-12 04:15:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Clay, 422 is for web dav. 412 is based on the server not meeting requirements of the request.

G is already introducing v2, so I'm fine with it appearing in there. I've yet to look at this change completely though."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-03-12 04:26:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So IMO the 422 is definitely wrong and is not valid.  That being said I do understand the concern, our guidelines state that fixing "error responses" is acceptable but given where we are in the release cycle I'm fine with fixing it in V2 only and leaving V1 as is.

If Clay or anybody else has an objection I think the above compromise might be a good alternative.'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-03-12 17:33:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Would like to see V2 fixed, preferably before G-final

Would rather see V1 left as is... it is an established API and clients don't expect it to change under them"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-03-12 17:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

understood'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-03-13 17:31:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-13 18:27:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Switch all uses of 422 response code to 400.

The 422 response is normally only for WebDAV, and these types of
errors should normally return a 400 code, HTTPBadRequest. This
commit goes through all the remaining 422 codes and changes them
to 400 responses.

Fixes bug 1153807

Change-Id: I9bf49643763c2cb0ac585641056c85a060152e36

commit_message:
Handle compute node records with no timestamp.

Commit 94560ab57d9fc23673f42017e6f2a78cb2b66b7a added a fast-path
to avoid work when baremetal compute nodes haven't changed, but if
the compute message has None for its updated-at timestamp (which
can happen during startup) the comparison crashes.

Fixes bug: 1096719
Change-Id: Ib8add431d975eee133deefea62eb53479a97396e
(cherry picked from commit fad69df25ffcea2a44cbf3ef636a68863a2d64d9)

commit_message:
SQlite storage improved.

 * faster insertion
 * i18n messages
 * list() returns iter
 * adapt to the storage-layer test framework
 * unicode handling

Change-Id: I6b499ad9c05683c0352f217d4e01185027c8ccc7

commit_message:
Don't actually connect to libvirtd in unit tests.

The libvirt tests shouldn't actually be connecting to libvirtd
while running unit tests. Many of the tests were calling either
getLibVersion or getCapabilites, which would start a connection.
Fake these out so the tests can run properly without libvirtd.

Fixes bug 1157992

Change-Id: Iff1a60fc3cc912fdaf641f1f289744bcc9cc9736

commit_message:
Allow user to specify headers at the command line.

Currently swift client does not allow content type to be specified
when upload an object. It does not allow a user to change content
type neither. This patch will allow a user to specify content
type by using upload command or modify the content type by using
post command.

For example:
1. To upload an object with specific content type:
swift upload -H content-type:applicaiton/xml con1 file1

2. To modify an object to a specific content type:
swift post -H content-type:application/josn con1 file1

This patch also allow a client to specify other request headers.

Change-Id: I12db83a1d465285e0906889cc67dfaa44e059568
Fixes: bug #1154621

When using the firewall driver IptablesFirewallDriver and the
default INPUT and FORWARD rules are DISCARD then the DHCP
request from the VM is discarded prior to getting to the dnsmasq.

'}]
commit_message:
Enable VM DHCP request to reach DHCP agent

When using the firewall driver IptablesFirewallDriver and the
default INPUT and FORWARD rules are DISCARD then the DHCP
request from the VM is discarded prior to getting to the dnsmasq.

New rules will be added that enable DHCP requests to pass.

This fixes bug 1131223

Change-Id: I5117458d6a4c0fe2e333f6f3c2f902672e6293e5

Using the ID of domain in Libvirt to recognize the hard reboot has been
implemented or not, if the ID changed, we believe the domain has been rebooted,

Fixes: bug #1046356

Change-Id: Iec2f9e8225cfe2779f84d2095667f3c0e621e935

commit_message:
Fix double reboot issue during soft reboot

Using the ID of domain in Libvirt to recognize the hard reboot has been
implemented or not, if the ID changed, we believe the domain has been rebooted,
return True and break from soft reboot.

Fixes: bug #1046356

Change-Id: Iec2f9e8225cfe2779f84d2095667f3c0e621e935
(cherry picked from commit 6344bff494758e0d7d7d25f43a3b56d82447441e)

0.7.10 has been released and is compatible with 0.7.x. Instead
of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

Unfortuantely '<0.8' matches '0.8.0b2', which is what we don't want.

Change-Id: Ia5e9fbe75e5ab17aa0b1d9023f112b5e199ebb1a

commit_message:
Pin SQLAlchemy to 0.7.x

0.7.10 has been released and is compatible with 0.7.x. Instead
of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

Unfortuantely '<0.8' matches '0.8.0b2', which is what we don't want.
Therefore pinning it to '<=0.7.99' instead.

Fixes: Bug #1153983

Change-Id: Ia5e9fbe75e5ab17aa0b1d9023f112b5e199ebb1a

commit_message:
localfs file ops should ensure parent dir is created

guestfs_write/guestfs_write_append both create the directories
needed for the file write/append operations to succeed. We need
to do the same for localfs

Fixes LP# 1157923

Change-Id: I37a46d442a1abd0ccb31b748189a6a0741e135e0

'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2013-03-18 21:04:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

You know what, in my imperfect understanding of CORS, I do not think that it's necessary to configure permissable headers. The list of possible headers that Swift can ever generate is known in advance. The only exception is middleware that may send additional headers. But in such case, configuration is not the right answer. The proper solution is to 1) add all foreknown headers such as Content-Type, and 2) provide an API, like a env key, that permits middleware to add CORS-compatible headers if necessary.

I may be wrong about this, so no -1."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-03-19 04:33:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I like Pete's suggestion better, but I'm happy to remove my -1 if someone with more CORS expertise can show how that's bad."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-03-19 08:00:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The use case I am trying to solve here is to be able for a HTML5 control-panel to upload directly to a Swift using CORS.

When doing the PUT/POST we may need to specify some meta-data headers with arbitrary name so having just a list of all swift headers would not work here (but would help for simple PUT without meta-data).

We could potentially just allow with every headers specified in the request header :

Access-Control-Request-Headers

in the reply header :

Access-Control-Allow-Headers:

but I don't think this is what the cors specs had in mind for the Access-Control-*-Headers as mentioned in this dev.mozilla article:

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/HTTP/Access_control_CORS

"The server also sends Access-Control-Allow-Headers with a value of X-PINGOTHER, confirming that this is a permitted header to be used with the actual request."

so in way the admin need to permit those headers and not just pass-thru.

I personally would be happy with a setting :

cors_allow_headers = *

to just do that assuming we are OK we may deviate a bit from the spec.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 904, 'date': '2013-03-19 11:08:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

I think your first suggestion is the best Chmouel, i.e. return all the headers listed in Access-Control-Request-Headers in the response header Access-Control-Allow-Headers.

The CORS specification does leave the door open for this, 6.2 (10), i.e. "Note: Since the list of headers can be unbounded simply returning headers can be enough."'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-03-21 08:46:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Sure i'll make a new patch so that effectively remove the allow_headers flag  on containers_info since we are always going to allow them."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-03-21 09:53:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

superseeded by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24978/'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-03-21 09:53:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24978/'}]

commit_message:
Allow default authorized cors headers config.

- Allow configure the default Access-Control-Allow-Headers sent back by
  the server which before the patch would be only auth-token if not
  using the container_cors method and only via server setting allowed.
- Fixes bug 1155034.

Change-Id: I8c62e280aeb9786dd94bad90b90a159f856fb007

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-25 16:37:07.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for memory overcommit in live-migration

Override the live-migration memory check in FilterScheduler and
make it use RamFilter for checking available memory on target
host.

Resolves bug 1068258.

Change-Id: I3002b8330e595ce71e2718b2091d3b0b99747707
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for memory overcommit in live-migration

Override the live-migration memory check in FilterScheduler and
make it use RamFilter for checking available memory on target
host.

Resolves bug 1068258.

Change-Id: I3002b8330e595ce71e2718b2091d3b0b99747707
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

subject: Allow trusts to be optional
messages:
[{'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-03-21 03:09:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Can't just disable something in the last minute without updating API spec first.

Is trust API not good enough for the use cases we are trying to solve? Has the community as a whole agree to this?"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-03-21 03:13:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Please see the comments I made in the dependant review."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-03-21 03:15:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

gyee:  This is a kill switch.  The default is still Enabled.  If there proves to be a serious problem with trusts, or if a given deployer does not want them, this gives people a way to disable them in the field.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-03-21 03:23:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Openstack is both the framework and reference implementation. If we are going to implement a kill switch in the reference implementation. At least mark the APIs as *optional* in the spec.

And lastly, lets inform the community by sending an email to openstack-dev. Lets try to make decision as a community.

Reason we included trust APIs in the spec was because there's a need for it right? Whoever wanted this should have the right to speak up."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-03-21 03:38:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-03-21 03:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

gyee: this just adds the option to disable trusts -- it doesn't actually affect anything out of the box. ayoung and termie have been discussing the viability of trusts in core vs an extension & alternative solutions.

i'd like to get this into rc1 as a security precaution if nothing else (disable feature you're not using), and we can have the enable/disable by default discussion in the dependent patch (which is a one-liner)

i assume ayoung is good with this patch as I addressed all his concerns in the (now) dependent review, and this patch was made at his suggestion anyway ("Do you want me to resubmit the kill switch patch with default enabled? I can do that.")'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2013-03-21 03:48:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

sure'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-03-21 04:14:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We either enable it by default or update API spec to mark those APIs optional."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-03-21 04:16:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

gyee: it is enabled by default here; api conversation & possible patch would go in this review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24952/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-21 04:19:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

dolph, I am good with enable it as default so there's no impact on the API spec. Frankly, its too late in the game to change the API spec anyway. If this feature is not useful, lets deal with in in 3.1 or 4.0."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-03-21 04:24:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Update Cinder's latest copy of OSLO grizzly stable

This patch updates all the files from oslo under
stable/grizzly but policy.py.  policy.py is a high risk
change at this date and it has lots of changes since the
last time we updated it.

Fixes bug #1157126

Change-Id: I399a1cd8474f718ed5196def90d2fea546fb01f5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-20 18:29:05.000000000', 'message': "Speedup solidfire unit tests

The SolidFire driver has a sleep that's used in a retry loop.  This
sleep was being called every iteration of the loop though
(instead of just when the call failed).

This made SolidFire the slowest test in the unit tests, and obviously
it's just stupid anyway.  So this change fixes that and only performs
the sleep if the call actually failed.

Change-Id: I560f2fdb6bf16a6a9b26184234225349ab62e816
"}]
commit_message:
Speedup solidfire unit tests

The SolidFire driver has a sleep that's used in a retry loop.  This
sleep was being called every iteration of the loop though
(instead of just when the call failed).

This made SolidFire the slowest test in the unit tests, and obviously
it's just stupid anyway.  So this change fixes that and only performs
the sleep if the call actually failed.

Change-Id: I560f2fdb6bf16a6a9b26184234225349ab62e816

commit_message:
No nova-compute, nova-volume on controller

Don't tell admins to install nova-compute and nova-volume on the
controller.

nova-compute only runs on compute nodes, and nova-volume has been
deprecated.

Change-Id: Iac58b51fa1cefad6c6ca7df4dd81deb1e84c97d7

commit_message:
Client Side Changes for Security Groups Support.

- Added new secgroups command with the following options
  - list
  - get
  - add_rule
  - delete_rule
- Added corresponding calls into the REST API

Implements blueprint: security-groups

Change-Id: Ie6d4bc2ce31dc18f172e92efa46ccdeea3e0a22a

commit_message:
Fix typo in policy.json and checks in nicira plugin

Bug 1155379

This patch removes extra colons from policy.json.
Also, it fixes some checks in the nicira plugin which were not
passing correctly the target resource for the policy engine.

Change-Id: I89a1d170818173eaa90b50158289a06455febadc

commit_message:
Tolerate missing keys in reformat_dict_keys

For validate, some keys are optional but still need mapping
if they are there.

Helps bug #1157537

Change-Id: Ib29cd99979a84892a98117c607651ea4c352e3d1

commit_message:
Wrap config module and require manual setup (bug 1143998)

This moves keystone.config to keystone.common.config, which requires
.configure() to be called manually in order for options to be
registered.

keystone.config preserves the existing behavior of automatically
registering options when imported.

keystone.middleware.auth_token and it's dependencies within keystone no
longer cause config options to be automatically registered.

This is an alternative to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24251/

Change-Id: If9eb5799bf77595ecb71f2000f8b6d1610ea9700

commit_message:
Properly handle emulated ldap enablement

Prior to this patch, a member attribute will attempt to be added to the enabled
project even if it already exists. This fails to pass since in LDAP you cannot
have two of the same member attributes in an object.

Change-Id: Ic2373b01eb9921fbf5e9ad828628119288821dba
Fixes: bug #1155234

commit_message:
Mova nova configuration initialization

* Move shared volume configuration from stack.sh to stackrc
* Move Nova network and vnc/spice configuration settings from stack.sh
  into lib/nova
* Rename NET_MAN to NETOWRK_MANAGER to match nova.conf attribute name

Change-Id: I9bd2955def553499aa832eda1f0959afe494206a

commit_message:
Make os-services API extensions consistent with Nova

Updates the os-services API extensions to match the Nova changes
proposed in I932160d64fdd3aaeb2ed90a092ecc7a36dcc9665.

Resolves bug 1147746.

Change-Id: Ib0f24dea8e937a8e1a1604b1cbf19d96bcdbcd8f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-08 05:42:05.000000000', 'message': 'Use system libvirt install on Jenkins.

On Jenkins hosts enable the use of site-packages in tox which will
allow the use of the system install of libvirt while testing.

Hardcode the libvirt host UUID for tests that check this UUID when
system libvirt is being used. Without this hardcoding eight tests
would fail when using the system libvirt install.

Change-Id: I59c5fbd45639962c0963298203c39759b6ca2d11
'}, {'created': '2013-02-08 06:10:08.000000000', 'message': 'Enable tox use of site-packages for libvirt.

Enable the use of site-packages in tox which will allow the use of the
system install of libvirt while testing.

Hardcode the libvirt host UUID for tests that check this UUID when
system libvirt is being used. Without this hardcoding eight tests
would fail when using the system libvirt install.

Partially fixes bug #1113181

commit_message:
Enable tox use of site-packages for libvirt.

Enable the use of site-packages in tox which will allow the use of the
system install of libvirt while testing.

Hardcode the libvirt host UUID for tests that check this UUID when
system libvirt is being used. Without this hardcoding eight tests
would fail when using the system libvirt install.

Partially fixes bug #1113181

Change-Id: I59c5fbd45639962c0963298203c39759b6ca2d11

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-03 12:29:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think this is looking pretty good.

The first thing I looked into was the implications on users because of the switch to entry points:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-January/004228.html

First thing we need to do is ensure that if ComputeCapabilitiesFilter is listed in scheduler_default_filters it should work. Logging a deprecation warning in this case would be good too.

I also think we should add a config option which contains a list of the weighing functions which should be used - i.e. the equivalent of default_filters, but for weighers. Some small number of users may have been using scheduler_weight_classes for this. In any case, it seems reasonable to have a way to disable weighers."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-03 12:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (7 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-03 13:10:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, I think I have a better idea how to handle the instance_properties vs resource_properties issue

In FilterScheduler._schedule() we can copy instance_properties and instance_type to resource_properties and resource_type before passing filter_properties to get_filtered_hosts() and get_weighed_hosts()

That might seem like a hack, but it makes some conceptual sense - we're using a mixture of generic filters from Oslo (which look at resource_properties) and Nova-specific filters (which look at instance_properties)"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-03 13:15:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You should also add the scheduler module to openstack-common.conf'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-01-04 08:55:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (5 inline comments)

[{'created': '2012-12-28 14:51:44.000000000', 'message': 'Convert Nova to use common scheduler filters/weights

Filter scheduler is being used for more than one core projects (Nova
and Cinder as of writing), the implementation shared a lot of common
code. Efforts has been spent on porting scheduler filters and weighing
functions to Oslo.

This patch will convert Nova to use common scheduler filters and
weights. And the common filters/weights are managed/exposed via entry
points, therefore this patch removes loadables module (since it is not
necessary anymore) and related tests as well.  Besides filters/weights,
the rest of Nova remains almost untouched, only a few lines of code
change is needed for Host Manager().

Change-Id: Ib0b3eb580072633be4367f22959d5ebed0bc86d6
'}, {'created': '2013-01-04 15:18:25.000000000', 'message': 'Convert Nova to use common scheduler filters/weights

Filter scheduler is being used for more than one core projects (Nova
and Cinder as of writing), the implementation shared a lot of common
code. Efforts has been spent on porting scheduler filters and weighing
functions to Oslo.

This patch will convert Nova to use common scheduler filters and
weights. And the common filters/weights are managed/exposed via entry
points, therefore this patch removes loadables module (since it is not
necessary anymore) and related tests as well.  Besides filters/weights,
the rest of Nova remains almost untouched, only a few lines of code
change is needed for Host Manager().

The implications for this patch to end users are:
1) Users who don't add custom filters or weighers

   * If a user has set the scheduler_default_filters config option to
     enable or disable some filters, this should keep working without
     the user having to update their config files. The current patch
     renames ComputeCapabilitiesFilter to CapabilitiesFilter which
     results a deprecated warning log message but the expected behavior
     is unchanged.

   * The behaviour of the filters should not change at all. For example,
     they operate on the same set of filter_properties provided to
     run_instance() so you should be able to update the scheduler before
     updating the API server.

   * The scheduler_available_filters config option is removed in favor of
     the default "all_filters" behaviour. It's safe to assume this class
     of users wouldn't have changed this option.  Even if end users who had
     this config explictly set in config file (a.k.a change default), simply
     remove this config option will solve the problem (NoSuchOptError).

   * The scheduler_weight_classes config option is replaced by
     scheduler_default_weigher option.  This class of users should not
     notice any difference at all.

2) Users who have added their own custom filters or weighers.

   * There were previously two ways of adding new code - drop a file
     into the right directory Nova's codebase or install it elsewhere
     and update the available_filters or weight_classes options. Neither
     of these methods will work anymore. Instead, they need to register
     their filter as an entry point.

   * The code needs to be updated to use the new Oslo filter/weigher
     base classes.

   * To use custom weighers or to disable the RAM weigher, simple place
     the desired weighers in new scheduler_default_weigher options will
     do the trick.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib0b3eb580072633be4367f22959d5ebed0bc86d6
'}, {'created': '2013-02-27 06:25:44.000000000', 'message': 'Convert Nova to use common scheduler filter/weight

1) Users who don't add custom filters or weighers

     the user having to update their config files. The current patch
     renames ComputeCapabilitiesFilter to CapabilitiesFilter which
     results a deprecated warning log message but the expected behavior

   * The behaviour of the filters should not change at all. For example,
     they operate on the same set of filter_properties provided to

   * The scheduler_available_filters config option is removed in favor of

     of users wouldn't have changed this option.  Even if end users who had
     this config explictly set in config file (a.k.a change default), simply
     remove this config option will solve the problem (NoSuchOptError).

   * The scheduler_weight_classes config option is replaced by
     scheduler_default_weigher option.  This class of users should not
     notice any difference at all.

2) Users who have added their own custom filters or weighers.

   * There were previously two ways of adding new code - drop a file
     into the right directory Nova's codebase or install it elsewhere
     and update the available_filters or weight_classes options. Neither
     of these methods will work anymore. Instead, they need to register
     their filter as an entry point.

   * The code needs to be updated to use the new Oslo filter/weigher
     base classes.

   * To use custom weighers or to disable the RAM weigher, simple place
     the desired weighers in new scheduler_default_weigher options will
     do the trick.

commit_message:
Convert Nova to use common scheduler filter/weight

Filter scheduler is being used for more than one core projects (Nova
and Cinder as of writing), the implementation shared a lot of common
code. Efforts has been spent on porting scheduler filters and weighing
functions to Oslo.

This patch will convert Nova to use common scheduler filters and
weights. And the common filters/weights are managed/exposed via entry
points, therefore this patch removes loadables module (since it is not
necessary anymore) and related tests as well.  Besides filters/weights,
the rest of Nova remains almost untouched, only a few lines of code
change is needed for Host Manager().

The implications for this patch to end users are:
1) Users who don't add custom filters or weighers

   * If a user has set the scheduler_default_filters config option to
     enable or disable some filters, this should keep working without
     the user having to update their config files. The current patch
     renames ComputeCapabilitiesFilter to CapabilitiesFilter which
     results a deprecated warning log message but the expected behavior
     is unchanged.

   * The behaviour of the filters should not change at all. For example,
     they operate on the same set of filter_properties provided to
     run_instance() so you should be able to update the scheduler before
     updating the API server.

   * The scheduler_available_filters config option is removed in favor of
     the default "all_filters" behaviour. It's safe to assume this class
     of users wouldn't have changed this option.  Even if end users who had
     this config explictly set in config file (a.k.a change default), simply
     remove this config option will solve the problem (NoSuchOptError).

   * The scheduler_weight_classes config option is replaced by
     scheduler_default_weigher option.  This class of users should not
     notice any difference at all.

2) Users who have added their own custom filters or weighers.

   * There were previously two ways of adding new code - drop a file
     into the right directory Nova's codebase or install it elsewhere
     and update the available_filters or weight_classes options. Neither
     of these methods will work anymore. Instead, they need to register
     their filter as an entry point.

   * The code needs to be updated to use the new Oslo filter/weigher
     base classes.

   * To use custom weighers or to disable the RAM weigher, simple place
     the desired weighers in new scheduler_default_weigher options will
     do the trick.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib0b3eb580072633be4367f22959d5ebed0bc86d6

commit_message:
Add snapshots to the volume usage audit report

* Added tests for db api call volume_get_active_by_window called by the volume
usage audit report.

* Added new db api called snapshot_get_active_by_window & test it. This is
similar to the volume_get_active_by_window method but returns the snapshots
 active the supplied time window.

* Integrate the above into the cinder-volume-usage-audit script to report on
  all the active snapshots as well as volumes in the specified time frame.

Fixes: bug #1157110

Change-Id: I7597da20c62150a8f6c74cbfeec159f68064d2a6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-28 02:38:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add run_service() to start services without screen

* USE_SCREEN defaults to True, set it to False to exec the services
  directly from bash.  SCREEN_DEV is still supported until the CI
  scripts get updated.
* The extra logging file descriptors are properly closed in the child process
* The screen_rc() call is still present; this means that stack-screenrc will
  have a complete record of what was started and rejoin-stack.sh may be able
  to re-create the setup under screen.
* The python interpreter was unwilling to write to the log files without
  unbufering stdout by using PYTHONUNBUFFERED.  This feels hackish and should
  be investigated further.

Change-Id: I012ed049f2c8b185a2e6929d73edc29e167bc21f

  directly via bash.  SCREEN_DEV is still supported until the CI
  scripts get updated.
* The extra logging file descriptors are properly closed in the child process
  and stdout/stderr are redirected to the log files.
* The screen_rc() call is still present; this means that stack-screenrc will
  have a complete record of what was started and rejoin-stack.sh may be able
  to re-create the setup under screen.
* The python interpreter was unwilling to write to the log files without
  unbufering stdout by using PYTHONUNBUFFERED.  This feels hackish and should
  be investigated further.

Change-Id: I012ed049f2c8b185a2e6929d73edc29e167bc21f

commit_message:
Add run_process() to start services without screen

* USE_SCREEN defaults to True, set it to False to exec the services
  directly via bash.  SCREEN_DEV is still supported until the CI
  scripts get updated.
* The extra logging file descriptors are properly closed in the child process
  and stdout/stderr are redirected to the log files.
* The screen_rc() call is still present; this means that stack-screenrc will
  have a complete record of what was started and rejoin-stack.sh may be able
  to re-create the setup under screen.
* The python interpreter was unwilling to write to the log files without
  unbufering stdout by using PYTHONUNBUFFERED.  This feels hackish and should
  be investigated further.

Change-Id: I012ed049f2c8b185a2e6929d73edc29e167bc21f

commit_message:
remove requirement on AGPL library

rtslib was added as a dependency during the grizzly cycle to
complete the LIO iscsi implementation, but this violates our policy
of no GPL libraries as dependencies for projects.

The following patch removes the dependency, as well as all the other
code that required rtslib either directly or indirectly (basically
removes the LIO support). This is one way to address the issue to
ensure we don't depend on it in tree.

Fixes bug #1157091

Change-Id: Ibdb7f71c127df0e36ca0e3b3ce65420ddc32e648

commit_message:
Load all the necessary database tables when running cisco plugin

In Cisco plugin, Remove redundant/unnecessary calls to configure_db().
Make sure that all the database models are loaded before calling
configure_db()

fixes bug #1155121

Change-Id: I27d5dda512140f0553b311b35678c82f729fa854

commit_message:
Config value for revocation list timeout

Adds the config option 'revocation_cache_time'
default of 300 seconds, same as token timeout

Bug 1076083

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ifd41c816dd5431f140461d6a1588364d7ecf9a62

commit_message:
Enable multi-agent support

even when q-svc is disabled, i.e. on node without q-svc in multi-agent architecture,
state_path will be configured in quantum.conf so that agent doesn't crashs anymore

Bug 1156685

Change-Id: I28625e4b606fa61c35179248321632d3d797c547

commit_message:
Force Quantum processes to run in a subshell

Force bash to evaluate the command line passed to screen_it so the
commands are executed in a subshell.  This seems to make a difference
when using run_service() when the server process is owned by init.

These Quantum services were the only ones in all of DevStack being
spawned in this manner.  This will allow the run_service() patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/23148/ to succesfully be merged
and the number of test failures due to screen should be reduced to 0.

Change-Id: I97d562adda51d39a5e7fa1dc4d945d4a396201cd
