revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-20 11:27:03.000000000', 'message': 'clarify --log-file comments

Clarify that --log-dir is only applicable for
relative --log-file paths.

Also change the description of --log-file, to be less specific.
By changing "If not set" to "If no default is set", it
allows for a better description given the cumulative nature of
these config settings.  Distributors can use this for example
to set a default in a distribution wide config file that is
then indicated by a commented default in a user editable file.
I.E. the following config file is now more accurate:

 # Name of log file to output to.
 # If no default is set, logging will go to stdout.
 # log_file = /some/dist/default/set/elsewhere.conf

Change-Id: I9a39511b6d6cfff907471ab7a6f31c34592a1015
'}]
commit_message:
clarify --log-file comments

Clarify that --log-dir is only applicable for
relative --log-file paths.

Also change the description of --log-file, to be less specific.
By changing "If not set" to "If no default is set", it
allows for a better description given the cumulative nature of
these config settings.  Distributors can use this for example
to set a default in a distribution wide config file that is
then indicated by a commented default in a user editable file.
I.E. the following config file is now more accurate:

 # Name of log file to output to.
 # If no default is set, logging will go to stdout.
 # log_file = /some/dist/default/set/elsewhere.conf

Change-Id: I9a39511b6d6cfff907471ab7a6f31c34592a1015

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-20 00:00:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add bulking support for Cisco plugin

For each bulk request, the Cisco plugin will handle the call,
and, through the base class method, convert them into a series of
non-bulking calls wrapped in a transaction.

Those non-bulking requests will all be forwarded to the Cisco
model (VirtualPhysicalSwitchModelV2), which will either handled
the request locally (as in create_port), or delegate the request
to the OVS plugin (OVSQuantumPluginV2).

As a result, the model should not receive any bulking calls.
However, the model was set up to delegate any bulk calls to the
OVS plugin (which would act like the existing code, in case we
decide later to pass along any bulk calls). An alternative would
be to raise an exception, if a bulk call was made to the model.

Prior to this change, all bulking calls were forwarded from the
Cisco plugin to the model plugin, which would would delegate
(directly or indirectly) to the OVS plugin. The OVS plugin would
turn the request into a transction of non-bulking calls.

The effective difference proposed is that the create_port will now
create the port in OVS and then create the network in the Nexus
plugin.

The Nexus plugin does not currently handle bulking for port
create (pre-allocating), and instead only handles single port
creates (e.g. VM instance creating a port). There is a separate
bug (#?) that will modify this logic to skip the Nexus
call, if there is no instance ID and to handle update_port()
calls, when the port is associated with an instance.

blueprint Add support for bulk API in Cisco plugin
Change-Id: I874295b32ea20c2ca393228b0893a9dd6c77baf2

commit_message:
Add bulking support for Cisco plugin

For each bulk request, the Cisco plugin will handle the call,
and, through the base class method, convert them into a series of
non-bulking calls wrapped in a transaction (emulated bulking).

Those non-bulking requests will all be forwarded to the Cisco
model (VirtualPhysicalSwitchModelV2), which will either handle
the request locally (as in create_port), or delegate the request
to the OVS plugin (OVSQuantumPluginV2).

As a result, the model should not receive any bulking calls.
However, the model was set up to delegate any bulk calls to the
OVS plugin (which would act like the existing code, in case we
decide later to pass along any bulk calls). An alternative would
be to raise an exception, if a bulk call was made to the model.

Prior to this change, all bulking calls were forwarded from the
Cisco plugin to the model plugin, which would would delegate
(directly or indirectly) to the OVS plugin. The OVS plugin would
turn the request into a transction of non-bulking calls.

The effective difference proposed is that the create_port will now
create the port in OVS and then create the network in the Nexus
plugin.

The Nexus plugin does not currently handle bulking so this commit
is implementing emulated (versus native) bulking.

This patch has been updated with latest from upstream (Havana).

blueprint bulk-api-cisco-plugin
Change-Id: I874295b32ea20c2ca393228b0893a9dd6c77baf2

commit_message:
Set the default_log_levels to include keystoneclient

This creates a loggger for keystoneclient so we don't get:
"
No handlers could be found for logger "keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token"
"

bug 1152584
Signed-off-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I72d4de37799956b33371826aae50d8ac1ee333b1

commit_message:
Switch to python-keystoneclient 0.2.3.

Fixed the bug #1151665 by having python-keystoneclient dependency to
version >=0.2.3.

Also fixed the issue of setting the fake memory cache for keystone
middleware in unit test by using the correct configuration and request
environment.

Change-Id: Id3706bea6083c03adc46a8716c5cb8074339fc45

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-12 06:28:40.000000000', 'message': 'Require paramiko >= 1.9.0

There is a well-known bug in the Paramiko SSH library that causes
these Exceptions:
SSHException: Error connecting via ssh: PID check failed. RNG must be
re-initialized after fork(). Hint: Try Random.atfork()

This bug has been fixed in Paramiko, and therefore we should require
the newer version for drivers that use Paramiko to function properly.

Change-Id: I0c0c3b05a259af55f0e1dfc903fd7e3a578460be
Fixes: bug 1150720
'}, {'created': '2013-03-19 06:39:31.000000000', 'message': 'Require paramiko >= 1.8.0

There is a well-known bug in the Paramiko SSH library that causes
these Exceptions:
SSHException: Error connecting via ssh: PID check failed. RNG must be
re-initialized after fork(). Hint: Try Random.atfork()

This bug has been fixed in Paramiko, and therefore we should require
the newer version for drivers that use Paramiko to function properly.

Change-Id: I0c0c3b05a259af55f0e1dfc903fd7e3a578460be
Fixes: bug 1150720
'}]
commit_message:
Require paramiko >= 1.8.0

There is a well-known bug in the Paramiko SSH library that causes
these Exceptions:
SSHException: Error connecting via ssh: PID check failed. RNG must be
re-initialized after fork(). Hint: Try Random.atfork()

This bug has been fixed in Paramiko, and therefore we should require
the newer version for drivers that use Paramiko to function properly.

Change-Id: I0c0c3b05a259af55f0e1dfc903fd7e3a578460be
Fixes: bug 1150720

commit_message:
Clarify conditions and impact of deleting a domain

Deleting a domain will delete all the objects owned by it.  This patch
updates the api documentation to clarify this and to specifiy that
a domain must first be disabled before it can be deleted

Documenation to go with fix for Bug #1097995

Change-Id: Ia5fb068ae4110b4401a7daa82ca176db1e63482a

commit_message:
NetApp[backport]: Fix for snapshot not deleted in error state.

This fix enables cleaning of volumes/snapshots
in error state by allowing them to delete.
It will allow the delete call to be
successful if snapshot/volume are in
error state. This also fixes the bug
raised recently with  number 1145409 which seems
to be duplicate of 1143661.

bug 1143661
bug 1145409

Change-Id: I4000a2a14d94738e1f68f2e337753321a4a736a4

[{'created': '2013-03-07 07:04:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix inability to delete volumes in error state for NetApp driver

While using NetApp 7-mode storage box to create volumes, if the volume
is not created on the storage box (possibly due to wrong/missing
options in cinder.conf file), the volume goes in error state, and when
one tries to delete the volume, an exception was raised which made
the volume go in error_deleting state, which is unrecoverable. This
commit quiesces that exception, resulting in successful removal of the
volume entry from the volume table.

Fixes bug 1090167

Change-Id: Ieca296f3bd5479bbafdd86f7ad154865902d1ec8
'}, {'created': '2013-03-18 13:26:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix inability to delete volumes in error state for NetApp driver

While using NetApp 7-mode storage box to create volumes, if the volume
is not created on the storage box (possibly due to wrong/missing
options in cinder.conf file), the volume goes in error state, and when
one tries to delete the volume, an exception was raised which made
the volume go in error_deleting state, which is unrecoverable. This
commit quiesces that exception, resulting in successful removal of the
volume entry from the volume table.

Fixes bug 1090167

Change-Id: Ieca296f3bd5479bbafdd86f7ad154865902d1ec8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix inability to delete volumes in error state for NetApp driver

While using NetApp 7-mode storage box to create volumes, if the volume
is not created on the storage box (possibly due to wrong/missing
options in cinder.conf file), the volume goes in error state, and when
one tries to delete the volume, an exception was raised which made
the volume go in error_deleting state, which is unrecoverable. This
commit quiesces that exception, resulting in successful removal of the
volume entry from the volume table.

Fixes bug 1090167

Change-Id: Ieca296f3bd5479bbafdd86f7ad154865902d1ec8

commit_message:
Validate domains unconditionally (bug 1130236)

Ensure that we validate the domain status of user/project for
a user authenticating via the v2 API.

This patch builds on the initial functional change done by Dolph,
and fixes up the tests that broke sure to domain being required in
any tests that setup data directly in the backends.

Fixes Bug #1130236

Change-Id: I66dfd453fb95fa4fa3fde713b663386a2c2ecdf8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-19 22:02:50.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor db.service_destroy and db.service_update methods

Remove session parameter from db.service_get method

Optimize db.service_destroy:
Was:
1 request with join to get service with compute_node
1 request to delete service
1(0) to delete compute_node
Now:
1 request (without join) to delete service
1 request to delete compute_node

Optimize db.service_update:
Remove unused join.

Fixes bug 1157442

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Ifcc8fdebfc95daec736464cbc9e16301116540aa
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor db.service_destroy and db.service_update methods

Remove session parameter from db.service_get method

Optimize db.service_destroy:
Was:
1 request with join to get service with compute_node
1 request to delete service
1(0) to delete compute_node
Now:
1 request (without join) to delete service
1 request to delete compute_node

Optimize db.service_update:
Remove unused join.

Fixes bug 1157442

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Ifcc8fdebfc95daec736464cbc9e16301116540aa

[{'created': '2013-03-20 06:03:05.000000000', 'message': 'Adds source-ip-prefix support.

This bug fix adds the missing --source-ip-prefix/--source_ip_prefix
to the quantum client. It is largely a simple copy-paste of the lines
which implement --remote-ip-prefix/--remote_ip_prefix.

Change-Id: I2f9a48470f1003a9aefdc193bea00b3b878bddae
Fixes: bug #1154078
'}]
commit_message:
Adds source-ip-prefix support.

This bug fix adds the missing --source-ip-prefix/--source_ip_prefix
to the quantum client. It is largely a simple copy-paste of the lines
which implement --remote-ip-prefix/--remote_ip_prefix.

Change-Id: I2f9a48470f1003a9aefdc193bea00b3b878bddae
Fixes: bug #1154078

This appears to be a duplicate of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24235/ which is currently waiting in the gate'}, {'account_id': 6992, 'date': '2013-03-12 21:03:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24235/ uses version websockify<0.4.
But version 0.4 works fine. It's only broken in 0.4.1"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-03-12 21:08:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Are you sure?  CI team said that 0.4.0 was not working.  It also looks like from the changes that 0.4.1 actually fixes the problem in 0.4.0.  I think at this late stage for Grizzly rc1, it's better to pin < 0.4.0 anyway, as that's what we'e been testing with."}, {'account_id': 6992, 'date': '2013-03-12 21:15:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

All the unit tests are passing with version 0.4. 
Not sure if there are other automated tests. So if we are confident with <0.4, let's go with that for the rc. We can merge this change later to trunk."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-12 21:42:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Fixing websockify dependency for running tests

Websockify install is failing with the latest 0.4.1
So falling back to 0.4.0

Fixes bug 1154297

Change-Id: Id4c6f33aca3f730bc120f6055624d3d1b00a490a

'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-03-07 03:21:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think the way the tests are written is a bit odd. For example:

- the cloudpipe instance is brought up in setupClass but AFAICT it isn't needed for any of the negative tests and I don't think its needed by the test_configure_cloudpipe_by_admin_user either

- test_create_cloudpipe_by_admin_user doesn't actually create a server since its already done in setupClass

- test_list_cloudpipe_by_admin assumes that a cloud pipe instance already exists (which is ok since its down in setupClass.

Perhaps the last two can be combined into 1 test and the server creation moved into that test so it only occurs for that test. 

This way server creation is not performed for the negative tests (and with parallel test runs this is important as it will potentially avoid multiple server creations)"}, {'account_id': 6690, 'date': '2013-03-07 13:55:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-07 14:42:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Works for me

commit_message:
Adding a Cloudpipe JSON & XML clients, adding also tests

Clients based on the Cloudpipe section of the OpenStack API
Reference documentation (http://api.openstack.org/api-ref.html)

Note that Cloudpipe should be explicitly enabled by adding
the following entries (with values)  to /etc/nova/nova.conf:

1. vpn_image_id
2. use_project_ca
3. cnt_vpn_clients

Change-Id: I566b26e228c757406047e4cd345c39f9c003dea9

commit_message:
Update identity api to handle '200 OK' response

add user and add tenant incorrectly state 201 created response in
api doc. this will not be fixed in v2 but applied to v3.

also, fix users example incorrectly using 'username', should be 'name'

Change-Id: I77738a23e45ae9b0d65ffbc02ed4987585b755f2

commit_message:
Update the network info when using quantum.

The network info cache in quantum was not updated with floating ips.
Also it wasn't updated properly updating the network info cache
during some operations that changed it. This adds floating ips and
updates the cache properly.

Fixes bug 1108975

Change-Id: I9e9c211d014f9671d724cded1fb9a74313c458b6

Fixes: bug 1157012

commit_message:
Fix Storwize/SVC LUN allocation with holes.

The Storwize/SVC driver should find the first unused LUN, but
continues searching, returning erroneous results.  Added 'break'
statement to fix.

Change-Id: Ibd95714e086a513a39fe9d20ffec57135dc5ec55
Fixes: bug 1157012

[{'created': '2013-03-18 16:38:43.000000000', 'message': 'Allow snapshot_delete for NFS/GlusterFS drivers

RemoteFsDriver should allow snapshot_delete, since snapshot_create
for NFS and GlusterFS volumes will create a snapshot in the error
state which cannot be deleted afterward.

snapshot_delete() should allow this to be removed rather than
throwing NotImplementedError.

Fixes bug: 1156686

Change-Id: I4307878fa97fbce5bd733a83fa172509e2fba8ce
'}]
commit_message:
Allow snapshot_delete for NFS/GlusterFS drivers

RemoteFsDriver should allow snapshot_delete, since snapshot_create
for NFS and GlusterFS volumes will create a snapshot in the error
state which cannot be deleted afterward.

snapshot_delete() should allow this to be removed rather than
throwing NotImplementedError.

Fixes bug: 1156686

Change-Id: I4307878fa97fbce5bd733a83fa172509e2fba8ce

commit_message:
remove cinder-rtstool because of rtslib dep

rtslib is AGPL, so cinder-rtstool is defacto AGPL by importing it.
Remove cinder-rtstool from the OpenStack repository.

Fixes bug #1157091

Change-Id: I30c9ee19d43107fa7f2e5e65d69049b8d69d2bdf

commit_message:
Add missing tests for db.virtual_interface_* methods

There was no tests in test_db_api for virtual_interface_* methods.

Add tests to ensure that all works.

This allow us to refactor these methods to use soft_delete instead of
delete.

Found bug 1156227 in sqlite we have lost UC on virtual_interfaces.address
after 152_* migration. To fix it we should add new db migration, so it will be
fixed in Havana-1.

blueprint db-api-tests

Change-Id: Ide03163b230762d65bf3cd7b5fe8f0a303fea5ae

'}, {'created': '2013-03-14 18:28:48.000000000', 'message': "Remove duplicate password/token opts.

commit_message:
Remove duplicate password/token opts.

Consolidate the 'auth' method option registration
in config.py.

This makes it so we don't have to catch Exceptions when the
default 'auth' options are registered twice and avoids some
log WARNING messages as well.

Fixes LP Bug #1154406.

Change-Id: I301328ec3ec4823dd7fbec1e639e2841516352e5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-28 20:29:04.000000000', 'message': "Fixes snat rules in complex networking configs

There is currently no way to disable nova's snat rule, which causes
problems for some network configurations with an external gateway.
This patch allows the snat to be completely disabled by setting
a blank value for routing_source_ip.

This patch also makes the snat rule a little more specific, only
snatting traffic that is destined for the public interface (or
the floating interface if it is defined). This allows the snat
to work without changing routing_source_ip and also ensures that
an instance assigned multiple ips from different floating pools
will connect from the appropriate address for each pool

Fixes bug 1048765

Change-Id: I18be88a3dbb7a9f4762db7beefc94e07b8310100
(cherry picked from commit 959c93f6d3572a189fc3fe73f1811c12323db857)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes snat rules in complex networking configs

There is currently no way to disable nova's snat rule, which causes
problems for some network configurations with an external gateway.
This patch allows the snat to be completely disabled by setting
a blank value for routing_source_ip.

This patch also makes the snat rule a little more specific, only
snatting traffic that is destined for the public interface (or
the floating interface if it is defined). This allows the snat
to work without changing routing_source_ip and also ensures that
an instance assigned multiple ips from different floating pools
will connect from the appropriate address for each pool

Fixes bug 1048765

Change-Id: I18be88a3dbb7a9f4762db7beefc94e07b8310100
(cherry picked from commit 959c93f6d3572a189fc3fe73f1811c12323db857)

So a few points:

1) So I assume that you are not trying to run the group_crud tests yet, since they are still being skipped by the nose.exec.SkipTest in test_backend_ldap.py?

2) Probably better to reference the bug not the blueprint in the commit message, i.e. add  a line that says

Fixes Bug #1092187'}, {'account_id': 6456, 'date': '2013-02-23 15:32:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi Henry, sorry for any confusion but I did run the group_crud test which is passing for group create, get and delete. It still fails at update so that's why for now I left the nose.exec.SkipTest in test_backend_ldap.py. Yes, I will change the blueprint with bug in the message with my next update. 
(Can you please look at my below inline comment on Patch 3 in test_backend_ldap.py. Just copying here for handy reference: 
"OK, thanks, that was good learning. So I have removed my changes from here. I tested group crud via the test_backend. I verified that group create, get and delete works fine. I had to add a new method in the core.py and also modified models.py. The "update" does not work so that's why I haven't yet removed the 'test_group_crud' function from the test_backend_ldap.py. Question on the 'update' - so right now the test fails, in the /backends/cory.py GroupApi update method, with an expected error that "changing Name not supported by LDAP" because we provide two different name as an argument via test_project_crud in test_backend.py. (I also see that it works the same way for "projects" currently). So what's the expected behavior of the 'update'? I believe I need to write new code according the expected behavior? Thanks!"
)

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 6456, 'date': '2013-02-24 19:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6456, 'date': '2013-02-24 20:16:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-24 20:32:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
Add missing tests for db.service_* methods

There was no tests in test_db_api for service_* methods.

Add tests to ensure that all works. Also these tests allow us to refactor
work with session in these methods.

blueprint db-api-tests

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-19 23:21:06.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure repeated member deletion fails with 404

Fixes bug 1157427

If an image membership is deleted more than once, the second and
subsequent deletions would be expected to return a 404 Not Found
response code, as opposed to 204 No Content.

Previously, the can_show_deleted logic got in the way, such that
for an admin caller the previously deleted membership was considered
still extant.

We now override the show_deleted logic for deletion, as it makes no
sense to consider the existence of previously deleted database rows
when another deletion request is issued.

Note that there is no corresponding proposal to master as this logic
has been refactored and this no longer affects master.

Change-Id: If8200bbb74e46c814c9f8fa6b4c636e7b022ab6c
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure repeated member deletion fails with 404

Fixes bug 1157427

If an image membership is deleted more than once, the second and
subsequent deletions would be expected to return a 404 Not Found
response code, as opposed to 204 No Content.

Previously, the can_show_deleted logic got in the way, such that
for an admin caller the previously deleted membership was considered
still extant.

We now override the show_deleted logic for deletion, as it makes no
sense to consider the existence of previously deleted database rows
when another deletion request is issued.

Note that there is no corresponding proposal to master as this logic
has been refactored and this no longer affects master.

Change-Id: If8200bbb74e46c814c9f8fa6b4c636e7b022ab6c

Hmm, the code is working as documented:

  Option values in config files override those on the command line.

i.e. it was never intended for CLI values to override config file values

This patch basically changes the semantics to:

  Option values in config files override those on the command line, except boolean options on the command line override values in config files

which clearly doesn't make any sense

I suspect some other change means we're getting debug spew from nova-manage"}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-19 22:49:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-19 23:06:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Fix  Inverse cmd line options for bool to work properly

When boolean options are set in configuration files and
inverse options are used in the command line (say
debug=True in nova.conf and --nodebug on the command line)
then the inverse option does not have any effect.

Added a bunch of tests to make sure we dont break the
functionality

Change-Id: I6a3ef892ac54389d30d2e9e25b9ad8047d4926ec

default log level is WARNING, since in devstack we need
as much detail as possible we just throw in --debug (DEBUG level).

Change-Id: Ie1865e0f66e23ffcae010dab128230664862937c

commit_message:
Do not set both --debug and --verbose to true

default log level is WARNING, since in devstack we need
as much detail as possible we just throw in --debug (DEBUG level).
There is no need to set --verbose (INFO) as well.

Change-Id: Ie1865e0f66e23ffcae010dab128230664862937c

[{'created': '2013-03-13 20:23:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix console support with cells

The (relatively recent) security fixes for consoleauth do not work
with cells because consoleauth and the compute manager for the instance
talk to different rabbit servers.  consoleauth is in the API cell and
the compute manager is in a child cell.

This patch adds code to proxy the following via cells:

1) compute -> consoleauth's delete_tokens_for_instance()
2) consoleauth -> compute's validate_console_port()

Also: On instance deletion when the compute manager tells consoleauth to
delete tokens for the instance, it's not necessary to do an rpc.call and
block.  The only purpose it could serve would be log a traceback on failure
on the compute manager side, but that seems unnecessary.  There's no
return value.  This patch changes it to an rpc.cast instead.

Fixes bug 1154755

Change-Id: Ic763f2a5c0dcff7b7ccfac5927680e7881605f61
"}, {'created': '2013-03-13 20:27:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix console support with cells

commit_message:
Fix console support with cells

The (relatively recent) security fixes for consoleauth do not work
with cells because consoleauth and the compute manager for the instance
talk to different rabbit servers.  consoleauth is in the API cell and
the compute manager is in a child cell.

This patch adds code to proxy the following via cells:

1) compute -> consoleauth's delete_tokens_for_instance()
2) consoleauth -> compute's validate_console_port()

Also: On instance deletion when the compute manager tells consoleauth to
delete tokens for the instance, it's not necessary to do an rpc.call and
block.  The only purpose it could serve would be log a traceback on failure
on the compute manager side, but that seems unnecessary.  There's no
return value.  This patch changes it to an rpc.cast instead.

Fixes bug 1154755

Change-Id: Ic763f2a5c0dcff7b7ccfac5927680e7881605f61

subject: Prevent volume-attach/detach from instances in rescue state

"}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-03-08 13:07:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Apart from the failing tests - which you should of course fix and add some more as well.

Also it would be very good to add an except clause to the create method of the volumes api extension Controller class so that we return proper HTTP error codes (we'd get a 500 now I believe - not nice).

Further - and this is a comment meant for discussion - Not allowing attach is definitely what we want to do, not allowing detach may not be however, because if instance had attached volumes, and it is rescued, there is no way to access these volumes until we unrescue the instance, since the will be marked as attached, but not actually attached to the "rescue" instance as it will be rescued without any block devices.

Allowing detach has it's own problems to because if we detach a volume and attach it to a new instance (to analize it for example), and forget to detach it, the unrescue will fail.

Just a point I thought worth bringing up - probably outside of the scope of this patch.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-11 23:31:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Nikola,  While not allowing detach will make the workflow a little strange (either detach volume before or after going into rescue state, and not in rescue state).  It seems to be the safest of the options.

Also one side effect of this patch, is a user cannot mount a volume to a VM in rescue mode to copy data off the disk onto the volume.'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-03-12 07:35:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes you are right!

At this point however, I think it's good to disable attach and detach for rescued instances (rather than try to work out the edge cases of how it can be done) - it will give a much cleaner user experience at least, so I am generally in favour of this patch. It'd be good to look into tests and API errors though, as mentioned in my previous comment. Cheers."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-12 23:54:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-13 00:15:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-08 02:23:47.000000000', 'message': "Prevent volume-attach/detach from instances in rescue state

Rescue is supposed to just be a way to log into a wayward instance
if something goes wrong with the base image that may have had some data
(logfiles etc.) and make it possible to grab that  - block devices are
assumed to be accessible by re-attaching them, and are considered
persistant so no need for rescue there.

Since there is no need to attach a volume in rescue mode, and detaching a
volume that was previously attached doesn't work, just ban volume
attach/detach in rescue state.

Fixes bug 1126187

Change-Id: Ifdf164155942cdeb2bbdfcd1dce0dd2e125b507c
"}, {'created': '2013-03-12 23:54:24.000000000', 'message': "Prevent volume-attach/detach from instances in rescue state

Rescue is supposed to just be a way to log into a wayward instance
if something goes wrong with the base image that may have had some data
(logfiles etc.) and make it possible to grab that  - block devices are
assumed to be accessible by re-attaching them, and are considered
persistant so no need for rescue there.

Since there is no need to attach a volume in rescue mode, and detaching a
volume that was previously attached doesn't work, just ban volume
attach/detach in rescue state.

Fixes bug 1126187

Change-Id: Ifdf164155942cdeb2bbdfcd1dce0dd2e125b507c
"}, {'created': '2013-03-13 21:16:12.000000000', 'message': "Prevent volume-attach/detach from instances in rescue state

Rescue is supposed to just be a way to log into a wayward instance
if something goes wrong with the base image that may have had some data
(logfiles etc.) and make it possible to grab that  - block devices are
assumed to be accessible by re-attaching them, and are considered
persistant so no need for rescue there.

Since there is no need to attach a volume in rescue mode, and detaching a
volume that was previously attached doesn't work, just ban volume
attach/detach in rescue state.

Fixes bug 1126187

Change-Id: Ifdf164155942cdeb2bbdfcd1dce0dd2e125b507c
"}, {'created': '2013-03-18 21:38:29.000000000', 'message': "Prevent volume-attach/detach from instances in rescue state

Rescue is supposed to just be a way to log into a wayward instance
if something goes wrong with the base image that may have had some data
(logfiles etc.) and make it possible to grab that  - block devices are
assumed to be accessible by re-attaching them, and are considered
persistant so no need for rescue there.

Since there is no need to attach a volume in rescue mode, and detaching a
volume that was previously attached doesn't work, just ban volume
attach/detach in rescue state.

Fixes bug 1126187

Change-Id: Ifdf164155942cdeb2bbdfcd1dce0dd2e125b507c
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent volume-attach/detach from instances in rescue state

Rescue is supposed to just be a way to log into a wayward instance
if something goes wrong with the base image that may have had some data
(logfiles etc.) and make it possible to grab that  - block devices are
assumed to be accessible by re-attaching them, and are considered
persistant so no need for rescue there.

Since there is no need to attach a volume in rescue mode, and detaching a
volume that was previously attached doesn't work, just ban volume
attach/detach in rescue state.

Fixes bug 1126187

Change-Id: Ifdf164155942cdeb2bbdfcd1dce0dd2e125b507c

[{'created': '2013-03-15 12:05:03.000000000', 'message': "Change 'Retry-After' header to be a string.

The 'Retry-After' was set as an intenger. When running nova behind
Apache mod_wsgi it causes that the actual exception is not rendered,
getting an error 500 instead.

Fixes bug 1155585

Change-Id: If1b1de2308ccdc6f0588c8df5dc896fe5f767dbe
"}, {'created': '2013-03-19 14:15:24.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that headers are returned as strings, not integers.

The 'Retry-After' header was set as an integer, and it was causing that
mod_wsgi failed with a 500 error, instead of the actual error. This
ensures that the headers are converted to str.

Fixes bug 1155585
Change-Id: If1b1de2308ccdc6f0588c8df5dc896fe5f767dbe
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that headers are returned as strings, not integers.

The 'Retry-After' header was set as an integer, and it was causing that
mod_wsgi failed with a 500 error, instead of the actual error. This
ensures that the headers are converted to str.

Fixes bug 1155585
Change-Id: If1b1de2308ccdc6f0588c8df5dc896fe5f767dbe

subject: Ensure auth_token can cope with no reponse from "GET Versions"
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-13 16:28:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/1/check/gate-python-keystoneclient-pep8/896 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/1/check/gate-python-keystoneclient-docs/747 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/1/check/gate-python-keystoneclient-python26/819 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/8377 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/13932 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-03-13 16:39:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-03-13 20:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-13 20:34:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

henry: Hey, I'm not sure I understand the reason for this patch. To me it seems like we shouldn't need to worry about firewall's in auth_token.

Did someone hit an error where a GET on versions actually failed due to firewall issues? It would seem to me, in that case you could also just set 'auth_version' explicitly and avoid this sort of code.

---

Also, I like the tidy ups you've done here but those should probably be a separate patch no?"}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-03-13 21:35:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So the situation that was raised by some (Guang Yee in particular) was where the installation has decided to block the Get Versions call, so the client can't determine what version to use by inspection.  While of course the client already supports explicitly setting a single version to use (by setting the auth_version config variable, which, however does not have a default by design), we want auth_token to still do something sensible out of the box if no guidance is given.  Hence the desire to have a fallback approach for such a situation (I'm adding a second config variable called auth_version_fallback in the next patch) which does have a default (set to 'v2.0') which will be used in this case.

Agreed on your comment that the other changes should be in a separate patch."}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-03-13 21:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-03-13 22:40:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-13 22:43:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/2/check/gate-python-keystoneclient-pep8/899 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/2/check/gate-python-keystoneclient-docs/749 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/2/check/gate-python-keystoneclient-python26/821 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/2/check/gate-python-keystoneclient-python27/827 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/8787 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/8503 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/14070 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-13 23:08:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I gotta say. I would rather not see us make version detection even more complicated with yet another config option.

Not a big fan of this.... nor do I really understand the use case here. Why would anyone block a GET on '/' to the keystone server. And if they did wouldn't setting the 'auth_version' flag (which already exists) provide a work around?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-13 23:10:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

guang-yee: would this approach not cover your case where a GET on '/' was blocked:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24186/

A bit simpler (doesn't require an extra config option)."}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-03-14 11:20:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-03-14 11:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-03-14 11:31:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Dan - so implementing https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24186/ would not cure this problem (since it would still error out trying to read the versions from the server).  I think we only have two solutions:

1) Solve this by telling people the must specify explicitly the auth version they want by using the existing auth_version config setting 

2) something like I am suggesting here.

Guang...I think you raised the initial concern here - is 1) good enough, or is that too restrictive?  If 1) is fine, let's abandon this change."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-14 12:06:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/3/check/gate-python-keystoneclient-pep8/909 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/3/check/gate-python-keystoneclient-docs/759 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/3/check/gate-python-keystoneclient-python26/831 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/3/check/gate-python-keystoneclient-python27/837 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/8867 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/8583 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24327/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/14169 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-03-14 16:30:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-03-17 03:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Not sure I undertand the problem this is trying to solve.  I think that the best approach would be to assume that if someone is firewalling off "/" they are not in complete control of their environment, and thus should be talking to the people communicating with Keystone in order to tell them which version to use.  Just make it a config option "use exactly this version"  and bypass the version call altogether.

I hope they have firewalled off "/v3" as well...'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-03-19 21:26:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Abandoned

General consensus is that since we have a manual override, we don't need to complicate things by supporting this kind of fall back,"}]

commit_message:
Ensure auth_token can cope with no reponse from "GET Versions"

In some installations, the keystone server may be firewalled in
such a way so as to not be able to respond to a "GET /" (i.e.
GET Versions) url. Rather than error out, auth_token should fall back
to a default version.

Fixes Bug #1154072

Change-Id: If25ad24bd4acbf4cb07dc683018dd1a5f92d99e4

commit_message:
Validate domains unconditionally (bug 1130236)

Ensure that the domain status (i.e. enabled/disabled) is taken
into account for user/project when authenticating a user via the
v2 API.

This chnage is based on the initial functional changes made by Dolphm,
and fixes up the test breaks caaused by requiring the backend to
be correct setup with a domain_id.

Change-Id: I41379998d50c17f3faaefa5a595e1d2767c7816c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-19 18:44:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix multiple fixed-ips with quantum.

This patch fixes a bug in the quantum suppot where multiple requested
fixed-ips did not work.  Every network interface would be given the last
fixed IP that was specified.  The problem was just the lack of putting
the right fixed ip in a local variable.

Fix bug 1154093.

Change-Id: Ie7e034e19a38c8431540c81b023ff4800aa6ec50
'}]
commit_message:
Fix multiple fixed-ips with quantum.

This patch fixes a bug in the quantum suppot where multiple requested
fixed-ips did not work.  Every network interface would be given the last
fixed IP that was specified.  The problem was just the lack of putting
the right fixed ip in a local variable.

Fix bug 1154093.

Change-Id: Ie7e034e19a38c8431540c81b023ff4800aa6ec50

[{'created': '2013-03-19 20:24:24.000000000', 'message': 'Use role in insensitive case in keystoneauth.

Using insensitive case could tolerate human error. For example,
user maybe set like this "operator_roles = Admin, swiftoperator"

- also fix a mistake in test, ['admin'] is correct value for roles, not
  'admin' (it will be looped as ['a', 'd', 'm', 'i', 'n'])
- add test for insensitive cases

Change-Id: I8b6157364e7a0e4ed08991bba23bf10e8056c3be
'}]
commit_message:
Use role in insensitive case in keystoneauth.

Using insensitive case could tolerate human error. For example,
user maybe set like this "operator_roles = Admin, swiftoperator"

- also fix a mistake in test, ['admin'] is correct value for roles, not
  'admin' (it will be looped as ['a', 'd', 'm', 'i', 'n'])
- add test for insensitive cases

Change-Id: I8b6157364e7a0e4ed08991bba23bf10e8056c3be

subject: Load all the necessary database tables when running cisco plugin
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 107, 'name': 'Arvind Somya', 'email': 'arvind.somya@gmail.com', 'username': 'asomya'}, {'_account_id': 385, 'name': 'Jason Klker', 'email': 'jason@koelker.net', 'username': 'jason-koelker'}, {'_account_id': 447, 'name': 'dan wendlandt', 'email': 'dan@nicira.com', 'username': 'danwent'}, {'_account_id': 490, 'name': 'Sumit Naiksatam', 'email': 'sumitnaiksatam@gmail.com', 'username': 'snaiksat'}, {'_account_id': 2031, 'name': 'Nachi Ueno', 'email': 'nati.ueno@gmail.com', 'username': 'nati-ueno'}, {'_account_id': 6659, 'name': 'Paul Michali', 'email': 'pc@michali.net', 'username': 'pcm'}, {'_account_id': 6685, 'name': 'Baodong (Robert) Li', 'email': 'baoli@cisco.com', 'username': 'baoli'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-19 20:16:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/24653/1/check/gate-quantum-pep8/5827 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24653/1/check/gate-quantum-docs/5100 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24653/1/check/gate-quantum-python26/5473 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24653/1/check/gate-quantum-python27/5487 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24653/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/14725 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2013-03-19 20:16:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I'm fairly new to openstack. My question is what "migration" is referred
> to. Can you give me some detailed information on the migration
> functionality? It's much appreciated!

The quantum-db-manage command allows running the migrations as specified in the alembic installation that is embeded in quantum at https://github.com/openstack/quantum/tree/master/quantum/db/migration . Migrations are applied outside of the quantum-server running, so one would have to make sure that the quantum-server's plugin had already called configure_db after the module defining the table had been imported.

> By the way, with the existing patch set, all the tables will be created at
> STARTUP, just not at the same time.

Sure, by convention its working that way, but its not enforced. My point is we shouldn't make it acceptable/easy to call configure_db everywhere creating tables in piecemeal fashion, ideally configure_db should be called exactly once on the main plugin instantiation (don't event know if that's a word, its all red and squiggly ;) or better yet in the manager/api. Since plugins are free to load their own parts of the code, this allows for create tables to be emited out unexpectedly at runtime. While, yes it works, it's much more performant to make SURE all tables are created at startup, hence subsequent calls to configure being noops.

That said, if the larger quantum community would like to allow dynamic table creation or enforce not doing that it via review policy, that's the way it will work ;).'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2013-03-19 20:16:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Not sure I'm down with this, as it allows plugins to defer create tables to runtime, and if that's the case, then should running migrations on those tables then be deferred as well?

I think just making sure that all model definitions are imported (so they get registered with the base) prior to the db being configured is a better course of action. All plugins should know what models they support and should make sure they don't call configure until all the models they support are loaded."}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2013-03-19 20:16:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

>> Quick question, what do you mean by "running  migrations on those tables"in your comments?

Just that if database tables get created not just at startup, then when migrations are run, should those be run at configure_db time only for the tables that are effected at the moment.

Consider for example something that has added a table and then in another commit, a migration is added for that table.  If the operator using quantum didn't first run the codepath that called configure_db after that new table was registered with the base, running the db migration would fail since the table wouldn't exist.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-03-19 20:16:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm not sure why this is needed.
The bug report lacks the reason why cisco plugin is not working.
Could you add more info?

May be this should be BP."}, {'account_id': 6685, 'date': '2013-03-19 20:16:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I actually went for that approach initially. But thought the currently proposed change will be simple and flexible, allowing tables to be created whenever they are needed. So I ended up posting this patch set for consideration.

I'll load the patch set based on this approach soon."}, {'account_id': 6685, 'date': '2013-03-19 20:16:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm fairly new to openstack. My question is what "migration" is referred
to. Can you give me some detailed information on the migration
functionality? It's much appreciated!

By the way, with the existing patch set, all the tables will be created at
STARTUP, just not at the same time.'}, {'account_id': 6685, 'date': '2013-03-19 20:16:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Nachi, updated the bug description with more details. Hopefully it will clarify the issue.

Jason, thanks for the information. Will take a look at it.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-19 20:16:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-19 20:16:59.000000000', 'message': 'Load all the necessary database tables when running cisco plugin

In Cisco plugin, Remove redundant/unnecessary calls to configure_db().
Make sure that all the database models are loaded before calling
configure_db()

fixes bug #1155121

Change-Id: I27d5dda512140f0553b311b35678c82f729fa854
'}, {'created': '2013-03-19 20:16:59.000000000', 'message': 'Load all the necessary database tables when running cisco plugin

In Cisco plugin, Remove redundant/unnecessary calls to configure_db().
Make sure that all the database models are loaded before calling
configure_db()

fixes bug #1155121

Change-Id: I27d5dda512140f0553b311b35678c82f729fa854
'}, {'created': '2013-03-19 20:16:59.000000000', 'message': 'Allow database tables to be created at different times

Currently, only the first call to configure_db() will create the database
engine and all the database tables. Subsequent calls to it are actually
noops. This will not work in the case where some database tables may be
initialized after the initial call to configure_db() has been made.

fixes bug #1155121

Change-Id: I27d5dda512140f0553b311b35678c82f729fa854
'}]
commit_message:
Load all the necessary database tables when running cisco plugin

In Cisco plugin, Remove redundant/unnecessary calls to configure_db().
Make sure that all the database models are loaded before calling
configure_db()

fixes bug #1155121

Change-Id: I27d5dda512140f0553b311b35678c82f729fa854

Previous log module in OSLO doesn't initialize root logger, which results
in lacking of log message for non-openstack library (such as stevedore).
This patch pull latest log module from OSLO, which has recently merged a
change to enable root logger initialization.

Fix bug: # 1131322

Change-Id: I86396f15ca152512ce6d18d6d424a855b27f495e
"}, {'created': '2013-03-18 06:06:04.000000000', 'message': "Pull Oslo log fix to enable root logger initialization

Previous log module in Oslo doesn't initialize root logger, which results
in lacking of log message for non-openstack library (such as stevedore).
This patch pull latest log module from Oslo, which has recently merged a
change to enable root logger initialization.

Notice that this change also includes one log modules fix in Oslo which
'unignore' log_format setting.  As a result, one may experience log format
change when using devstack.  To get old log format back, simply assign
a NULL string (aka nothing) to 'log_format' configure option in cinder.conf.
For example, just append cinder.conf with one new line 'log_format = '.

Fix bug: # 1131322

Change-Id: I86396f15ca152512ce6d18d6d424a855b27f495e
"}]
commit_message:
Pull Oslo log fix to enable root logger initialization

Previous log module in Oslo doesn't initialize root logger, which results
in lacking of log message for non-openstack library (such as stevedore).
This patch pull latest log module from Oslo, which has recently merged a
change to enable root logger initialization.

Notice that this change also includes one log modules fix in Oslo which
'unignore' log_format setting.  As a result, one may experience log format
change when using devstack.  To get old log format back, simply assign
a NULL string (aka nothing) to 'log_format' configure option in cinder.conf.
For example, just append cinder.conf with one new line 'log_format = '.

Fix bug: # 1131322

Change-Id: I86396f15ca152512ce6d18d6d424a855b27f495e

commit_message:
Remove references to FLAGS from volume/manager.py

Note that we still must import flags.py because volume_topic is defined
in the list global_opts in flags.py.

Fixes bug #1153551

Change-Id: I3d37bde4ba895c110390cea92385344ff94cb7d1

commit_message:
Fix live ldap tests

Clean up clear_live_database so that all fixture data is removed. Make sure we
use the configured trees for each ldap object in tests. Ensure all live tests
pass or are skipped where appropriate.

Fixes: bug #1154277

Change-Id: I2eb4efe78e2c9d2a18bce339765b3ab5d20ac8f5

simple rebase

Added create/delete/list/show/set for service
Modified setup.py

As of Folsom, there is no need to edit the glance-api-paste.ini and
glance-registry-paste.ini files in a regular install of glance. Remove
references to this in the install doc.

For implementation details, see:
 * https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1043490
 * https://review.openstack.org/12149
 * https://github.com/openstack/glance/commit/b7197041f

Change-Id: Ic3ef513f818727a7daebda2b7271e5dcd66ffe91
'}]
commit_message:
No need to edit glance paste files

As of Folsom, there is no need to edit the glance-api-paste.ini and
glance-registry-paste.ini files in a regular install of glance. Remove
references to this in the install doc.

For implementation details, see:
 * https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1043490
 * https://review.openstack.org/12149
 * https://github.com/openstack/glance/commit/b7197041f

Change-Id: Ic3ef513f818727a7daebda2b7271e5dcd66ffe91

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-14 13:25:37.000000000', 'message': "Delete swift segments when image_size_cap exceeded

When an image which is being written to swift in segments exceeds the
'image_size_cap' limit we should ensure that the now stale swift segments
are deleted.

Fixes bug 1154576.

Change-Id: I08be04e63f6d55acc6b0350810350a4ccadab7be
"}, {'created': '2013-03-14 17:21:43.000000000', 'message': "Delete swift segments when image_size_cap exceeded

When an image which is being written to swift in segments exceeds the
'image_size_cap' limit we should ensure that the now stale swift segments
are deleted.

Fixes bug 1154576.

Change-Id: I08be04e63f6d55acc6b0350810350a4ccadab7be
"}, {'created': '2013-03-14 17:37:22.000000000', 'message': "Delete swift segments when image_size_cap exceeded

"}, {'created': '2013-03-18 18:14:48.000000000', 'message': "Delete swift segments when image_size_cap exceeded

When an image which is being written to swift in segments exceeds the

are deleted.

commit_message:
Delete swift segments when image_size_cap exceeded

When an image which is being written to swift in segments exceeds the
'image_size_cap' limit we should ensure that the now stale swift segments
are deleted.

Fixes bug 1154576.

Change-Id: I08be04e63f6d55acc6b0350810350a4ccadab7be

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-18 17:36:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Is there any disadvantage to just lowercasing the roles when you first get them?

That is, something like
    
    roles = [r.lower() for r in identity.get('roles', [])]

    # plus the same thing done to operator_roles in __init__()

It seems to me like that'd save you a bunch of maps and crap all over the place and also reduce the chance of missing one in the future. I'm not too familiar with the keystone middleware (or keystone, really) so if there's a spot where you'd actually want to preserve case, just ignore me."}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2013-03-18 18:01:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I agree with Sam, the thought crossed my mind too, just didn't want to bikeshed this."}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-03-18 18:36:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think this is more a design decision. Will keystone and
swift always make the role name case insensitive? If this is
not the case, then the patch may actually introduce security
problems. If the role names are indeed case insensitive, then
it must be documented clearly some where so that this fix and
the doc fix will come together."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-18 20:14:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Alright, I actually went and did some digging around on this.

openstack-common (oslo?) has case-insensitive role comparison: https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator/blob/master/openstack/common/policy.py#L738

I think nova uses that policy stuff to make its decisions, but it's hard to tell without spending a bunch of time on it. There's certainly method calls that look like that's what they do...

Glance doesn't use openstack-common for this, but it also has case-insensitivity: https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/middleware/context.py#L85

Now that I know all that, I like this patch. I'd still like to just downcase the roles initially, but it'd be nice to get this into the imminent RC, so I'll +2 this now and one of us (hopefully not me, hint hint ;) ) can follow up with a refactoring soon."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-03-18 21:00:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

thanks for doing this, any chances to add a test that actually test insensitivity ?"}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-03-19 05:35:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

litong:
read https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg13074.html first, try to understand the purpose of why insensitive


chmouel:
thanks for your reminding, we should have UT for testing insensitive cases


sam:
I know your consideration. But I didn't lowercase these at __init__(), because we need accurate info in some other place, log message now (I think user'll be little confusing about his role is not sensitive in his log). And if some usage need write data back (i.e. back to keystone), insensitive is not proper. I think this's a reason why just lowercase in comparing.

Another question for you. I did some searching and analyzing like you did. Should I post all of that in launchpad or commit message to avoid to confuse someone unfamiliar with background of a patch?"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-03-19 07:23:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Kun, this should be OK you don't have to copy and past the comment to the launchpad bug. Usually people refer to review for further discussion.

Would be good if we can have the test today so this can go for release, feel free to ping me on #openstack-swift if you need help (I am EU based).

IMO: I think as well we should do that in __init__ instead of having bunch of map/lambda around the code (and by the way in python land we usually use list comprehension for that kind of thing, see: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1247486/python-list-comprehension-vs-map)."}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-03-19 08:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-03-19 08:28:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

perfect, thank you.'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-03-19 08:36:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Thanks for your advice'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-19 09:07:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me

Build succeeded.

commit_message:
Use role in insensitive case in keystoneauth.

Using insensitive case could tolerate human error. For example,
user maybe set like this "operator_roles = Admin, swiftoperator"

- also fix a mistake in test, ['admin'] is correct value for roles, not
  'admin' (it will be looped as ['a', 'd', 'm', 'i', 'n'])
- add test for insensitive cases

Fixes: bug #1013120
Change-Id: I56d71da8bc503e48e92dd743692ba6fc237f029e

commit_message:
Docs in cinderlcient were never actually updated.

Not only were the docs and release info here not being
maintainted properly, but the examples that were given were
not correct.

This change is an attempt to set us on the right path going
forward and includes info on how to import the API and history
info for the upcoming release/push to PyPi.

Fixes bug: 1156994

Change-Id: I169b1c01380ef653a6a25eb8946b9a06d6419e62

commit_message:
QueueController for mongodb storage

This patch introduces a queue controller for the mongodb storage
backend.

Implements blueprint storage-mongodb

Change-Id: I473d0514b1948bedeae66c3b737d9e18e088c796

commit_message:
Revert "Add importlib."

This reverts commit ec00b862b9963ed43242cf2765ccec2cb37f7872

This raises an exception if you try to install it in python2.7, which breaks the mirror script.

(And incidentally means that it must only be conditionally listed as a requirement for python2.6.)

Change-Id: I5254c5d7fdba8707a6f054ff613cea1619c7c0cc

commit_message:
Add importlib.

Which is a python2.6-only requirement for kombu.  Since we're not yet
building the mirror on python2.6, we need to explicitly list it for
now.  Later we will add a mirror builder for each current OpenStack
testing platform.

Change-Id: I5254c5d7fdba8707a6f054ff613cea1619c7c0cc

Change-Id: Ic676f3cb3dabd03a67bc523e1de9a1e1d60a9431
Effect: allow config vars named 'set_cli' and 'load'.
"}, {'created': '2013-03-18 21:53:29.000000000', 'message': "Move .set_cli and .load to the project() object.

The API changes from config.project().from_options().load() to
config.project().load(); the intermediate project() object now
serves as the config handle.  As a 'side-effect', config vars
can be named 'set_cli' and 'load' now.

Change-Id: Ic676f3cb3dabd03a67bc523e1de9a1e1d60a9431
"}]
commit_message:
Move .set_cli and .load to the project() object.

The API changes from config.project().from_options().load() to
config.project().load(); the intermediate project() object now
serves as the config handle.  As a 'side-effect', config vars
can be named 'set_cli' and 'load' now.

Change-Id: Ic676f3cb3dabd03a67bc523e1de9a1e1d60a9431

(2 inline comments)

* Make it optional
* Use PID to be able to identify the process
* complexity smells, so I would rather use nohup redirect out and err to a log file, and logging only the filename - let the shell deal with the redirection.
* What happens with stderr?"}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2013-03-19 15:30:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

I personally think this is necessary functionality for everyone using XenServer. I don't find it to be unnecessarily complex. If we consider logging a few lines to be an unnecessary amount of extra complexity, I suggest filing a bug or blueprint to achieve the things mentioned.

Regarding PID tracking, I would argue that we should avoid trying to perform multiple migrations to or from the same box simultaneously anyway, as the I/O hit is enormous."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-19 15:51:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: No score

commit_message:
xenapi: Adding logging for migration plugin

With this change administrators will be able to examine hypervisor
logs for real-time progress of rsync operations (resizes, migrates).

Change-Id: I463b574be1021e141fe2c8380b9c07f6cd860c78

Adds vnc_require_instance_uuid_as_password option

the uuid as a password before connection is made.

fixes bug 1128454

commit_message:
q-admin: update keystone + nova config section

bug 1156822

- added sections for new metadata & security groups flags
- updated vif-plugging section in light of port-bindings
- also cleaned up some incorrect references to 'OpenStack
Compute' where it should be 'OpenStack Identity'.
- other misc improvements as I saw them.

Change-Id: I47aec95aa961d362375d7c3f54ce32a9fbc29fce

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-06 07:36:42.000000000', 'message': 'Return error details to users in "dns-create-private-domain"

Fixes bug 1135539
When SysLogHandler is configured in UDP socket mode, the user
who doesn't have the admin privilege got the unexpecting internal
server error(HTTP 500) in "nova dns-create-private-domain" command.
This bug occurs as the call graph drew below:

|--ProxyCallback._process_data():amqp.py
                          |--LOG.exception()
                          |    :
                          |    |--BaseHub.switch():hub.py
                          |                 |-- clear_sys_exc_info()
                          |
                          |--ctxt.reply(None, sys.exc_info(),..)
                                       |
                                       :
                                       |
                         |--serialize_remote_exception():common.py
                                       |--failure_info#(None,None,None)

The sys.exc_info() is cleared by the clear_sys_exc_info(), but it is
called again by the ctxt.reply().
This patch prevents the internal error and returns the details of
the forbidden error(HTTP 403) which is expected.

Change-Id: I76d4a938e66bfaf44423f7586e00db2caf9f5dde
'}, {'created': '2013-03-13 02:11:35.000000000', 'message': 'Return error details to users in "dns-create-private-domain"

Fixes bug 1135539
When SysLogHandler is configured in UDP socket mode, the user
who doesn't have the admin privilege got the unexpecting internal
server error(HTTP 500) in "nova dns-create-private-domain" command.
This bug occurs as the call graph drew below:

|--ProxyCallback._process_data():amqp.py
                          |--LOG.exception()
                          |    :
                          |    |--BaseHub.switch():hub.py
                          |                 |-- clear_sys_exc_info()
                          |
                          |--ctxt.reply(None, sys.exc_info(),..)
                                       |
                                       :
                                       |
                         |--serialize_remote_exception():common.py
                                       |--failure_info#(None,None,None)

The sys.exc_info() is cleared by the clear_sys_exc_info(), but it is
called again by the ctxt.reply().
This patch prevents the internal error and returns the details of
the forbidden error(HTTP 403) which is expected.

Change-Id: I76d4a938e66bfaf44423f7586e00db2caf9f5dde
'}]
commit_message:
Return error details to users in "dns-create-private-domain"

Fixes bug 1135539
When SysLogHandler is configured in UDP socket mode, the user
who doesn't have the admin privilege got the unexpecting internal
server error(HTTP 500) in "nova dns-create-private-domain" command.
This bug occurs as the call graph drew below:

|--ProxyCallback._process_data():amqp.py
                          |--LOG.exception()
                          |    :
                          |    |--BaseHub.switch():hub.py
                          |                 |-- clear_sys_exc_info()
                          |
                          |--ctxt.reply(None, sys.exc_info(),..)
                                       |
                                       :
                                       |
                         |--serialize_remote_exception():common.py
                                       |--failure_info#(None,None,None)

The sys.exc_info() is cleared by the clear_sys_exc_info(), but it is
called again by the ctxt.reply().
This patch prevents the internal error and returns the details of
the forbidden error(HTTP 403) which is expected.

Change-Id: I76d4a938e66bfaf44423f7586e00db2caf9f5dde

commit_message:
Fixes PowerVM spawn failed as missing attr supported_instances

During test in a cross-hypervisor environment (KVM+PowerVM), user will run
into an issue during deploying an instance for Power host by PowerVM driver,
though the property "hypervisor_type" for the PowerVM image have been
configured. Since the _update_host_stats of PowerVM driver missing the
attribute "supported_instances".

Fixes bug: 1155498

Change-Id: I81259d153a7b5ae35747e57c53b14e0075d28d78

commit_message:
Fix RequestContext crashes w/ no service catalog

Code introduced in a prev review assumed service_catalog will be
at least an empty list and will never be None.  But missed one code
path where the service_catalog could potentially be set to None. So
this change switches back the default value of service_catalog in
the arguments to None and makes sure we tolerate anyone else
passing in a None or Empty list as service_catalog

Fix for LP# 1156730

Change-Id: I480b761d57c4699ea7ef72114160cdbeb281e454

commit_message:
Pass project membership as dict in migration 015.

Passing the query result directly to execute() seems to bork
migrations on sqlite.  Pass a dict with the required parameters
instead.

Fixes LP 1156780.

Change-Id: Ib71c5c82be85402cdf6fc5855fc64ec683edebeb

commit_message:
Require netaddr>=0.7.6 to avoid UnboundLocalError

This issue is discussed at https://github.com/drkjam/netaddr/issues/2.
The bug in netaddr was fixed in release 0.7.6 on 13th Sep 2011.

Change-Id: Iea75a30963a09f9b0dd94138460bf041ab98fc66
Fixes: bug #1157058

commit_message:
Don't log unneccessarly on each http request

Note: logging still works with -d, this just quiets it down
for the normal case.

bug 1154408
Signed-off-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I0adccc8b2c83d917d2742e86fdb4b6363b398ca6

Also removes an unused import.

commit_message:
Remove skip decorator from keypairs tests

This removes skips from:
    - test_get_keypair_detail (bug 980688 which is invalid and currently
works fine)
    - test_keypair_delete_nonexistant_key (bug 1086980)

Also removes an unused import.

Depends on change: I7e822c0661c563db01040ae2d57aacfe677d72b0

Change-Id: Id536c484753e219588b030d4fef9753f0e421b35

commit_message:
tests: fix API v2 tests with Keystone auth_token

Recent changes in keystone added a variable to check if _cache is
initialized, so use the same trick.

Change-Id: Ic1d593e3fcfacc6939c0dff9ed97558455006e6c
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

LGTM, thanks for helping with the new CLI tests!'}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-03-08 09:08:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-03-08 18:37:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I agree with Joe, but a little more strongly. The acceptance of this test is a statement that the output format of the keystone cli is part of its spec. I am going to ask for input from the keystone folks about whether this is accepted by them.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-03-10 12:58:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@David Kranz:

The cli client's output used by many script including the ones in devstack, so the and users not excepting the format will change in a minor release. We should make sure, the output just only changes when it is planned and hopefully well communicated."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-03-10 13:12:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I understand your point. But devstack is essentially owned by developers. I just want to make sure that the leaders of this project agree that the printed output of the cli is part of the contract to end users. Is this part of their unit tests? I don't know."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-11 17:42:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

David, these tests are run as part of the regular tempest test.  So yes they will be run on every keystone change.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-03-11 18:22:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I know tempest will be run on keystoneclient changes. I was questioning whether they *should* be. The initial answer from Adam Young on keystone core was that this was OK.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-11 18:24:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

David, thanks for clarifying.   Glad to hear we explicitly confirmed this with the keystone team.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-03-11 20:08:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

@Pavel

Please fix the typo in the commit message and I'm good to go on approving this commit."}, {'account_id': 1794, 'date': '2013-03-11 21:03:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-03-12 04:36:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

PLease take a look at the test_keystoneclient.py and test_keystoneclient_sql files in the keystone/tests directory to see a much more robust test suite."}, {'account_id': 6683, 'date': '2013-03-12 09:52:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Adam:

Yes, looks like there is plenty of keystone/tests for keystoneclient, but it's "just" for the python library.

And this targets the CLI commands which the users are going to execute (==use).
Testing the client python library is (just) side-effect (in case if there are similar tests|coverage for other commands too).'}, {'account_id': 6683, 'date': '2013-03-14 11:23:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (3 inline comments)

commit_message:
Add basic Keystone CLI tests

New cli.output_parser helpers for parsing 'ascii-tables'
 often used in CLIs output.

New basic tests for keystone cli, verifies only read-only
 actions (return codes and basic structure of output).

commit_message:
Implement get_volume_stats in NFS driver

Use the already existing code (ie: _get_available_capacity) to
implement get_volume_stats in the nfs driver

Change the netapp nfs driver to use this new implementation
instead of the dumb one.

Fixes bug #1152501

Change-Id: Ie16d9628ba4b096c60966b4aa6192fbdcb9a4f20

commit_message:
Fix more OS-DCF:diskConfig XML handling

Add handling in the deserialisation code to handle the
OS-DCF:diskConfig attribute in the rebuild and resize actions so
the diskConfig extension can handle it properly. Formerly only
the older auto_disk_config attribute was managed (and incorrectly so).

Fixes bug 1153133

I may be missing something, but it seems like the logic has changed. In the old code, if the test fails by an image having been created, the else clause will delete the image. If the test fails with the new code, is their some magic that will cause the image to be cleaned up?"}, {'account_id': 1037, 'date': '2013-03-14 14:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

tearDown method should take care of the resources created after a test is executed. So, i think it is not required to put the logic of deleting the image.
Please let me know if my understanding is correct.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-03-14 14:45:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I don't think so. The resource management was applied to create_server, not create_image. And the resource management only applies when you call self.create_server or cls.create_server but there are still some test cases that call the client.create_server and then clean it up. At least that is my understanding."}, {'account_id': 1037, 'date': '2013-03-14 14:58:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

So, if we see the teardown of this test file:
        for image_id in self.image_ids:
            self.client.delete_image(image_id)
            self.image_ids.remove(image_id)

I thought that this is clear all the image_id in self.image_ids.
Also there are test like test_create_image_when_server_is_terminating,
if the image is created then we are not cleaning up the image.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-03-14 15:20:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Yes, the tearDown does that. But how does this code:

resp, body = self.client.create_image(server['id'], name, meta)

cause the image, if it is created, to be added to the list of images to delete. I still may be missing something but if not perhaps the other tests have the same issue. Unless we just don't care about this case."}, {'account_id': 1794, 'date': '2013-03-14 21:54:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: No score

We have a new images base client that tracks the creation of all images: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24098/

Sarad you need to rebase your change with trunk to get this change.

Once the image is correct for one reason or another it is tracked using: cls.created_images.append(image['id'])

Then destroyed during tearDownClass(cls)"}, {'account_id': 1794, 'date': '2013-03-14 21:55:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

s/correct/created'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-03-15 00:40:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Replace try/except/else with self.assertRaises.

Test Modified:
test_create_image_from_deleted_server
test_create_image_from_invalid_server

Modifications:
As per new Tempest style guidelines, convert "try/expect/else"
statements into "assertRaises".

Added a private method to append the cls.image_ids list if for any
reason the above test are creating images. This will be cleaned up
in the tearDown of the test.

Partially Implements blueprint update-expected-exception-tests.

Change-Id: I96ca98d2892840d6ae26a2134dbf11bcc946a090

instead of manually doing a try / finally to do server cleanup, call

'}]
commit_message:
clean up trys in test_servers

instead of manually doing a try / finally to do server cleanup, call
clear_servers in tearDown(). This dramatically simplifies the code.

Change-Id: I01bb8d32307fb4efd157d0742731f052ffd464f3

commit_message:
libvirt: Tolerate existing vm(s) with cdrom(s)

When there is an existing vm with cdrom (not started by Nova), we
should tolerate missing file attribute (just skip those)

Fixes LP# 1144756

Change-Id: I43d45872e2d7348801b2e54cd43651609676f372

commit_message:
Implement configurable auto-fade for alerts messages.

The configuration takes what alert types would fade, the delay before
it fades and the fade out duration.

Fixes bug 1144820

Change-Id: I421ee52308613da72118a507ed8b8b574c176f68

commit_message:
LibvirtGenericVIFDriver update for stp

Fixes bug 1129055

The patch will set the stp status as 'off' and the bridge
forwarding delay to 0.

Change-Id: Ie9c96caa797de623ef0b357c61f1b7233a7d869e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-17 19:18:34.000000000', 'message': 'Improve UX around "unauthorized" API exceptions.

Instead of blindly logging out the user when any API returns
a 401 or 403 response (which in most cases is due to a service
being down or misconfigured) we catch the error and inform the
user that they are not authorized for that data.

This is separate from being unauthorized for a dashboard or
panel in Horizon, since those are within our control and involve
security concerns around exposing admin functionalities to end
users. Those checks function as they have previously.

Fixes bug 1060426.

Change-Id: Ied800f10926ac5fb3b9ac1c1c26bbb4fa94a2557
'}, {'created': '2013-03-18 18:58:02.000000000', 'message': 'Improve UX around "unauthorized" API exceptions.

Instead of blindly logging out the user when any API returns
a 401 or 403 response (which in most cases is due to a service
being down or misconfigured) we catch the error and inform the
user that they are not authorized for that data.

This is separate from being unauthorized for a dashboard or
panel in Horizon, since those are within our control and involve
security concerns around exposing admin functionalities to end
users. Those checks function as they have previously.

Fixes bug 1060426.

Change-Id: Ied800f10926ac5fb3b9ac1c1c26bbb4fa94a2557
'}]
commit_message:
Improve UX around "unauthorized" API exceptions.

Instead of blindly logging out the user when any API returns
a 401 or 403 response (which in most cases is due to a service
being down or misconfigured) we catch the error and inform the
user that they are not authorized for that data.

This is separate from being unauthorized for a dashboard or
panel in Horizon, since those are within our control and involve
security concerns around exposing admin functionalities to end
users. Those checks function as they have previously.

Fixes bug 1060426.

Change-Id: Ied800f10926ac5fb3b9ac1c1c26bbb4fa94a2557
