revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-19 01:08:06.000000000', 'message': "Handle None protocol in security group rule table

Default Quantum security groups come in with a protocol of None via
nova. Horizon chokes when it tries to uppercase what it expects to be
a unicode string.

Replace None with 'Any' when displaying the value.

Fixes bug 1156922.

Change-Id: I94a534e829ecdbe75f785eb8fc750260aacd6dfc
"}, {'created': '2013-03-19 08:15:19.000000000', 'message': "Handle None protocol in security group rule table

Default Quantum security groups come in with a protocol of None via
nova. Horizon chokes when it tries to uppercase what it expects to be
a unicode string.

Replace None with 'Any' when displaying the value.

Fixes bug 1156922.

Change-Id: I94a534e829ecdbe75f785eb8fc750260aacd6dfc
"}]
commit_message:
Handle None protocol in security group rule table

Default Quantum security groups come in with a protocol of None via
nova. Horizon chokes when it tries to uppercase what it expects to be
a unicode string.

Replace None with 'Any' when displaying the value.

Fixes bug 1156922.

Change-Id: I94a534e829ecdbe75f785eb8fc750260aacd6dfc

commit_message:
Change overLimitFault to overLimit.

When tempest has to handle the rate-limiting for requests it seeked for
the overLimitFault in the response body, with is not correct. This is
related with https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1046021

Fixes bug 1156668

Change-Id: I47561025f23cf30048bb2bbe6f58f70916ceb9fa

Fixes: bug #1153966

commit_message:
Fix locking issues in Windows

The Windows Storage Cinder plugin through
the Windows Locks implementation
of the InterProcessLock fails in
attaching/detaching operations.

Change-Id: I7ebd3f0addea570a62d1f3b19dc46d49f02b83c7
Fixes: bug #1153966

commit_message:
Install guide: Use env vars with keystone

In the Install Guide, use environment variables to set the endpoint
and token. This makes the text easier to read.

Also changes some markup from programlisting to computeroutput.

Change-Id: I3c246868d114c988ea2902a3a30d6ebf40c5961f

commit_message:
Check if volume service is enabled in quota update

Quotas fail to load on the project quota update form in the
admin dashboard when the volume service is disabled.

Change the get_default_quota_data and get_tenant_quota_data functions
to always check for a disabled volume service, so we don't have to
remember to do it every time we call the functions.

Moved *QUOTA_FIELDS to usage/quotas.py to avoid a circular import.

Fixes bug #1155878.

Change-Id: I7150c4d7c318b6199ff03825cf5d770c7741b379

commit_message:
Workaround for http_log_debug unsupported

In older (e.g. Folsom) python-cinderclients, the argument 'http_log_debug'
is unexpected.

Fixes bug 1156817

Change-Id: I64000e28b85d108400ca13188a3a394c89ae635c

'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-03-01 16:10:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Is the comment in that section of code still true? "This node will only initially sync out one third of the objects" since the whole mod ordinal thing isn't used there now? Couple typos "occured" and "fualts", but I wouldn't reject the patch just for that ;)

I've never used container sync in a production environment, can we get some folks that have take a look at this? It seems like this would cause a lot more requests, though mostly short-circuiting, and I'd be more comfortable approving this if a true stakeholder said it was cool by them.'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-03-01 17:21:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@gholt: 
For a 3 replica ring: 
Under normal conditions this patch  increases the number of short circting from 2 to 3 .
Yet, until this change, if any object was faulty, the entire container sync process stops, as described in the bug report. 
This change fixes that bug and leaves the basic mechanism unchanged (I agree that the basic mechanism is not great to begin with and there is room for improvement).  

First Phase:
"This node will only initially sync out one third of the objects" is still true. 
Yet, until now if a fault occurred during that initial phase, the process terminated mid way - now such a fault will result in the faulty object being skipped and treated by the second phase.

Second phase:
Until now only 2/3 tried to recover any skipped item. Now all 3/3 do so. 
Until now, if an object is faulty, the system just breaks and stop recovering. Now it will retry that object and any newer object while short circuiting any non faulty object. 

Its not a great mechanism, but it is the best we can do with the way container sync works and without redesigning it (which we may do later).'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-08 19:58:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(4 inline comments)

Some small nitpicks, but nothing too important.'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-03-08 20:29:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-08 20:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Improved container-sync resiliency

container-sync now skips faulty objects in the first and second rounds.
All replicas try in the second round.
No server will give up until the faulty object suceeds

Fixes: bug #1068423

Change-Id: I0defc174b2ce3796a6acf410a2d2eae138e8193d

[{'created': '2013-03-19 06:26:35.000000000', 'message': 'Backport paramiko 1.8.0 requirement to Folsom.

Require paramiko >= 1.8.0

There is a well-known bug in the Paramiko SSH library that causes
these Exceptions:
SSHException: Error connecting via ssh: PID check failed. RNG must be
re-initialized after fork(). Hint: Try Random.atfork()

This bug has been fixed in Paramiko, and therefore we should require
the newer version for Cinder drivers that use Paramiko to function
properly.

Change-Id: Ia14b7b72393e2a2482ebde418b5477934779bf13
Fixes: bug 1150720
'}]
commit_message:
Backport paramiko 1.8.0 requirement to Folsom.

Require paramiko >= 1.8.0

There is a well-known bug in the Paramiko SSH library that causes
these Exceptions:
SSHException: Error connecting via ssh: PID check failed. RNG must be
re-initialized after fork(). Hint: Try Random.atfork()

This bug has been fixed in Paramiko, and therefore we should require
the newer version for Cinder drivers that use Paramiko to function
properly.

Change-Id: Ia14b7b72393e2a2482ebde418b5477934779bf13
Fixes: bug 1150720

That being said, dropping the path isn't the way to go I don't think.  We already have a method to handle differing paths across platforms for this (ie we run into this with RedHat/Ubuntu) and the solution is to add another entry for the platform that is different."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-03-16 21:34:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-03-16 21:42:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think relying on exec_dirs is better because it allows to keep each rootwrap entry only once. with the "_usr" copies of the command they're bound to run out of sync, which can cause very subtle bugs. 

While reviewing my changes I noticed that this is more a cleanup than a bugfix, as the problem was actually local. So I can not add a bug reference for now as there is no bug.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-16 22:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-15 15:38:49.000000000', 'message': 'Strip exec_dirs prefix from rootwrap conf

Specifying the full path to binaries in exec_dirs
is not necessary and actually causes a problem if
the binary is in a different path. Fixes rootwrap
failures for SUSE.

Change-Id: Ic16a779e916cd3b727db54b034d069c122aa45df
'}, {'created': '2013-03-16 21:34:50.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up exec_dirs prefix from rootwrap conf

Specifying the full path to binaries in exec_dirs
is not necessary and actually causes a problem if
the binary is in a different path. The rootwrap
infrastructure allows the binaries to be in all
paths specified by exec_dirs.

Change-Id: Ic16a779e916cd3b727db54b034d069c122aa45df
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up exec_dirs prefix from rootwrap conf

Specifying the full path to binaries in exec_dirs
is not necessary and actually causes a problem if
the binary is in a different path. The rootwrap
infrastructure allows the binaries to be in all
paths specified by exec_dirs.

Change-Id: Ic16a779e916cd3b727db54b034d069c122aa45df

Consume oslo.packaging.

Makes setup declarative rather than procedural. Removes the need to
copy files around.

This is a POC - oslo.packaging isn't real yet.

Change-Id: I6c5151a6d34c74bb17f01fe4cb3d7fd29e78d321

commit_message:
Fix how tests are failing due to missing dirs and recursion limits.

I am very unsure as to how CI was passing with these tests
continously failing. Running ./run_tests.sh externally shows that
they fail, so why wasn't CI detecting them. Odd..

Fixes: bug #1125907
Fixes: bug #1131881

Change-Id: Icf658f493dafaf336dcf81b2a423d8c31c8c3be4

'}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-03-18 23:53:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm struggling to understand what's going on here. http_log_debug was reintroduced in

https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/e30724df5b55f5b989f294f82ad7209e150b3559

Was it removed in 2.0?"}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-03-19 00:02:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Current version is 1.0.2 and it's perfectly fine in that. I didn't feel like finding what version it was introduced in specifically.

I added the <2.0 'cuz it's safer to assume that a 2.0 release may have backwards-incompatible changes in it (as with how keystoneclient and quantumclient do releases). It's not doing anything meaningful right now for cinderclient, but it may someday."}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-03-19 00:06:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Fair enough. As long as we're confident using an older cinderclient won't cause any regressions in horizon. My preference is still to just remove the client kwarg for the rc, but I'm willing to +2 this."}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-03-19 02:40:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-19 05:11:27.000000000', 'message': "Pin SQLAlchemy to 0.7.x

0.7.10 has been released and is compatible with 0.7.x. Instead
of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

Unfortuantely '<0.8' matches '0.8.0b2', which is what we don't want.
Therefore pinning it to '<=0.7.99' instead.

This matches a corresponding change in openstack/requirements

Fixes: Bug #1153983

Change-Id: Icf680a933c6092cce52706fd9616a0d208164d1e
(cherry picked from commit 2f2aaf2a89445590e01a7c288de9f5c93b20e87f)
"}]
commit_message:
Pin SQLAlchemy to 0.7.x

0.7.10 has been released and is compatible with 0.7.x. Instead
of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

Unfortuantely '<0.8' matches '0.8.0b2', which is what we don't want.
Therefore pinning it to '<=0.7.99' instead.

This matches a corresponding change in openstack/requirements

Fixes: Bug #1153983

Change-Id: Icf680a933c6092cce52706fd9616a0d208164d1e
(cherry picked from commit 2f2aaf2a89445590e01a7c288de9f5c93b20e87f)

commit_message:
Removes nova-volumes/nova-volume surgically, replace with Block
Storage.

Not sure about lgm vs tgts, etc, in the configuration sections. It
seems ok to leave both as examples but needs review.

Fix bug 1007528
Fix bug 1074200
Fix bug 1078353
Fix bug 1153869

Patchset addresses reviewer's comments.

Patchset fixes new bug, init should be ini and troubleshooting.

Patchset addresses question about networking.

Change-Id: Ib6f325ba11c5cff01364ef787c52cdc57ee8f70f

A couple fixes for Quantum:

  * The Load Balancers panel is now no longer enabled by
    default since it is disabled by default in Quantum.
  * Security Groups and Security Group Rules now support both
    Nova's integer IDs and Quantum's UUID IDs.
  * Regroups all the Quantum panels into a "Manage Network"
    panel group to match "Manage Compute" above it.
  * Adds tests for both int and UUID ids in the Security

Change-Id: I2327901634a83f95c5cff4ba91c8c7c32a0ad8af

A couple fixes for Quantum:

  * Security Groups and Security Group Rules now support both
    Nova's integer IDs and Quantum's UUID IDs.
  * Regroups all the Quantum panels into a "Manage Network"
    panel group to match "Manage Compute" above it.
  * Adds tests for both int and UUID ids in the Security

Fixes bug 1153477 and fixes bug 1155244.

Change-Id: I2327901634a83f95c5cff4ba91c8c7c32a0ad8af
'}]
commit_message:
Disable LB panel by default; allow UUID for Sec Group ID.

A couple fixes for Quantum:

  * The Load Balancers panel is now no longer enabled by
    default since it is disabled by default in Quantum.
  * Security Groups and Security Group Rules now support both
    Nova's integer IDs and Quantum's UUID IDs.
  * Regroups all the Quantum panels into a "Manage Network"
    panel group to match "Manage Compute" above it.
  * Adds tests for both int and UUID ids in the Security
    Group test suite.

Fixes bug 1153477 and fixes bug 1155244.

Change-Id: I2327901634a83f95c5cff4ba91c8c7c32a0ad8af

commit_message:
Basic ring builder validation.

This prevents people from creating bogus ring builder files.

Example: "swift-ring-builder object.builder create 33 0.9 -4".

Fixes bug 924577.

Change-Id: I7bfc04f7fa5f55f70a4eaae96c414f6b2872e283

commit_message:
Give friendly notification in swift-get-nodes

Hard coding of '/srv/node' maybe drive to some errors. But it seems
unfixable (please see talks in bug report). To avoid erros as we can,
showing a friendly notification to let user set their own device
location works better than hard coding directly.

Change-Id: I45d749dd52af8d3b051dfe98dbb9d71a5a374f97
Fixes: bug #907908

commit_message:
Utilize legacy_endpoint_id column (bug 1154918)

This column was created in migration 11 but isn't used because it wasn't
added to the model definition. Attempting to store data here ended up
putting it into 'extra'.

Change-Id: I02680b5213f09fe3cddcf5365104554d3e6d6b8a

[{'created': '2013-03-07 16:30:27.000000000', 'message': "Handle Swift 404 in scrubber

If the image object happened to go missing from the backend, the _delete
function was not catching this exception and caused the app to fall over
constantly.

  avoid printing out credentials.

  every 15 seconds, though the code currently was only waiting 15 seconds.
  I have fixed this up as part of the move.

commit_message:
Handle Swift 404 in scrubber

If the image object happened to go missing from the backend, the _delete
function was not catching this exception and caused the app to fall over
constantly.

Also:
* Log the image id rather than uri in the case of UnsupportedBackend to
  avoid printing out credentials.

* Refactor the 'wait for build servers' snippet into a function.
  Jason Klker's note says the purpose is to wait up to 5 mins, checking
  every 15 seconds, though the code currently was only waiting 15 seconds.
  I have fixed this up as part of the move.

Fixes bug #1152252

Change-Id: Ifb74d7bc95b3245002291396ffabd8c5d729a1ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-18 20:36:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix XenAPI performance issue

This patch implements 'list_instance_uuids' in the xenapi virt driver so
that compute manager's '_get_instances_on_driver' can operate more
efficiently.

Fixes bug 1097980

The cleanup_running_deleted_instances periodic task uses the above call
while context has been modified to be read_deleted='yes'.  Without
list_instance_uuids being implemented in xenapi, there's a fallback to
querying all instances on the host.  Because of read_deleted='yes', this
queries all instances that have ever lived on the host.  In a very busy
environment where instances are repeatedly built and destroyed, one can
end up with thousands of deleted instances.  Now that we are storing
instance_type data in system_metadata and system_metadata is joined with
every instance_get, this results in 10x the number of rows being
returned with sqlalchemy... the fallback doesn't perform well enough.

Change-Id: I4bbfd69c9769807cec813af757665f03d9643460
"}]
commit_message:
Fix XenAPI performance issue

This patch implements 'list_instance_uuids' in the xenapi virt driver so
that compute manager's '_get_instances_on_driver' can operate more
efficiently.

Fixes bug 1097980

The cleanup_running_deleted_instances periodic task uses the above call
while context has been modified to be read_deleted='yes'.  Without
list_instance_uuids being implemented in xenapi, there's a fallback to
querying all instances on the host.  Because of read_deleted='yes', this
queries all instances that have ever lived on the host.  In a very busy
environment where instances are repeatedly built and destroyed, one can
end up with thousands of deleted instances.  Now that we are storing
instance_type data in system_metadata and system_metadata is joined with
every instance_get, this results in 10x the number of rows being
returned with sqlalchemy... the fallback doesn't perform well enough.

Change-Id: I4bbfd69c9769807cec813af757665f03d9643460

commit_message:
Remove unused virt.disk.api methods bind/unbind

The bind and unbind methods were only used by the old LXC
attach/detach volume code which was removed in
https://review.openstack.org/17861 (commit
b8831091a8d097bb55a0e65c3af254a8bfa88811). Remove them.

Fixes bug 1156127

Change-Id: I37b0344970415fe93faabd955b4b4db88de269db

commit_message:
Permit functional tests against Swift with Keystone

While poking at such problems with authentication other than swauth
it was useful to allow stock functional tests running back-to-back
at two clusters, with tempauth and Keystone.

When running the legacy tests, this version packs account into user
the way it was down previously. This way we do not need to repack
them before every call to get_auth. The downside is additional work
to be done when setting ACLs.

Change-Id: Ieb1d9227cb88977ecd2c39825039bc4be8afae0b

[{'created': '2013-03-18 20:45:37.000000000', 'message': "These patches come from our first Marconi hackday. We committed to a github fork in order to facilitate collaboration and quickly get a baseline story completed. Future hackdays will use the regular Gerrit review process.

To avoid Jenkins build errors, I've squashed all commits from the hackday together. May the OpenStack gods have mercy on my soul.

--------------

refactor(tests.util): Remove prepare method support
Trello: #101 (https://trello.com/c/SI7PYnpl)

refactor: Rename Kernel class to make it less confusing.
Trello: #58

refactor: Rename TestSuite to TestBase.
Trello: #102

refactor(wsgi.Driver): Use Falcon

test: Repurpose TestSimple as an example/template

feat(transport.wsgi): Initial create queue test
Trello: #59

Keystone Authentication

Inserted Keystone middleware into Paste Deploy pipeline when running an HTTP transport instance.

Ignoring PyCharm IDE files

Initial implement of the reference storage.

refactor(test): Fixes tests

Deleting redundant file, fixed undefined reference

Trivial variable name change to test git

feat(transport.wsgi): Create queue
Still needs some error handling, but the happy path works now
Trello: #59

fix(transport.wsgi): Return 201 Created instead of 200 OK
Trello: #59

Added copyright to config files

PEP8 fix for wsgi.py

WIP: separate create_or_update.

Tests does not pass; need wsgi changes.

feat(transport.wsgi): Get queue metadata (initial commit)
Still needs error handling, but the happy path is there

fix pep8.

Throw AlreadyExists if creating a duplicate queue.

fix(transport.wsgi): Set location header on response to create queue
Trello: #59

Eliminate two potential race conditions.
1. Create fail, followed by delete, then update fails silently.
2. Use sub-query to do /stats.

feat(transport.wsgi): Set metadata on existing queue
Still needs some error handling, but the happy path works.
Trello: 116

style(tests): Fix pep8/pyflakes errors

chore: Rename AUTHORS so it doesn't get overwritten by setup script

Change-Id: I31c35b1ba29a1b721d073535b8cced7a31362333
chore: Fix merge conflicts

Added copyright to config files

PEP8 fix for wsgi.py

WIP: separate create_or_update.

Tests does not pass; need wsgi changes.

feat(transport.wsgi): Get queue metadata (initial commit)
Still needs error handling, but the happy path is there

fix pep8.

Throw AlreadyExists if creating a duplicate queue.

fix(transport.wsgi): Set location header on response to create queue
Trello: #59

Eliminate two potential race conditions.
1. Create fail, followed by delete, then update fails silently.
2. Use sub-query to do /stats.

feat(transport.wsgi): Set metadata on existing queue
Still needs some error handling, but the happy path works.
Trello: 116

style(tests): Fix pep8/pyflakes errors

chore: Rename AUTHORS so it doesn't get overwritten by setup script

Change-Id: I31c35b1ba29a1b721d073535b8cced7a31362333
chore: Fix merge conflicts
"}]
commit_message:
feat: Create a queue

This patch is an amalgamation of commits from our first Marconi hackday.

We committed to a github fork in order to facilitate collaboration and
quickly get a baseline story completed. Future hackdays will use the
regular Gerrit review process.

To avoid Jenkins build errors, I've squashed all commits from the hackday
together. May the OpenStack gods have mercy on my soul.

--------------

refactor(tests.util): Remove prepare method support
Trello: #101 (https://trello.com/c/SI7PYnpl)

refactor: Rename Kernel class to make it less confusing.
Trello: #58

refactor: Rename TestSuite to TestBase.
Trello: #102

refactor(wsgi.Driver): Use Falcon

test: Repurpose TestSimple as an example/template

feat(transport.wsgi): Initial create queue test
Trello: #59

Keystone Authentication

Inserted Keystone middleware into Paste Deploy pipeline when running an
HTTP transport instance.

Ignoring PyCharm IDE files

Initial implement of the reference storage.

refactor(test): Fixes tests

Deleting redundant file, fixed undefined reference

Trivial variable name change to test git

feat(transport.wsgi): Create queue
Still needs some error handling, but the happy path works now
Trello: #59

fix(transport.wsgi): Return 201 Created instead of 200 OK
Trello: #59

Added copyright to config files

PEP8 fix for wsgi.py

WIP: separate create_or_update.

Tests does not pass; need wsgi changes.

feat(transport.wsgi): Get queue metadata (initial commit)
Still needs error handling, but the happy path is there

fix pep8.

Throw AlreadyExists if creating a duplicate queue.

fix(transport.wsgi): Set location header on response to create queue
Trello: #59

Eliminate two potential race conditions.
1. Create fail, followed by delete, then update fails silently.
2. Use sub-query to do /stats.

feat(transport.wsgi): Set metadata on existing queue
Still needs some error handling, but the happy path works.
Trello: 116

style(tests): Fix pep8/pyflakes errors

chore: Rename AUTHORS so it doesn't get overwritten by setup script

Change-Id: I31c35b1ba29a1b721d073535b8cced7a31362333
chore: Fix merge conflicts

commit_message:
Validate protocol when creating VIP.

Fixes: bug #1123114

When creating a VIP, check that the protocol matches the protocol
for the associated pool. If not, raise an exception.

Change-Id: Iba318eda935ccc89dbe8244e00f36ebdfcce65e0

commit_message:
Add pytest-runner.

It is a dependency of keyring that is only listed in setup_requires
and is therefore not detected by the current version of the mirror
script.

commit_message:
Eliminate two potential race conditions.

1. Create fail, followed by delete, then update fails silently.
2. Use sub-query to do /stats.

Change-Id: Iee8648f3e1524f2a29b11d24f883377be31d2e84

commit_message:
Adds docs for settings/configuration.

In addition to thoroughly documenting the settings and config
options for Horizon/OpenStack Dashboard, this clarifies some
misconceptions around how to enable Object Storage/Swift
and Netowrking/Quantum in the OpenStack Dashboard.

Fixes bug 1064412. DocImpact.

Change-Id: I85fc7592c55111f5bc69a7cdab49679eaf81c6ca

[{'created': '2013-03-15 18:58:34.000000000', 'message': 'swift-ring-builder blows up when not supported command requested.

swift-ring-builder uses outdated unbounded class method to handle
not supported command. It worked for python 2.6 or older but not
for python 2.7 or newer. This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I7dbc681ef6be44f6d79ff93189ccca13c51eab74
Fixes: bug #1154882
'}, {'created': '2013-03-18 13:04:56.000000000', 'message': 'swift-ring-builder blows up when not supported command requested.

swift-ring-builder uses outdated unbounded class method to handle
not supported command. It worked for python 2.6 or older but not
for python 2.7 or newer. This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I7dbc681ef6be44f6d79ff93189ccca13c51eab74
Fixes: bug #1154882
'}]
commit_message:
swift-ring-builder blows up when not supported command requested.

swift-ring-builder uses outdated unbounded class method to handle
not supported command. It worked for python 2.6 or older but not
for python 2.7 or newer. This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I7dbc681ef6be44f6d79ff93189ccca13c51eab74
Fixes: bug #1154882

commit_message:
Improve test coverage for quantum wsgi module

OpenStack quantum.wsgi package includes a lot of classes not covered
with unit tests. This change adds such unit tests.

Fixes: bug #1136027
Change-Id: I16dd35389bf82f2818b74d1fb4cf7f7a6bebce28

'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-03-01 23:37:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

If I understand this changes correct, before we have three states: use memcache client from env, use local memcache client, or no caching. Now we also have three states: use memcache client from env, use local memcache client, or use in-memory cache. That would constitute a change of functionality.

I am not saying its a bad thing. But should we at least document this behavior somewhere. Using cache has security implications. For example, some deployments prefer not using cache in exchange for real-time token validation. Basically making a performance to security trade-off."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-03-02 00:40:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Given that token_cache_time is configurable, couldn't you just set it to a very low value (15s?), and get the best of both worlds?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-03-02 00:43:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

guang-lee: That is a good point. I feel like caching for 5 minutes is almost always useful but perhaps we should probably provide a way to disable it and document that it is enabled. One could use token_cache_time=1 to essentially disable the caching, but perhaps we should have a new config called disable_cache that will turn it off completely?'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-03-02 00:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

s/guang-lee/guang-yee'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-03-02 00:45:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sure. Set it to a low value would have similar effect. All I am saying is that we may need to document this behavior. Either in middewarearchitecture.rst or put a comment in auth_token.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-03-02 00:48:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

In fact i just checked and you can set the time to -1 which will result in essentially no caching, so I think just documenting that is good enough.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-03-02 00:57:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-03-02 00:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

updated the doc.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-03-02 01:04:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Cache tokens using memorycache from oslo.

Verifying tokens accounts for a significant portion of the time taken
by the various api servers. This uses the simple memory cache from
oslo so that there is a simple default cache even if memcached is not
deployed. Also cleans up the tests and removes unnecessary fakes.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I501c14f2f51da058cb574c32d49dd769e6f6ad86

commit_message:
Remove dead code.

This patch removes an unreachable line of code.  Just above this line
was an if/else that had a return in both cases.  This final return False
was unreachable.

Change-Id: Ib71f732d231dd541a4f77d0244dda2c8d9914060

commit_message:
setup.cfg should be used in configuring nose tests

populate nose config object created in run_tests.py with data from
nose config files, such as setup.cfg. Edited setup.cfg to include
useful nose config options. Added a sample logger configuration file
logging_sample.conf

fixes bug #1128582

Change-Id: I8e28ed325a3504de93f719b6d3da3d1dd61587e8

[{'created': '2013-03-16 11:55:27.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure delete domain removes all owned entities

Deleting a domain should delete all Users, Groups and Projects
that are owned by that domain.  This is supported by making sure
that deleting Users/Projects clean up their relevant Tokens and
Credentials (raised as a separate bug, bug fixed here).

To help avoid inadvertent deletion, we insist that a domain must
be disabled before it can be deleted.

In implementing this change, it was discovered that the exception
CredentialNotFound is referenced in the identity backend, but
never defined. This is raised as a separate bug, and fixed here. A
further bug has been raised that this indicates we are lacking in
negative testing for Credentials (not fixed in this change)

Fixes Bug #1097995
Fixes Bug #1155921
Fixes Bug #1155924

Change-Id: Ibc926f8212fb9bd4426088339a21002a07c86984

commit_message:
Ensure delete domain removes all owned entities

Deleting a domain should delete all Users, Groups and Projects
that are owned by that domain.  This is intertwined with making sure
that deleting Users/Projects clean up their relevant Tokens and
Credentials (raised as a separate bug, bug fixed here).

To help avoid inadvertent deletion, we insist that a domain must
be disabled before it can be deleted.

In implementing this change, it was discovered that the exception
CredentialNotFound is referenced in the identity backend, but
never defined - this was needed here for the unit tests. This is raised
as a separate bug, and fixed here. A further bug has been raised
that this indicates we are lacking in negative testing for
Credentials (not fixed in this change)

Fixes Bug #1097995
Fixes Bug #1155921
Fixes Bug #1155924

Change-Id: Ibc926f8212fb9bd4426088339a21002a07c86984

commit_message:
Instruction for multi node setup misses /var/run/swift creation

Multiple Server Swift Installation (Ubuntu) instruction does not
indicate that the directory /var/run/swift needs to be created.
That directory actually needs to be created and the ownship needs
to be changed to the user/group which swift service runs under.

This patch will fix the document and gives the steps how to create
the directory and set the ownership right. It also gives instruction
on how the script can be added so that swift services can be resarted
after system reboots.

Change-Id: Id61aa67cc0d6f66d749701e6ea824b1ff3b2c478
Fixes: bug #1156631

commit_message:
Fix rate limit handling and logging

On rate limit event the request new request sent to the server, but
the original response returned to the caller, instead of the new one.

Other changes:
* Create http_obj in the __init__
* Fix >400 warning
* Simplify rate limit handling
* Ensure exception is raised on 413 response
* The full response body will be part of the 413 exceptions

Change-Id: I6c38c343618f92e0e79843aaa662a3d24026702b

[{'created': '2013-03-15 01:56:17.000000000', 'message': "Fix crash in swift-ring-builder's list_parts command.

If you run list_parts against a builder that has never been
rebalanced, you'd get a crash. Now you don't.

To reproduce:

$ swift-ring-builder foo.builder create 8 3 1
$ swift-ring-builder foo.builder add r1z1-1.2.3.4:6000/sda 100
$ swift-ring-builder foo.builder list_parts z1

Change-Id: Ic3edffab0c5c2e9551a2f89ddb881153f0b07db7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix crash in swift-ring-builder's list_parts command.

If you run list_parts against a builder that has never been
rebalanced, you'd get a crash. Now you don't.

To reproduce:

$ swift-ring-builder foo.builder create 8 3 1
$ swift-ring-builder foo.builder add r1z1-1.2.3.4:6000/sda 100
$ swift-ring-builder foo.builder list_parts z1

Change-Id: Ic3edffab0c5c2e9551a2f89ddb881153f0b07db7

commit_message:
Allow tests in TestDhcpAgentEventHandler run independently

Tests in TestDhcpAgentEventHandler depend on dhcp_confs
option that is defined in quantum.agent.linux.dhcp. We have
to register the option in order to allow independent testing.

This problem is similar to bug #1125951.

Fixes: bug #1156696

Change-Id: I323908c6f70697e056294b1817ff32ce5d32b32c

commit_message:
Fix XML handling of member links (bug 1156594)

This is a was revealed as a blocker for the default_project_id scoping
tests.

Also improves test coverage of XML de/serialization invertibility. The
tests were previously sensitive to things like attribute ordering which
are not relevant to test results. The fix is to compare canonically
serialized XML instead of whatever lxml spews out.

Change-Id: I003583038421d35aadbc781144d4cafb09392db5

commit_message:
Add metadata "interface" in "storage.objects.*.bytes" counter

This allow to create rules against the request environment
to mark the the counter as 'internal' or 'external'

Rules look like this (in the ceilometer filter in /etc/swift/proxy-server.conf)

interface_default = int
interface_rule_1 = HTTP_HOST, 123.123.123.123:8080, ext
interface_rule_2 = SERVER_PORT, 8081, ext
interface_rule_3 = SERVER_NAME, 192.168.3.51, ext

Change-Id: Id34dc516a0d161a2291f647d2128f78adb71897d

commit_message:
libvirt: enable apic setting for Xen or KVM guest.

Bug 1086352

Currently, nova doesn't enable apic setting for Xen or KVM guest
in its libvirt driver. Windows guests would not boot successful in
such case. This patch adds apic setting in libvirt driver for Xen
or KVM guest, which would fix this problem. A check is also added
to libvirt guest config test case for this patch.

(cherry picked from commit d0e930bd9f1bddf6223635fdc463b2176cc39690)

Change-Id: Ie213c9d086f77faf0cdc5a32337c5bf4b828cf5f

subject: Require paramiko >= 1.8.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-12 08:10:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/24149/1/check/gate-noop/662 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-12 21:56:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is a nice example to consider properly

It looks like paramiko 1.8.0 released in Oct 2012 fixed the bug. Can we make it

  paramiko>=1.8.0

instead?

This is the fix AFAICT: https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/commits/f8239015

1.7.6 was released in November 2009

We don't want a newer version for any new APIs, purely for this bugfix

That's a really easily backportable fix, so I expect some of the more conservative distros might consider backporting the fix rather than rebasing to a much more recent version

That said ... this metadata is primarly for people installing deps from pypi and for our test infrastructure and in both cases >=1.7.6 is innacurate

I'd be fine with >=1.8.0"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-03-13 19:02:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Mark."}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-03-15 12:52:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-15 14:02:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Require paramiko >= 1.8.0

There is a well-known bug in the Paramiko SSH library that causes
these Exceptions:
SSHException: Error connecting via ssh: PID check failed. RNG must be
re-initialized after fork(). Hint: Try Random.atfork()

This bug has been fixed in Paramiko, and therefore we should require
the newer version for Cinder drivers that use Paramiko to function
properly.

Change-Id: I0844db1011f8b5c0e771b0e99a83027a13b6ea75
Fixes: bug 1150720

[{'created': '2013-03-13 22:55:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix issues with cells and resize

There are cases where compute API resizez() is called with 'flavor_id'
as a positional argument, so we need to fix up the cells_api version of
resize() to more closely match the super class.

Also: A recent change for storing instance_type info in system_metadata
happened to make an incorrect change, assuming cells_api was for child
cells.. which it's for the API cell.  It needs to pull the instance type
from the DB just like the super class does.

Fixes bug 1154843

Change-Id: Ifdf2a68c3bff6d27d5f192e2eb73f9b79804c2c7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issues with cells and resize

There are cases where compute API resizez() is called with 'flavor_id'
as a positional argument, so we need to fix up the cells_api version of
resize() to more closely match the super class.

Also: A recent change for storing instance_type info in system_metadata
happened to make an incorrect change, assuming cells_api was for child
cells.. which it's for the API cell.  It needs to pull the instance type
from the DB just like the super class does.

Fixes bug 1154843

Change-Id: Ifdf2a68c3bff6d27d5f192e2eb73f9b79804c2c7

commit_message:
Replace create / update with upsert

This patch replaces both methods with a single method upsert. The idea
behind it, as discussed, is to have a single method for handling queue
creation and update.

The method is expected to return Ture when a queue was created and False
when a queue was updated.

Implements blueprint storage-base
Fixes bug 1155657

Change-Id: I367c5a29038acc89dbf60a3df9d8dcbf436037a7

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-03-18 12:26:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

the default is False
class HTTPClient(httplib2.Http):
    USER_AGENT = 'python-quantumclient'

    def __init__(self, username=None, tenant_name=None,
                 password=None, auth_url=None,
                 token=None, region_name=None, timeout=None,
                 endpoint_url=None, insecure=False,
                 auth_strategy='keystone', **kwargs):

so we can not validate the certificates by default.
am I wrong?"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-03-18 12:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-03-18 12:26:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I mean we don't validate the certificate by default.
and self.disable_ssl_certificate_validation is not used in other places after it is assigned value."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-03-18 12:26:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

so if we pass in --insecure, does the httpclient validate the server or not? If we need to validate the server's certificate, don't we need the servers' public certificate specified too?"}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-03-18 12:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Awesome thanks!'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-03-18 12:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-03-18 12:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-03-18 12:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Any chance for this to be approved?'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-03-18 12:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Sorry, I misunderstood you. But validation of SSL certificates has already been enabled by default (as HTTPClient accepts insecure=False). This patch just adds a command line option to set that value to True (not touching the HTTPClient class at all, just ClientManager and command line arguments parsing), which effectively disables certificates checking.

HTTPClient is a subclass of httplib2.Http. httplib2 uses that value internally.'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-03-18 12:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

"insecure=False" means "ensure SSL certificates validation" which, I believe, is a sensible default.

Variable "insecure" is used later in HTTPClient __init__() method:
   ...
   # httplib2 overrides
   self.disable_ssl_certificate_validation = insecure'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-03-18 12:26:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

If we pass --insecure, HTTPClient will not validate the certificate.

That's a good note. To make validation work we must pass a file containing root CA certificates to httplib2.Http __init__() method (although the httplib2 distribution can actually come with some predefined root CA certificates).

So:
1. This patch just adds an --insecure option to disable SSL certificates validation.
2. I'm going to write a patch implementing the https://blueprints.launchpad.net/python-quantumclient/+spec/quantum-client-ssl blueprint to make SSL certificates validation actually work."}, {'account_id': 6945, 'date': '2013-03-18 12:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I agree with Dan's comment about making the option "insecure" rather than "os-insecure" just to be consistent with rest of the OS services' options'}, {'account_id': 6945, 'date': '2013-03-18 12:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Add a missing command line option: --insecure

This option allows to disable SSL certificates validation in HTTPClient.

Fixes bug 1153715

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-15 17:59:43.000000000', 'message': 'Reset migrating task state for more Exceptions

There are a number of exceptions that can occur during pre
live-migration checks, and they should reset the task state to None when
they occur since they prevent the migration from beginning.  This adds
two more exceptions to the list of exceptions that just need to reset
the task state rather than set the instance to error.

Bug 1100462

Change-Id: I95e09f49908fbc3a79f5d2eb490d5a0b3296a6ed
'}]
commit_message:
Reset migrating task state for more Exceptions

There are a number of exceptions that can occur during pre
live-migration checks, and they should reset the task state to None when
they occur since they prevent the migration from beginning.  This adds
two more exceptions to the list of exceptions that just need to reset
the task state rather than set the instance to error.

Bug 1100462

Change-Id: I95e09f49908fbc3a79f5d2eb490d5a0b3296a6ed

commit_message:
Fixes dettach volumes in Windows cinder plugin

The patch fixes issues when desassigning target to initiators
in the terminate_connection method. The method now takes
the right parameter coming from provider location.

Change-Id: I2ea1ac7f46e3a24a6493af8eba46a113126e1117
Fixes: bug #1153968

"}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-12-21 16:25:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

I'm generally for this kind of patch since I think it's a simple solution to the problem.

See my comment about a concern over using os.wait()

Also, have you ensured other resources aren't shared between processes? For instance, if the two processes shared a database connection, that could be catastrophic."}, {'account_id': 1678, 'date': '2012-12-22 07:25:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Johannes, you are right. 

Do you mean we should explicit make a new connection to database, or libvirt to make these process more tidy?

In fact, I'm not sure whether sqlalchemy will make a new connection to MySql when it find the old connection is closed. 

BTW I have deployed the code with this commit for some weeks. And I found the speed of processing RPC request is very fast. But actually we should do more work to make the commit more graceful."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-02-23 18:18:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I really like the idea of separating periodic tasks into a separate process. However, I don't think this should be a config option. We should just use a separate process by default.  If we know running the tasks in parallel is problematic with a specific architecture/hypervisor/etc, let's check for these cases and disable automatically."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-25 09:32:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Rafi - this kind of config option is bad idea - you might as well call it "give_me_bug_1078811=yes|no". We should just do the right thing here automatically with no config option.

On the code in general, your approach of using os.fork() is seriously dangerous. POSIX mandates that if you fork() in a multi-threaded process, you are forbidden from using any system call which is not marked async signal safe. If you ignore this restriction, your code is likely to deadlock randomly. This code certainly violates that restriction.

Instead of using os.fork(), we can either use real threads for instead of green threads, or we need to fork()+exec() nova-compute passing it a flag to tell it which periodic job to run.'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2013-02-26 15:36:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I like the direction this patch is going. Do we need a FFE for this?'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-02-28 15:34:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I very much like the direction this is going, but agree with Daniel's concerns."}, {'account_id': 1678, 'date': '2013-03-02 09:03:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thank you all! your suggestion is cool!

@Daniel, how about creating an new process by using `multiprocessing`? I just know it more graceful than os.fork(). Do you think it can work better?

@Yun Mao, Sorry for my broken English, can you tell me what's 'FFE' ?"}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-03-03 03:35:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

FFE - Feature freeze exception.  In other words, it would be nice to get this into Grizzly if the necessary changes can be made in time and approved by the appropriate folks to get merged for RC1.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-04 10:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I've never used "multiprocessing" but from looking at the docs, it seems like it has the kind of architecture that I was suggesting.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-04 15:56:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

As is this is causing bad things to happen in SmokeStack:

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-21 07:56:45.000000000', 'message': "Extract periodic task into fork process.

Currently, there are three main parallel task in nova-compute.
First, processing RPC request. e.g, launch new instance.
Second, running periodic tasks. e.g, update availability resource of the host.
Third, reporting itself state to ServerGroup. e.g, report state into database.

Because periodic_task may run for a long time, especially when there are a lot
of instance. That can make nova-compute hard to response to RPC request as
quickly as it can. And there are more than one bug was reported for the reason.

Partial descripted in bug #1078811 Bug #1045152

Previously resolution is add 'sleep(0)' into periodic task code,. which is not
good enough to resolve the problems. So I believe that moving the periodic task
into a process is the killer of these bugs.

Change-Id: Ida7065255b900a8e873e18b1644621806ea6d141
"}, {'created': '2013-02-23 06:39:48.000000000', 'message': 'Running periodic tasks in separate process.

Combine periodic tasks and main jobs into one process make service work slow.
Especially when there are lots of instances, periodic tasks will eat lots of
time. What make main server hard to do response to RPC request as quickly as it
can. Since main jobs and periodic tasks share nothing, So extract periodic
tasks into a separate process can work perfectly.

This patch create a new config entry named "use_separate_periodic" to indicate
whether running periodic tasks in separete process. When launcher server,
set one of the processes's enable_periodic to False, and set another to True.
So one process will not run periodic tasks absolutely, another will only run
periodic task.

Fix bug #1078811

Change-Id: Ida7065255b900a8e873e18b1644621806ea6d141
'}]
commit_message:
Running periodic tasks in separate process.

Combine periodic tasks and main jobs into one process make service work slow.
Especially when there are lots of instances, periodic tasks will eat lots of
time. What make main server hard to do response to RPC request as quickly as it
can. Since main jobs and periodic tasks share nothing, So extract periodic
tasks into a separate process can work perfectly.

This patch create a new config entry named "use_separate_periodic" to indicate
whether running periodic tasks in separete process. When launcher server,
set one of the processes's enable_periodic to False, and set another to True.
So one process will not run periodic tasks absolutely, another will only run
periodic task.

Fix bug #1078811

Change-Id: Ida7065255b900a8e873e18b1644621806ea6d141

commit_message:
Use self.configuration to support the multi-backend case

Use self.configuration instead of using FLAGS directly to make
the driver work in a multi backend environment.
And remove three repeated lines:en = out.split('\r\n')

Fixes bug: 1154125

Change-Id: I6e08706104eabb71677ec8583b9abb9711553504

commit_message:
Fix typo in persona valid values

The 3PAR drivers have a persona extra spec that has a valid
values with a typo in it. The value '11 - VMWare' should be
"11 - VMware', note the lower case 'w'.

Fixes bug 1155781

Change-Id: I70ab255e1ec6a4b83437b072a7eb4fe11eafc710

[{'created': '2013-03-17 20:38:21.000000000', 'message': "Create a wsgi factory method for Debug filter.

This can be enabled by putting the following in the *-paste.ini
file:

commit_message:
Create a wsgi factory method for Debug filter.

This can be enabled by putting the following in the *-paste.ini
file:
[filter:debug]
paste.filter_factory = heat.common.wsgi:filter_factory
heat.filter_factory = heat.common.wsgi:debug_filter

and adding 'debug' to the pipeline.

This assisted with bug #1133792

Change-Id: I4c2d3194ac9673d095b4115d4b6f385fd2f4fa4e

commit_message:
Raise no exception for cfn-hup _is_valid_metadata()

Now info is logged that no AWS::CloudFormation::Init
existed in the metadata.
Fixes: bug #1155999

Change-Id: Ice7016c65a5bf18f50c3552629f7a182d48db1f2

commit_message:
rm invalid args when updating quotas with nova api

  1. Remove invalid args "volumes" and "gigabytes" while calling
     nova.tenant_quota_update in UpdateProject and CreateProject
     workflows.

  2. Update related test cases.

Fixes bug 1155876 and fixes bug 1156198.

Change-Id: I3ee9e3b6b4f19452e42129f750bc4bbe0727e343

commit_message:
Correct the related tenant_id when getting quotas

QuotaUsage::_get_quota_data() always get the project quotas by the
requester's tenant_id, which was wrong.

Add a args "tenant_id" which point to the correct project when
getting its quotas.

Fix Bug #1130070

Change-Id: I82f080720235631c430d8a18a44ece013de60a3b

commit_message:
Allow for prettytable 0.7.x as well

Relax requirements to >= 0.6, < 0.8, as 0.7.x seems to
work as well. Lower has been raised to 0.6 to match openstack-common/requirements

Change-Id: Ic8ce818016ae7d9fbfeb1548b612f8d9e8ae7c42

The fix for unit-tests here e02b45976fe4468ad70c886255f1af71652ce4f9
accidentally removed a parameter that was being used from the
_validate_console call. This adds it back.

Fixes bug 1156316

Change-Id: Ibe472c7fb5f656ebfa0f645feebaf13829acabc7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issue with consoleauth after security fix.

The fix for unit-tests here e02b45976fe4468ad70c886255f1af71652ce4f9
accidentally removed a parameter that was being used from the
_validate_console call. This adds it back.

Fixes bug 1156316

Change-Id: Ibe472c7fb5f656ebfa0f645feebaf13829acabc7

commit_message:
Check keypair destroy result operation

This checks the result of delete operation over keypairs to see if it
affected any row (this is what delete returns), if not raises
KeyPairNotFoundException.

Also adds tests for keypair db api.

Fix bug 1086980

Change-Id: I7e822c0661c563db01040ae2d57aacfe677d72b0

commit_message:
Add standard methods to the Limits API

- Added create, delete, detail, show, and update
  stubs to the Limits API
- Added unit test cases
Fixes bug 869877

Change-Id: I112a8016ff2cf83009b3bcfe2fe6307568ce7334

commit_message:
Revert "Remove the usage of instance['extra_specs'

This reverts commit 76c47c1c3057d5ee479cf1e55b803f5ac9faba1d.

Fix libvirt vif get_config interface breakage.

In 76c47c1 we added a new arg to the libvirt vif driver get_config
interface (instance_type=None). We did not update all the libvirt
drivers to use it however which can break things badly (instances
fail to spawn, etc). We clearly need more test coverage here as well.

This should fix SmokeStack.

Fixes LP Bug #1155950.

Change-Id: I073d119ea2bfd5c314d2d8c8bbf2f6d7d649753a

commit_message:
Fix use of libvirt_disk_prefix

The code supporting libvirt_disk_prefix was dropped during the
refactoring work in commit 7be531fe.  This patch re-enables
support for this option, along with a test case to verify it.

Change-Id: I84f059e2b35d9237b799236032de5c272a03a451

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-15 22:46:47.000000000', 'message': 'Store project_id for instance actions

When packing values to store for an instance action, include the project
id from the request context.  This allows tracking which tenant has
performed an action.

Bug 1155801

Change-Id: I07b986655581fd6fbfdced90eb3151019f18ada7
'}]
commit_message:
Store project_id for instance actions

When packing values to store for an instance action, include the project
id from the request context.  This allows tracking which tenant has
performed an action.

Bug 1155801

Change-Id: I07b986655581fd6fbfdced90eb3151019f18ada7

commit_message:
rstrip() strips characters, not strings

Fixes bug 1155761

This use of rstrip() could end stripping off more than just the ".gz"
suffix if the filename contains any of the ".gz" characters at the end
of the string.

Change-Id: Id75388453f286ca7b05bab51c9826c43c10ef516

commit_message:
Update migration 153 for efficiency.

Currently migration 153 inserts 10 rows per instance in the database.
For new/small installations this is relatively quick, but for large
installations this can take some time.

This change modifies the migration to only insert records for
non-deleted instances and makes bulk inserts (10 rows are inserted
with each query, instead of 1 per query) for added speed.

Fixes bug 1155371

Change-Id: I88a6cec2c117368fda6eefd82150106a1542027d

It's good as is.

However one improvement I'd like to see is that failure to inject the key, should not mean a failed build; it should continue without the key installed.

As a user, I'd rather have it build, then let me log in and fix things up, than fail. But it definitely needs to communicate to the user that it was unable to inject the key.

This is of course, up for debate, and is likely more in the scope of a new, different patch."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-12 21:02:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Comstud: This looks fine to me.

Regarding your Note about having '/root/.ssh
pre-created with modes 0700 on those directories.'.

So right now you are running inject_ssh_key before any other files are injected. If you were to reverse this order (and run inject_ssh_key afterwards) then you could write another file to '/root/.ssh' via personalities... which I think would cause nova-agent to create that directory for you right? This would essentially provide a way to inject ssh keys into images without having /root/.ssh pre-created right?"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-03-15 22:04:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Dan:  Maybe I should clarify this.  inject_ssh_key uses the exact same code as file injection (it's the same agent call).   That agent call *does* create directories.  However, the agent doesn't accept any permissions arguments and it defaults to creating directories as 755.  So you must make sure to pre-create with 700.

One may have created an image where /root is 755 (which is silly, but I see it all of the time) and it should be 700, too.  sshd tends to be picky about this."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-03-17 14:10:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-17 14:11:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: No score

commit_message:
Make ssh key injection work with xenapi agent

If there's 'key_data' on an instance, and instance is not Windows, use
file injection to inject /root/.ssh/authorized_keys.  If a user
specifies their own /root/.ssh/authorized_keys via 'injected files',
that will take precedence.

Fixes bug 1152713

Note: Images for Xen that use nova-agent will need to have /root/.ssh
pre-created with modes 0700 on those directories.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I190c6b3f67099061b5316baa45b8bfcd1a5e53f6

'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-02-28 09:19:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Well, I like the following idea, depicted in the bug discussion more:

I think we should just remember the data that's entered when the Dialog gets opened again, we just open it with the data that was entered. We could do this by hiding the element instead of complete deleting it and showing it again. This seems better for user experience.

Workflow:
1. User clicks outside of the dialog or clicks cancel > The dialog gets hidden with the entered data
2. User clicks on the same button which opens the previous dialog > The previous dialog with the entered data should be opened again

If needed we can add a clear button which sets all values to default?
Anybody who thinks this is good. Seems a downside is that there may be data that needs to be refreshed?"}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2013-02-28 15:56:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I have two issues with the approach suggested above.

1. The current behavior of dismissing a modal dialog by clicking on a backdrop that's general purpose is to block events is a strange user experience. The current approach basically could be rendered as a giant close button around the modal content which would be clearer to the user The suggested approach does nothing to address that.

2. There are many modal triggers on a page that have varied purposes: detail, edit, and create. For detail, one would imagine a data refresh is desired. For edit, the above proposal may make sense, but there is the potential to either have to save the data for multiple modals or maintain multiple modals which is a fairly invasive change that alters the current modal life-cycle. For create, we have to make a guess as to the user's intention: did they inadvertantly close the dialog and want the saved values, or are they starting over? I think that type of approach would introduce the potential for a great number of bugs over user expectations and varied modal utilization. And all this is to mask the fact we are closing modals in an unexpected manner.

My personal preference would be to not close the modal when clicking on the backdrop, but since this issue seems to have been previously debated and the compromise seemed reasonable. I have proposed that in code."}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-03-01 14:54:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thank you for the contribution David. This approach seems reasonable to me. Reopening a window with the previously entered data could work well for Create forms but could cause confusion for the Edit forms IMO.

A couple of things I found testing the patch:

- The Yes and No buttons are small, it would be nice to include keyboard shortcuts to activate the buttons. "No" is highlighted which to me hints that pressing Enter would activate that option (it doesn't). A "nice to have" possibly.

- To try and escape the confirmation window, I pressed Esc and the modal at the back with my data disappeared, but not the Yes/No confirmation window.

- It doesn't work very well with workflows using multiple modals, e.g. Create User -> start filling the form -> Click on + besides "Project" to create a new Project -> come back to the User form. The confirmation will work with the Project modal but not the User modal anymore, even if changes are made. It's no different from the current behaviour, but does make the new behaviour feel a bit inconsistent.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-09 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-09 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2013-03-09 15:01:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Restored

commit_message:
Preventing potential data loss in modals

Adding a confirmation dialog which appears when changes have been
made to a modal form and the user then clicks on the modal backdrop.

Instead of closing automatically and causing potential loss of work,
the user is provided a dialog that will allow the user to either
retain the form and the entered values or dismiss the modal and lose
the work.  If the user has not made any changes to the form, the
auto-dismiss behavior is maintained.

Fixes: bug #1062065
Change-Id: Idd2d2be639a9d015c6180b48dc5f11182c76bf9b

commit_message:
Refactor RPC API into quantum.api.rpc directory

In addition, change update_lease_expiration from cast to call
so that it will not RPC flood server.

'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-03-06 17:18:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Work In Progress

The solution isn't perfect yet.  Might need some change be made in oslo."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-08 11:08:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I've pushed a series of commits to I4360d5b9ec6df2246a6b963b296b11de3536e127 which show how your patch can be split up

Trying to fix too many different things in one patch makes it very difficult to review thoroughly"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-08 11:20:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not merge

I think there's a pretty fundamental problem with what you're trying to do

All arguments to nova-manage commands can be passed as an optional or positional argument ... even if the argument is required

This was the original behaviour of nova-manage, so we need to retain support for it. I don't claim the original behaviour is a good idea :)

i.e. both of these are valid commands:

  $> nova-manage floating create 172.31.0.1/30
  $> nova-manage floating create --ip_range 172.31.0.1/30

Unless we can get argparse to implement this behaviour, we need to a) add all args as optional args, b) allow an unlimited number of positional args and c) use cliutils to check that all the required args were supplied

I know this means we have:

 usage: nova-manage floating create [--ip_range <range>]
                                    [action_args [action_args ...]]

 positional arguments:
  action_args

 optional arguments:
   --ip_range <range>    IP range

But it's not clear how else we can implement the original behaviour"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-08 11:28:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Trying this out:

 $> bin/nova-manage --config-file=etc/nova/nova.conf.sample floating create --ip_range 172.31.0.1/30
 nova-manage floating create: error: argument --action_kwarg_ip_range is required
 $> bin/nova-manage --config-file=etc/nova/nova.conf.sample floating create 172.31.0.1/30
 nova-manage floating create: error: argument --action_kwarg_ip_range is required'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-08 11:30:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Whatever we do here should also be done in nova-baremetal-manage too'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-03-09 18:15:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Thanks for splitting the patch.  My opinions about how we can fix some of the problems:

1) metavar and dest issue. Right now nova-manage needs metavar to cover the ugly dest because dest has to be prefixed; dest has to be prefixed because oslo.config lacking of a method to retrieve value of argument in the case when there is config option with same name as argument. Therefore, I believe the right thing to do is fix cfg module in oslo.config.  Another proof is when argument is added as positional (e.g. newly added argument for HostCommands/LogCommands, and every argument that is required in nova-baremetal-manage), 'dest' is not available due to argparse's limitation which means the prefix trick is not applicable anymore.  That's why you saw the error when tried out my last patch because I was trying to apply same prefix magic to args too, but that obviously doesn't work.

2) I missed the part that following two forms both worked:
 'nova-manage floating create --ip_range 172.16.1.0/24'
 'nova-manage floating create 172.16.1.0/24'
So removing general action_args break compatibility. And adding 'required=True' also _breaks_ compatibility.  It seems the only improvement can be made for this issue is to make help message more clear (while still very confusing because the fact that allow 2nd way to invoke the command in examples above means it is _not_ really required.)"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-17 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-17 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-26 03:10:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix nova-manage sub-command argument processing

The legacy implementation added double dash '--' to every arguments of
sub-commands. To remain compatiable of this (i.e. legacy automation scripts
based on nova-manage), after converting to OSLO's cfg, which is based on
python argparse module, double dash remains.
However, current implementation doesn't distinguish required/optional
arguments of sub-command, but instead using a late-check
(cliutils.validate_args()) to verify if enough parameters have been supplied
before executing the commands.  While this does prevents invalid input of
arguments but the out-put after detecting a missing argument problem isn't
helpful at all.  A easier and elegant way is to make arguement claration
correct, then argparse will verify input for us and prompt meaningful error
message.  What's more, treating every arguement as optional (that's how
argparse sees the arguments) makes help message very very confusing. Last
but no least, current implementation adds a 'action_args' argument to every
sub-command which takes multiple optional arguements (nargs='*'), this
doesn't make sense since each sub-command defines what arguments they need,
there's no need to add an additional general action_args.

This patch does following to fix issues mentioned above:
 * remove unnecessary 'metavar' for arguements;
 * add 'required=True' to those required arguments while keeping double dash;
 * remove all 'dest' of arguments;
 * add missing argument declaration for HostCommands and LogCommands;
 * add missing help message for CellCommands;
 * change the way nova-mange to retrieve arguments of sub-commands;
 * remove general 'action_args';
 * remove cliutils.validate_args() since it's not needed anymore;

Fix bug #1092605

Change-Id: I60bfeec5ffbc35bef5a18de142b265c621d951b4

commit_message:
Fix nova-manage sub-command argument processing

The legacy implementation added double dash '--' to every argument of
sub-commands. To remain compatible of this (i.e. legacy automation scripts
based on nova-manage), after converting to OSLO's cfg, which is based on
python argparse module, double dash remains.
However, current implementation doesn't distinguish required/optional
arguments of sub-command, but instead using a late-check
(cliutils.validate_args()) to verify if enough parameters have been supplied
before executing the commands.  While this does prevent invalid input of
arguments but the out-put after detecting a missing argument problem isn't
helpful at all.  A easier and elegant way is to make arguement declaration
correct, then argparse will verify input for us and prompt meaningful error
message.  What's more, treating every argument as optional (that's how
argparse sees the arguments) makes help message very very confusing. Last
but not least, current implementation adds a 'action_args' argument to every
sub-command which takes multiple optional arguements (nargs='*'), this
doesn't make sense since each sub-command defines what arguments they need,
there's no need to add an additional general action_args.

This patch does following to fix issues mentioned above:
 * remove unnecessary 'metavar' for arguements;
 * add 'required=True' to those required arguments while keeping double dash;
 * remove redundant 'dest' for arguments;
 * add missing argument declaration for HostCommands and LogCommands;
 * add missing help message for CellCommands;
 * change the way nova-mange to retrieve arguments of sub-commands;
 * remove general 'action_args';
 * remove cliutils.validate_args() since it's not needed anymore;

Fix bug #1092605

Change-Id: I60bfeec5ffbc35bef5a18de142b265c621d951b4

commit_message:
Add tests and doc entry for request.environ[reseller_request]

The recent account_quotas (https://review.openstack.org/23434)
patch added a new setting request.environ[reseller_request].
This patch adds tests for tempauth and keystoneauth as well as
an updated overview_auth.rst.

Change-Id: Icdb7ec9948ae7424b0721fc51a143782b2fdc5a6

commit_message:
Add slicing tool to the master branch

This patch added tools used for slicing and merging in translation process.
The patch also includes the POT files for each documents.
The PO files are not included, which can be downloaded from Transifex.

Fixes: bug #1153415
Change-Id: Ia455134c99acb1129e8f10deda0d85867b1ef9a3

commit_message:
Fix configuration examples with inline comments

The configuration parser does not support comments after a
configuration value, so blindly copying the examples could
result in a non-functioning system.

Fixes bug #1147767

Change-Id: I91071c08f08901dd4a0dec18468c28097c96f8b4

commit_message:
Remove the usage of instance['extra_specs'].

Instance type extra specs is remove from instance dict, so use inst_type['extra_specs']
instead of instance['extra_specs'].

fix bug #1146253

Change-Id: I1d3542e5142f490269607b779daa507f9d7b36e4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-08 20:48:03.000000000', 'message': "Fix circular dependencies in dashboard settings

Importing horizon.utils from dashboard local_settings.py to generate
SECRET_KEY results in a sequence of imports, and horizon.conf.default
module gets imported at some point. During initialization of default
HORIZON_CONFIG this module uses settings.LOGIN_REDIRECT_URL and
ugettext() call. Both of them need django settings to be ready to use,
therefore settings initialization starts again before it could finish.

Since Python processes module only when it is imported the first time,
this process stops, but the 'inner' settings object contains only
parameters that were set above the point of import of local_settings.
Therefore Django complains about missing SECRET_KEY when it processes
'inner' settings.

The fix removes the dependency of horizon.conf.default from
django.conf.settings and replaces ugettext() with ugettext_lazy().
That also improves consistency with lazy nature of HORIZON_CONFIG,
since django.conf.settings is explicitly imported only at _setup() of
LazySettings.

Change-Id: If63ab1920ecc8e646fd5b6cc52c106ae0876fa2d
"}, {'created': '2013-03-13 12:41:06.000000000', 'message': "Fix circular dependencies in dashboard settings

Importing horizon.utils from dashboard local_settings.py to generate
SECRET_KEY results in a sequence of imports, and horizon.conf.default
module gets imported at some point. During initialization of default
HORIZON_CONFIG this module uses settings.LOGIN_REDIRECT_URL and
ugettext() call. Both of them need django settings to be ready to use,
therefore settings initialization starts again before it could finish.

Since Python processes module only when it is imported the first time,
this process stops, but the 'inner' settings object contains only
parameters that were set above the point of import of local_settings.
Therefore Django complains about missing SECRET_KEY when it processes
'inner' settings.

The fix moves the import of horizon.conf.default to
LazySetting._setup(). If keys of HORIZON_CONFIG obtained from
horizon.conf are not used within openstask_dashboard settings.py
or local_settings.py, the circular import won't happen.

Fixes bug #1154564

Change-Id: If63ab1920ecc8e646fd5b6cc52c106ae0876fa2d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix circular dependencies in dashboard settings

Importing horizon.utils from dashboard local_settings.py to generate
SECRET_KEY results in a sequence of imports, and horizon.conf.default
module gets imported at some point. During initialization of default
HORIZON_CONFIG this module uses settings.LOGIN_REDIRECT_URL and
ugettext() call. Both of them need django settings to be ready to use,
therefore settings initialization starts again before it could finish.

Since Python processes module only when it is imported the first time,
this process stops, but the 'inner' settings object contains only
parameters that were set above the point of import of local_settings.
Therefore Django complains about missing SECRET_KEY when it processes
'inner' settings.

The fix moves the import of horizon.conf.default to
LazySetting._setup(). If keys of HORIZON_CONFIG obtained from
horizon.conf are not used within openstask_dashboard settings.py
or local_settings.py, the circular import won't happen.

Fixes bug #1154564

Change-Id: If63ab1920ecc8e646fd5b6cc52c106ae0876fa2d

commit_message:
Display port link between router and extra network

A port link between router and extra network was not displayed
with demo account. This commit fixed the bug. Also remove dead
link when port has no link.

fixes bug 1131082

Change-Id: I50c469e55e0b8435b95f03b191a04e27017fc37e

commit_message:
Add support for nova quantum security group proxy

This commit adds the following options:
NOVA_QUANTUM_SECURITY_GROUP_PROXY which by default is set to True.

Fixes bug 1131333

So I ran this using two different test cases:
Test case 1:  my standard devstack setup ldap config.  This one worked perfectly.  Your code created the _member_ role correctly and I was then able to add a person to a project and they were added to the _member_ role.  That was great.

Test case 2:  I updated my ldif file and added a project and a user in the member attribute of the project. My assumption was that your code would migrate this user.  Your code did not appear to run (do I need to enable it?) and it did not move the user from the project like I believe it was supposed to. commit_message:
Backport changes from possible oslo-hacking.

In prep to make a pip installable package with our dev tools, backport the
patches from oslo-hacking into oslo-incubabor so that we can do a proper
git filter-branch to make the new repo.

https://github.com/emonty/oslo-hacking has a stab at an oslo-hacking.

Change-Id: I8e0261711b9befc97adead088b1567e61c5367ab

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-16 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

'}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-03-16 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Vipul - I'd have to look closer at hosts to make sure there's nothing different in that particular call.

I have a feeling there will be consensus around creating a flag for this, but we should bring it up next meeting. 

By default we'd use whatever is available in standard Nova now. Then if the extensions are set, will return other fields. I think if possible we should always return only extra fields with the extension to make things simpler, which means we may occasionally get new fields in our MGMT API. I don't think that would matter but I'll ask around to be sure.

I'll go ahead and create a blue print for this."}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-03-16 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Let me apologize for this oversight on our part.

The MGMT API uses Nova extensions which we make use of. "rdservers" is one such extension. 

Mike has made part of this public, located here: https://github.com/hub-cap/mgmt-extensions
There is a client component to this as well. I'll try to commit that part to the public soon.

We may need to discuss what to do here as these functions are used all the time by our operations team. My initial thoughts are that we'll create a flag that will tell us if these Nova extensions are available, and if not simply avoid showing the additional fields.'}, {'account_id': 1925, 'date': '2013-03-16 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Let's change it to be flag driven then.  We should have the default behavior be something that requires an extension.

Maybe I don't fully understand the use case, but it seems like some of the extensions like 'list hosts' is already part of the API?

http://api.openstack.org/api-ref.html -- "v2/{tenant_id}/os-hosts"

So it seems we may be able to move away from the extension?'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-16 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-16 06:03:01.000000000', 'message': "Fixed error 500 in rd mgmt cli instance list

The problem is that nova client no longer returns a 'rdservers' attribute and
some of the attribute expected in rdservers are no longer there.

Fixed by using 'servers' instead. The 'server' attribute no longer
has delete and delete_at variable anymore.

fixed Bug #1130933

Change-Id: Ib8746c228e37a0d5681e357856da5ac022f4a149
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed error 500 in rd mgmt cli instance list

The problem is that nova client no longer returns a 'rdservers' attribute and
some of the attribute expected in rdservers are no longer there.

Fixed by using 'servers' instead. The 'server' attribute no longer
has delete and delete_at variable anymore.

fixed Bug #1130933

Change-Id: Ib8746c228e37a0d5681e357856da5ac022f4a149
