commit_message:
Adds support for the DHCP DNS domain search option (RFC 3397) per subnet

Added dns_searchdomains to Subnet
If dns_searchdomain is specified, then write dhcp option in dnsmasq conf
Modified api to allow dns_searchdomains to be set
Updated linux_dhcp test cases to include the domain search option

Change-Id: I57d45d1664a18d89fbb46bcc74c2a09f8b786e0b
Fixes: bug #1108644

Fix pep8 issues

Change-Id: I55c667ca3fb7d8bae4aa738fb8f60003f7c1227a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-09 04:48:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix rabbit_max_retry

First, the configvar is defined as a StrOpt. This means that the check
against the integer retry_attempts will fail.

Secondly, rabbit_max_retries is tested as a boolean before comparing
against retry_attempts. With the value 0, this would be false and the
setting rabbit_max_retries=0 would actually retry indefinitely, which is
not the obvious behavior. This patch will make the default not to
retry at all (which was the implied, but not actual, behavior)

Fixes bug 1152866

Change-Id: Ic39d708f0294fc5d919cb2a5d9fae532128ef17e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbit_max_retry

First, the configvar is defined as a StrOpt. This means that the check
against the integer retry_attempts will fail.

Secondly, rabbit_max_retries is tested as a boolean before comparing
against retry_attempts. With the value 0, this would be false and the
setting rabbit_max_retries=0 would actually retry indefinitely, which is
not the obvious behavior. This patch will make the default not to
retry at all (which was the implied, but not actual, behavior)

Fixes bug 1152866

Change-Id: Ic39d708f0294fc5d919cb2a5d9fae532128ef17e

commit_message:
Discard null endpoints (bug 1152632)

If a v2 client passed {..., "adminurl": null, ...} in a endpoint-create
request, then the null value was being persisted on an endpoint with a
different interface value (i.e. a publicly facing endpoint would have an
"adminurl": null value inexplicably attached to it.)

This change simply pops null urls from the endpoint and discards them.

Change-Id: Idd0964b6ec34fbc8b979253d32f655ea9797f259

commit_message:
Fix scrubber and other utils to use log.setup().

scrubber and other utils call config.setup_logging(),
which does not read the 'default_log_levels' config option.
Fix this problem by calling log.setup(), just like what
glance-api and glance-registry do.

Per John Bresnahan's comment, made the change to check
the existence of log conf file in oslo-incubator code.
Refer to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24230/

Change-Id: I4a53d74c4cd8274a3174b246207a6ed76c5e31c6
Fixes: bug #1153432

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-15 21:01:15.000000000', 'message': 'Revert 1154253 causes XenServer image compat issue

In 1154253 we:

  Drop gzip flag from tar command for OVF archives

While support more OVF file formats is a worthy goal the approach
in 1154253 is going to cause serious issues for existing
Nova XenServer users who are already zipping their OVS images.

I would also point out that our utils.py xenserver plugins still
zips tarballs we create (see create_tarball) so the new code
causes internal inconsistencies as well.

This should fix SmokeStack.

Fixes LP Bug #1155783.

Change-Id: Iff6db314c0dec6df2e48d98db2a547f6624b9d9a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert 1154253 causes XenServer image compat issue

In 1154253 we:

  Drop gzip flag from tar command for OVF archives

While support more OVF file formats is a worthy goal the approach
in 1154253 is going to cause serious issues for existing
Nova XenServer users who are already zipping their OVS images.

I would also point out that our utils.py xenserver plugins still
zips tarballs we create (see create_tarball) so the new code
causes internal inconsistencies as well.

This should fix SmokeStack.

Fixes LP Bug #1155783.

Change-Id: Iff6db314c0dec6df2e48d98db2a547f6624b9d9a

commit_message:
extracting user and trust ids into normalized fields

These fields are used for queries, and may need to be indexed
Also moves the delete token for... functions into the base class
for controllers.

Removed the token API revoke token call as that needed access to other
APIs.  Logic was moved into the controller.

Bug 1152801

Change-Id: I59c360fe5aef905dfa30cb55ee54ff1fbe64dc58

add-interface/set-gateway/create-router actions in Admin Router panel
are no longer needed since all of these operations now can be done by
regular users. Moreover, there is a bug that admin cannot add an

Consindering the above, this commit remove forms create/modifying

commit_message:
Remove router actions from Admin panel

add-interface/set-gateway/create-router actions in Admin Router panel
are no longer needed since all of these operations now can be done by
regular users. Moreover, there is a bug that admin cannot add an
interface of other tenant to a router in Admin Router panel and the
behavior is confusing for users.

Consindering the above, this commit remove forms create/modifying
quantum routers. After the commit admin router panel just provides
the list of routers of all tenants and removes them.

Fixes bug #1153754

Change-Id: Ie17601b260fc6584ba21cd19dc9492bf16b267c1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-14 17:50:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix db archiving bug with foreign key constraints.

Fixes bug 1137977

A few Nova tables have foreign key constraints on other tables.
Deleting a row whose id is referenced as an enforced foreign key for
another table results in an error.

The fix is to detect the IntegrityError when we attempt to delete a row,
and exit from archive_deleted_rows_for_table early.  The parent
archive_deleted_rows function will continue deleting from other tables,
including the one whose dependence on this row caused the IntegrityError,
and things will eventually sort themselves out.

Change-Id: I0afdfe0778057abc5fd269a20bfa4c4ca3a7b003
'}, {'created': '2013-03-14 18:08:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix db archiving bug with foreign key constraints.

and things will eventually sort themselves out.

Change-Id: I0afdfe0778057abc5fd269a20bfa4c4ca3a7b003
'}, {'created': '2013-03-15 13:18:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix db archiving bug with foreign key constraints.

'}]
commit_message:
Fix db archiving bug with foreign key constraints.

Fixes bug 1137977

A few Nova tables have foreign key constraints on other tables.
Deleting a row whose id is referenced as an enforced foreign key for
another table results in an error.

The fix is to detect the IntegrityError when we attempt to delete a row,
and exit from archive_deleted_rows_for_table early.  The parent
archive_deleted_rows function will continue deleting from other tables,
including the one whose dependence on this row caused the IntegrityError,
and things will eventually sort themselves out.

Change-Id: I0afdfe0778057abc5fd269a20bfa4c4ca3a7b003

commit_message:
Implement some logic in abstract methods

Since there're some checks that will be common between implementations
(MIN_TTL <= TTL <= MAX_TTL, for example), this patch adds a first set of
logic and tests fro *Base classes

Implements blueprint storage-base

Change-Id: I9e543ef2e2624bd5483e6d2392d0a9aeff5b0416

subject: Changes 1153108: Fixing test_preattach_status_volume
messages:
[{'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-03-15 20:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thanks for looking at this Sam, but there's actually an interesting problem with state in this test (possibly others).

I added some notes to the bug here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1153108

Basically the problem is we have different state and it looks like code path between running the test individually (run_tests.sh cinder.tests.test_volume) or running the entire suite of tests.

Your change just fixes the "entire suite" case but then the individual test is now going to get unexpected results.

I haven't looked at root cause on this yet, but you get the idea.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-15 20:28:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

swift port selection is still really suboptimal. 6011 is often used
by ssh x-forwarding, so if you are sshed into the box with
x-forwarding, then one of the swift services doesn't start.

disable this until we figure out a better path to port selection.

Change-Id: I62b9f96f24118ddfc962715e55b34c05dbe03a1b
"}]
commit_message:
turn off swift by default

swift port selection is still really suboptimal. 6011 is often used
by ssh x-forwarding, so if you are sshed into the box with
x-forwarding, then one of the swift services doesn't start.

disable this until we figure out a better path to port selection.

Change-Id: I62b9f96f24118ddfc962715e55b34c05dbe03a1b

commit_message:
Use default swift pipeline and add extras.

- By default use the default pipeline as shipped with swift.
- Add option SWIFT_EXTRAS_MIDDLEWARE which by default include tempurl
  formpost staticweb bulk to enable extra featuress.
- Clean pids in cleanup_swift Fix bug 1140364.

Rebased

Change-Id: Ida537ae8d3e319a5b84546f82ebf00615f070be1

[{'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-05 22:42:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It looks like this problem is bigger than originally expected.

Confirmed by running 'nova --debug service-disable  precise64 nova-compute'

But the return value don't align.

novaclient expects:
 ['Host', 'Service', 'Disabled']

(even though it sends  {"host": host, "binary": binary})

But this returns: 
 RESP BODY: {"service": {"status": "enabled", "binary": "nova-compute", "host": "precise64"}}'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-05 22:44:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

"}, {'account_id': 5174, 'date': '2013-03-05 23:53:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hey Dan, I know that I'm being annoying  with this fix idea against changes on api, but I really think we should deal with this consistency issues on the next api version, scheduled to havanna. consistency is one of my main concerns to make it better for sure.

As you see this fails to api samples tests, besides the documentation purpose the other point we tried to reach with  it was avoid changes like that during the same api version.

And as I said in that other review about os-services, I'm totally willing to change my vote once someone points a good reason to make it right now."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-06 00:05:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

joe: Yes. I was planning on throwing up a novaclient branch to fix this as well once this lands. My thought was to make it so Novaclient prints:

Binary | Host | Status

so that it matches the output of list.

At first I considered changing just novaclient (hacking it) but this API seems inconsistent with itself and doesn't quite match some of the patterns we return in other extensions anyway (like returning {'service': } for the update)."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-06 00:07:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Mauru:

This is an API extension and as such isn't subject to API version like other things. I totally agree that we should avoid breaking this... but this doesn't appear to have been working to begin with so I say lets make it how we want it."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-06 00:22:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Dan, sounds good.'}, {'account_id': 6450, 'date': '2013-03-08 12:57:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hey Dan,

This bug is a duplicate of bug 1145768 that I am working on that has a review up[1] to revert the API changes made to novaclient that broke things initially [2].

We should really synchronize our efforts here. The thing is that the original patch introduced API changes to more than just the services extension and those still need to be reverted.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/23849/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/18578/'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-08 14:04:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hans: I agree that we have some novaclient issues. The point of this patchset is that Nova's os-services API is inconsistent within itself. I would like to fix that... and follow that up by making novaclient work with these changes as well."}, {'account_id': 6450, 'date': '2013-03-08 16:33:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I understand. Should I move ahead and see if I can merge my patch and then let you make whatever changes needed in novaclient or should I try to separate things in my patch so that I leave the current (and not working) services extension as is?'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-03-09 00:25:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Make os-services API extensions consistent.

Updates the os-services API extension so that it is consistent
internally (index and update return similar formats), and so
that it works with the recent novaclient code which sends
the following request body format:

  {"binary": "nova-cert", "host": "nova1"}

Also, updates the response body format of the update call so that it
wraps things in an extra service dict which should make novaclient
happier here as well (and is consistent with other extensions too).

Fixes LP Bug #1147746.

Change-Id: I932160d64fdd3aaeb2ed90a092ecc7a36dcc9665

commit_message:
Make conductor's quota methods pass project_id properly

Commit 652a487ed9daba9ae97f7df77ae35720322d1af3 added a workaround for
project_id on conductor's quota methods. This fully plumbs project_id
through to the manager (and thus the quota implementation) and removes
the tests that verify the workaround.

Fixes bug 1153795

Change-Id: I7cd5e3de39acfaba7831892aff6c754569c8e1bf

'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-12 23:54:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

How exactly does this review fix 1154117? Bug states that the error message is 'Host %(host)s could not be found.' and we need to make sure host variable is set for the bug to be fixed. How does the str() pick up the 'host'?"}, {'account_id': 6450, 'date': '2013-03-13 08:08:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Its not the str() but rather the use of e instead of e.message that does the trick.

Exceptions like HostNotFound in this case, that derive from NovaException redefine the class variable message to be a parameterized string.

When an exception of that class is later raised, the missing parameters are given as args and used to fill in the parameterized string, but the now complete message is never stored in NovaException. It is only passed on as the single argument to the standard exception class being its super class and hence can only be retrieved by calling str(e) or unicode(e) on the exception itself while e.message still contains the original parameterized string.

Maybe message should be renamed _message to make it clear that this is a private variable that should not be used external to the class.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-13 10:24:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

thanks for the explanation!'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-03-13 20:27:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Can you add a test to verify that this now works as expected and resolves the bug?'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-13 21:03:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Fix: improve API error responses from os-hosts extension

Modify responses to include the actual host instead of %(host)s.

Resolves bug 1154117.

Change-Id: Ic680403bdf1cb1fc1ac184352f486390fb04a195

subject: adding a new option to proxy-logging so that it could append a seed to the swift transaction id. This is very useful if one manages more than one swift cluster that way one can identify where that transaction id belogs to instead of search over all swift clusters. Also updated sample and manpage to reflect the changes.

Change-Id: Ic0c9c5dfca79ea742134ce162a15e02a524985cc
'}]
commit_message:
adding a new option to proxy-logging so that it could append
a seed to the swift transaction id. This is very useful if one
manages more than one swift cluster that way one can identify
where that transaction id belogs to instead of search over all
swift clusters. Also updated sample and manpage to reflect the
changes.

Change-Id: Ic0c9c5dfca79ea742134ce162a15e02a524985cc

commit_message:
Pin SQLAlchemy to 0.7.x

0.7.10 has been released and is compatible with 0.7.x. Instead
of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

Unfortuantely '<0.8' matches '0.8.0b2', which is what we don't want.
Therefore pinning it to '<=0.7.99' instead.

This matches a corresponding change in openstack/requirements

Fixes: Bug #1153983

Change-Id: Icf680a933c6092cce52706fd9616a0d208164d1e

commit_message:
Add clean.sh

clean.sh gets rid of all residue of running DevStack except installed
packages and pip modules.

And it eradicates rabbitmq-server and ts erlang dependencies as well as
the other RPC backends and databases.

Change-Id: I2b9a251a0a151c012bae85a5a2f9c2f72e7700be

commit_message:
Document the os options config for swift store

Several configuration options were added to the swift store. These
options help python-swiftclient and sometimes glance itself to determine
which swift service to use if multiple services appear in a keystone
catalog. This change adds documentation for the additional options.

Last fix for bug 1037708

Change-Id: Id06d263b73705b06295b730ff68460b22f117e63

attribute during XML deserialising as the diskconfig extension
expects a string (MANUAL or AUTO) not a bool.

Fixes bug 1152439

Change-Id: Id9a5c2559a2891c2a21c437c9a5a534b9885c9bf
'}, {'created': '2013-03-09 06:26:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix OS-DCF:diskconfig XML handling

Removes string to bool conversion for the OS-DCF:diskconfig
attribute during XML deserialising as the diskconfig extension
expects a string (MANUAL or AUTO) not a bool.

Change-Id: Id9a5c2559a2891c2a21c437c9a5a534b9885c9bf
'}]
commit_message:
Fix OS-DCF:diskconfig XML handling

Removes string to bool conversion for the OS-DCF:diskconfig
attribute during XML deserialising as the diskconfig extension
expects a string (MANUAL or AUTO) not a bool.

Fixes bug 1152439

Change-Id: Id9a5c2559a2891c2a21c437c9a5a534b9885c9bf

[{'created': '2013-03-14 15:06:42.000000000', 'message': 'xml_body returns backtrace on XMLSyntaxError

Protected against XMLSyntaxError that can occur in from_xml.  Return
a validation error (400) instead of an internal server error (500).

Change-Id: Ic5160f4f6c810e96b74dbf9563547ac739a54c5e
Fixes: bug #1101043
'}]
commit_message:
xml_body returns backtrace on XMLSyntaxError

Protected against XMLSyntaxError that can occur in from_xml.  Return
a validation error (400) instead of an internal server error (500).

Change-Id: Ic5160f4f6c810e96b74dbf9563547ac739a54c5e
Fixes: bug #1101043

commit_message:
Add RUN_EXERCISES to exercise.sh.

The exercise.sh accepted a SKIP_EXERCISES var for limiting which
exercises run.  Sometimes I only want to run one of this.  This new
variable make that much easier than having to list every other exercise
as one that should be skipped.

Change-Id: I21d3cc6ead677d25f7697c6cc1fd690cbbbfbdd7

I do not see how could I test this easily. It does not change the output for the existing code, since there are no modules (apart from shell.py) printing out any output, but it opens the door for a module to print a debug message without raising an exception (for example a warning message).

The old code was setting the debug level and setting the formatting only on the shell logger only. This changes the level and formatting on the root logger, so that any other module using the logging module can write messages with the configuration that is set up in the shell, that it is not possible right now.

commit_message:
Set up debug level on root logger.

If we set up the debug level on the root logger, this can be used by the
submodules that might need to print some debug output.

Change-Id: I2a00b40d4748cc62e6081df7d6a44622f5ad4467

commit_message:
Fixes bug 1151747: broken XML translation for resource collections

Special-case "links" when converting a collection from JSON to XML and
vice versa.

Change-Id: I7ab1f50c1da3ec389930c1bf45d498551c4cf954

perfect thanks Darrell for the clarification.'}, {'account_id': 995, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:31:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I've heard this has already been talked about but why isn't this combined into the container quota's middleware?  We could rename the container-quota to just quota- it hasn't been put into a major release yet.  They are pretty (very) similar in functionality. seems you could have a single middleware with

[filter:quotas]
use = egg:swift#quotas
restrict_by_container = true
restrict_by_account = true

or something"}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2013-03-08 06:57:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-03-08 07:25:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I'd prefer not to combine them.  They're both quotas, but they're pretty different, one's a user feature and the other's an admin feature.  They're acting on different data.  But I don't feel all that strongly, so whatever."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-03-08 09:07:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

@david The reason it wasn't combined into two is because last time when we discussed about that on #openstack-swift most other people semed to want it separated, see: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/swift/2013/swift.2013-01-23-19.00.log.html"}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2013-03-08 13:32:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2013-03-08 13:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

- remove reseller_request() function, add "reseller_request" into environ in tempauth and keystoneauth (will submit a patch to swauth if successfully merged)

I haven't merged this with container_quotas due to the reasons mentioned by Michael and Chmouel.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-08 14:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me

commit_message:
Account quotas

Add a new middleware implementing account quotas.

This middleware blocks write requests (PUT, POST) if a given quota (in bytes)
is exceeded while DELETE requests are still allowed.

Quotas are stored in the x-account-meta-quota-bytes metadata entry.
Write requests to this metadata setting are only allowed for resellers.

Change-Id: I57fd7c6209f34cc79d4bab72d500d43ba2a62083

commit_message:
Remove gigabytes & volumes in novaclient quota set

Refer to Bug: 1155419
    "gigabytes" and "volumes" should no longer exist in
    quota sets in novaclient since blueprints: https://
    blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/delete-nova-volume.
Remove these 2 items in
    novaclient/v1_1/quota_classes
    novaclient/v1_1/quotas
    and related test cases.

Change-Id: I34acd17acdb1db3f87f59f2ef884a4b7b67251e6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-10 15:22:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes instance task_state being left as migrating

In a cross-hypervisor environment, such as KVM + Hyper-v. After a negative test
which live migrate a KVM instance to Hyper-v host, there well an exception
InvalidHypervisorType. As a result, the instance task_state is being
left as migrating. That leaves the instance in a broken state and most of the
requests on the instance will fail.

Actually, there are some other exceptions will cause this issue as well, such
as UnableToMigrateToSelf, DestinationHypervisorTooOld. All of them are thrown
from the driver of scheduler during live migration. But obviously, if the live
migration fails at the schedule stage, the task_state of the target instance

commit_message:
Fixes instance task_state being left as migrating

In a cross-hypervisor environment, such as KVM + Hyper-v. After negative test
which live migrate a KVM instance to Hyper-v host, there will be an exception
InvalidHypervisorType. As a result, the instance task_state is being
left as migrating. That leaves the instance in a broken state and most of the
requests on the instance will fail.

Actually, there are some other exceptions will cause this issue as well, such
as UnableToMigrateToSelf, DestinationHypervisorTooOld. All of them are thrown
from the driver of scheduler during live migration. But obviously, if the live
migration fails at the schedule stage, the task_state of the target instance
should be updated to None.

Fixes Bug: 1153283

Change-Id: Ide4b48653268c8dbe31de6964814830d2e82a5ba

Fix exception message in Networks API extension

Raise exception indicating VLAN is disabled when
trying to associate a network w/ a tenant in cases where
VLAN is not the network manager
Added unit test case
Fixes bug 1075790

[{'created': '2013-03-06 12:22:02.000000000', 'message': "Enable swift by default.

- Set by default SWIFT_REPLICAS to 1 since this is the most common use
  case when using it in devstack.
- If we have swift_replicas to 1 launch the object container account and
  proxy servers in foreground in screen.
- Allow any s- services if we have just 'swift' in service enabled
  instead of having to specify all s- services to enable swift. This will be
  removed in the future.
- Set object server starting at 6013 instead of 6010 to not conflict
  with remote ssh x11 forwarding.

Change-Id: I890b6953b70283bfa0927fff0cf5e92f3c08455b
"}]
commit_message:
Enable swift by default.

- Set by default SWIFT_REPLICAS to 1 since this is the most common use
  case when using it in devstack.
- If we have swift_replicas to 1 launch the object container account and
  proxy servers in foreground in screen.
- Allow any s- services if we have just 'swift' in service enabled
  instead of having to specify all s- services to enable swift. This will be
  removed in the future.
- Set object server starting at 6013 instead of 6010 to not conflict
  with remote ssh x11 forwarding.

Change-Id: I890b6953b70283bfa0927fff0cf5e92f3c08455b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-13 05:37:08.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate use of fixed_range flag in nova conf

Since a3786b4b8aa47cf19b9dc2babb4df85f578a1280 merged into nova we
now can default to setting fixed_range in nova.conf to "". This will
cause nova to do automatic NAT set up based on the networks
configured rather than relying on the user to set fixed_range to the
largest subnet that includes the networks they've configured.

Leave the stack.sh default value of $FIXED_RANGE alone because it is
used for creating the networks, etc.

Change-Id: Iad13588af3dcf22ce81823de301b73b05cf2aae9
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate use of fixed_range flag in nova conf

Since a3786b4b8aa47cf19b9dc2babb4df85f578a1280 merged into nova we
now can default to setting fixed_range in nova.conf to "". This will
cause nova to do automatic NAT set up based on the networks
configured rather than relying on the user to set fixed_range to the
largest subnet that includes the networks they've configured.

Leave the stack.sh default value of $FIXED_RANGE alone because it is
used for creating the networks, etc.

Change-Id: Iad13588af3dcf22ce81823de301b73b05cf2aae9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-13 21:39:43.000000000', 'message': "Make skip_tracker bug keyword detection more robust.

This commit changes the regex for detecting a bug in
skip_tracker.py to be case insensitive and support a colon
instead of whitespace immediately following the bug keyword.
Previously only Bug or bug was detected, and whitespace needed
to follow the bug keyword for skip_tracker.py to pick up the bug
number correctly. This causes issues with some skips because they
didn't comply with these constraints. This commit fixes these issues
by allow any capitalization of 'bug' and allowing either a colon or
whitespace to immediately follow the bug keyword.

Change-Id: I0e9a073b195d475e0b1eebc76e4db160742e171e
"}, {'created': '2013-03-14 17:02:21.000000000', 'message': "Make skip_tracker bug keyword detection more robust.

This commit changes the regex for detecting a bug in
skip_tracker.py to be case insensitive and support a colon
instead of whitespace immediately following the bug keyword.
Previously only Bug or bug was detected, and whitespace needed
to follow the bug keyword for skip_tracker.py to pick up the bug
number correctly. This causes issues with some skips because they
didn't comply with these constraints. This commit fixes these issues
by allow any capitalization of 'bug' and allowing either a colon or
whitespace to immediately follow the bug keyword.

commit_message:
Make skip_tracker bug keyword detection more robust.

This commit changes the regex for detecting a bug in
skip_tracker.py to be case insensitive and support a colon
instead of whitespace immediately following the bug keyword.
Previously only Bug or bug was detected, and whitespace needed
to follow the bug keyword for skip_tracker.py to pick up the bug
number correctly. This causes issues with some skips because they
didn't comply with these constraints. This commit fixes these issues
by allow any capitalization of 'bug' and allowing either a colon or
whitespace to immediately follow the bug keyword.

Change-Id: I0e9a073b195d475e0b1eebc76e4db160742e171e

commit_message:
Pass-in the initial value when performing a POST on Workflow Action. This fixes the call to self.changed_data, it allows django forms to be able to compare initial value with current value.

Fixes bug 1153697.

Change-Id: I21846487ada34f3b007a545bcdcba400bd044af5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-12 16:56:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes Hyper-V live migration with attached volumes

Fixes bug: 1153429

Hyper-V live migration requires volumes to be available on the the target host
mounted with the same device position, which is not feasible in this
context.

In order to be able to live migrate instances with attached volumes, this fix
provides the following behavior:

pre_live_migration

The target host logs into the storage targets

live_migration

The source host:

1) pauses the instance
2) detaches the volumes
3) live migrates the instance
4) reattaches the volumes in the correct order, using the correct paths
5) resumes the instance

Pausing the instance is necessary to avoid issues in the guest when the
volumes are detached. In case of instances with boot from volume, this is a
very limited amount of time due to the fact that no storage needs to be
migrated.

Unit tests have been added for this scenario.

Change-Id: Ib634b77894f492896d86dce65a7269ece8f3d55b
'}, {'created': '2013-03-12 17:04:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes Hyper-V live migration with attached volumes

live_migration

2) detaches the volumes
3) live migrates the instance
4) reattaches the volumes in the correct order, using the correct paths
5) resumes the instance

Pausing the instance is necessary to avoid issues in the guest when the
volumes are detached. In case of instances with boot from volume, this is a
very limited amount of time due to the fact that no storage needs to be
migrated.

Unit tests have been added for this scenario.

Change-Id: Ib634b77894f492896d86dce65a7269ece8f3d55b
'}, {'created': '2013-03-12 23:55:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes Hyper-V live migration with attached volumes

Fixes bug: 1153429

Hyper-V live migration requires volumes to be available on the target host
mounted with the same device position, which is not feasible in this
context.

In order to be able to live migrate instances with attached volumes, this fix
provides the following behavior:

pre_live_migration

The target host logs into the storage targets.

live_migration

The source host:

1) pauses the instance
2) detaches the volumes
3) live migrates the instance
4) reattaches the volumes in the correct order, using the correct paths
5) resumes the instance

Pausing the instance is necessary to avoid issues in the guest when the
volumes are detached.

In case of instances with boot from volume, volumes are mounted as IDE
disks and cannot be detached from a running instance. To work around this
issue, a shutdown is performed instead of pausing the vm.
The user can control this feature by setting the following option
accordingly: "allow_instance_shutdown_for_live_migration"

Unit tests have been added for this scenario.

Change-Id: Ib634b77894f492896d86dce65a7269ece8f3d55b
'}, {'created': '2013-03-13 21:06:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes Hyper-V live migration with attached volumes

Fixes bug: 1153429

The previous Hyper-V driver live migration implementation expects to find iSCSI
devices mounted on the same path on source and destination, which is not an
option in this context.

In order to be able to live migrate instances with attached volumes, this fix
provides the following behavior, based on the creation of a staged VM on the
target, so called "planned" in the Hyper-V documentation and in this patch.

pre_live_migration

The target host logs into the storage targets.

live_migration

The source host:

1) checks and removes a previously created planned VM for the current
   instance if present on the target
2) creates a planned VM on the target by using the Hyper-V WMI API
3) maps the volume devices on the planned VM based on the target host
   devices
4) live migrates the source VM on the planned VM
5) logs off the storage targets on the source

This solution provides live migration of volumes without needing to pause
the VM and detach / attach the volumes, preserving also the atomicity of the
live operation.

In the case in which no volumes are attached to the VM, live migration is
performed without creating explicitly a planned VM, starting from step 4
on the source in the above list.

Unit tests have been added for this scenario.

Change-Id: Ib634b77894f492896d86dce65a7269ece8f3d55b

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V live migration with attached volumes

Fixes bug: 1153429

The previous Hyper-V driver live migration implementation expects to find iSCSI
devices mounted on the same path on source and destination, which is not an
option in this context.

In order to be able to live migrate instances with attached volumes, this fix
provides the following behavior, based on the creation of a staged VM on the
target, so called "planned" in the Hyper-V documentation and in this patch.

pre_live_migration

The target host logs into the storage targets.

live_migration

The source host:

1) checks and removes a previously created planned VM for the current
   instance if present on the target
2) creates a planned VM on the target by using the Hyper-V WMI API
3) maps the volume devices on the planned VM based on the target host
   devices
4) live migrates the source VM on the planned VM
5) logs off the storage targets on the source

This solution provides live migration of volumes without needing to pause
the VM and detach / attach the volumes, preserving also the atomicity of the
live operation.

In the case in which no volumes are attached to the VM, live migration is
performed without creating explicitly a planned VM, starting from step 4
on the source in the above list.

Unit tests have been added for this scenario.

Change-Id: Ib634b77894f492896d86dce65a7269ece8f3d55b

commit_message:
Fixed local.sh to be able to generate the dburl correctly

Devstack has been refactored so that the function to generate the
db_url no longer takes a local variable to output to, but echoes the
url directly. local.sh has been updated for this.
Fixes bug: 1155432

Change-Id: Ic55889af7d16727a11ea7c3332f15553d89c92fd

still hacking, not yet tested or polished.'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2013-03-14 16:25:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Physical utilization of the block device does not accurately reflect the logical utilization of the file system.

Blocks may have been dirtied that could easily be discarded during a filesystem resize, but without digging into the guts of the filesystem or actually trying the filesystem resize and seeing if it succeeds, we'll never know for sure."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-14 16:49:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Johannes, apparently there is a limitation with the VHDs that they can't shrink beyond their current physical size at the moment. There must be a way to trim it, but it gets messy, and hasn't been implemented yes, I am told.

We could dd the resized filesystem to a new VHD, but I was planning on looking at all that kind of thing next, as part of this https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1155068

The idea of this patch is to stop people loosing their VM by picking the wrong size, even though they have cleared out their disk to an appropriate level for their chosen flavor."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-14 17:33:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
xenapi: ensure vdi is not too big when resizing down

Fixes bug 1155066

When you try to make a cow VHD smaller, you are limited by its
current physical size. Ideally we could look at the actual
logical utilization, but unfortunatly we can't currently
easily shrink the vhd below its current physical size.

This check ensures that when a user chooses to resize thier
instance to a smaller size and it is not possible, their
VM is still running, but will be left in the Error state.

Change-Id: I9cc13f10140bf698241c5fcf008e01a1323fecb9

commit_message:
Update references of "folsom" to "grizzly"

The instructions as provided in the page at
<http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/install/apt/content/osfolubuntu-prerquisite.html>
should pretty much work the same for grizzly as they do for folsom,
assuming that you change the specific names of the repositories
that you're using to suit.

Also note that the name of the file changes from ap_installingfolsom.xml
to ap_installinggrizzly.xml

Change-Id: Idbc7b16a0638b37024a21b3dca39595d164e9dd3

commit_message:
Add vmware support to baremetal virtualpowerdriver

This patch adds vmware worstation to the supported host types.
Included in this patch is an example of VPD using Windows as the host.
{_BaseCmd_} is added to as a new swap tag to support running
of commands not provided by the host provider applacation.

Adds config options:
virtual_power_base_cmd_location: Change the base_cmd location
virtual_power_vmware_ws_guest_path: path to vmware guest profiles directory
virtual_power_win_nohup: external program to allow process detachment in
			 Windows.

Note: the windows example includes some helper functions as stock
Windows has very little command line support. It should also be
noted that Windows will also requires a thrid party ssh server,
in testing BitVise SSH Server was used.

Change-Id: I002a2dda7d38c008df4bc9054dfe482abad33561
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add quotas for fixed ips.

DocImpact: there is now a default quota of 10 fixed ips per tenant.
This will need to be adjusted by deployers if that number does not
meet their needs.

Resolves bug 1125468.

Change-Id: Iffa19583340f80cb2a13ba5fce31f7ff724a52d6

commit_message:
Doc info and other readability improvements

A few good suggestions were made on the final round of reviews
on the previous patch to add v3 token support, but were not
implemented. This patch applies these, which should not create
any functional change.

Fixes Bug #1154768

Change-Id: Ie5408a5477d176bd28b2c385e49cd29b39c0de39

commit_message:
Switch to final 1.1.0 oslo.config release

Fixes bug #1128256

oslo.config has now been released to PyPI in time for Grizzly RC1 so
we can switch to using it directly.

Change-Id: I655f831718ae5f4e25e941ee206fe195214a9a91

update v3 domains - remove public/private namespace

commit_message:
Retry http_request and json_request failure.

Temporary network outages or keystone server restarts can lead
to a connection refused in auth_token middleware. Rather than
failing immediately, this patch attempts to retry a few times.

Fixes bug 1150299

Change-Id: I2ecf0d7745290976efcb3e3cd6511817a53d3e0a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-13 14:57:10.000000000', 'message': 'Export compression and multitier capabilities.

Compression and tiering support were not exported as capabilities,
and are important features.

Definitions:

Tiering: The storage device has multiple classes of media. Data can
be placed on the media automatically according to workload or other
considerations, or manually (for example, by setting additional
key-values in the volume type).

Compression: Data is compressed automatically by the storage when
written, and decompressed automatically when read.

Change-Id: I41c304d0da89a050c0345b930b3f45741214b425
Fixes: bug 1146341
'}, {'created': '2013-03-13 15:18:54.000000000', 'message': 'Export compression and multitier capabilities.

and are important features.

written, and decompressed automatically when read.

Fixes: bug 1146341

commit_message:
Compression/tier capabilities for Storwize/SVC.

Compression and tiering support were not exported as capabilities,
and are important features.

Also fix a couple bugs introduced by
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/23830/

Change-Id: I41c304d0da89a050c0345b930b3f45741214b425
Fixes: bug 1146341
Fixed: bug 1155071
